zD0HKxyXRpQnsDKnznTxpA.text: Pretty decent food, good drinks, good breakfast. Solid service. If only they would improve their coffee...

o5TAjFoCG1Nq3IJU8JWhAQ.text: We ate here for the first time the other day and thought it was incredible. Had seared tuna salad. Wow! We had bloody Mary's. Wow! The spicy burger and macaroni and cheese. Every single thing we had was excellent and we will be coming back here for sure. We recommend this place to everybody!! They pretty much have anything and everything a person would want.and take their food service and drinks very seriously. Incredibly great price to.

K1UqwacWuRxUpA6sMMw-7g.text: Long time customers so we ordered breakfast last Sunday morning: rancid coffee, uht half and half curdled, eggs and bacon incorrectly prepared despite instructions, cold food, english muffin sliced awkwardly and untoasted.    Will not be returning.

EJ8Jt9jrPbdLgQmyASn2hA.text: I've been meaning to come back to this place for a while now after discovering it through a Yelp Elite event some time ago.  I finally had the time, so I jetted down to the restaurant and I had a really good time.  The service here was great.  I was greeted and seated immediately, and decided that lunch was the way to go for me.  I like the fact that they serve breakfast here until 2PM, because sometimes I DO want breakfast at noon!  They also have happy hour daily from 3-7 which is awesome as well.  No need to rush after work.  Just do happy hour on a Saturday!  Anyways, I went with the burger, and surprisingly, they have a variety of sides to choose from.  I "like" french fries, but am always looking for something more at times.  Sometimes I want a salad instead, or soup, and BLD gives you that choice.  Instead of fries, they have 4 or 5 choices to go with.  I went with hummus.  It was delicious!  Nice change of pace from fries.  Anyways, its a bit of a drive, but a nice alternative from the ordinary.  Lovely decor, spacey with lots of good food to choose from.   I will be back!

UTYVxYSSz9kSFXdbQTwvlA.text: So I came here for my grandmother's birthday with all of my family and we had a few disappointing meals: their turkey sausage looked like it came out of a tub with dehydrated peppers and some other "items" that honestly looked nothing like what should be on a plate, it looked worse than what I feed my 5' black and white argentine tegu... And that's saying something. The watermelon was absolutely rancid, it smelt nasty and tasted foul. The early bird hash was absolutely disgusting. It was inedible with some cheese byproduct that destroyed the meal. The over-medium eggs were super running past the point of over-easy. Only thing that was good was the eggs Benedict that my grandmother got (thank goodness since it was her birthday breakfast). But I don't think we'll be coming back. Pretty disappointed in the meals.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Their &#34;turkey sausage&#34;

moaQcZxofoai7gRIj1l6ww.text: Really good Mac n cheese with bacon prosciutto Brie and havarti!! Very good. It's a thin saucy type of cheese. Not a thick cheesy Mac n cheese. The polenta with braised short ribs was very good too. Lots of good options. Nice modern restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese

cajOTNhlfFBXYzPNSRORoA.text: Delicious breakfast dishes!  This place is clean, good service and yummy food. We have been three different times, even brought out of town family that loved it, we really like it and I consider our family "particular" .

5j0hZ7rDwuqXZyWgYpyBhA.text: Ok so I wasn't going to post this in yelp but I tried emailing the managers/owners privately and have yet to get a response.. ok so DONT eat here!!!!! My wife and I go here often until last Wednesday. I got my usual bld burrito and was packing up my left overs when I started to pour my sauce on my burrito there was a sucked/chewed on mint in my sauce! Seriously like the prep cook lost the mint while making the sauce and couldnt find it so just kept on making the sauce! Well it was in my food.. I was in shock that this was actually happening so we brought it to the bartenders attention and all he did was make jokes about it.. then he comped my meal and made us pay the rest of the bill... I couldn't believe what was going on. I was so unbelievably grossed out because this was pretty much somebody spitting in my food. I couldn't believe this was how this situation was handled.. no manager came over nothing! As soon as I walked out of their doors I began to throw up from being so grossed out. Later that day I tried to email the owners/managers and days later I have yet to hear one single word from anybody! Which is even worse for being a privately owned establishment you would think that somebody would respond.. I will never return to this establishment again and i will most likely be contacting the Heath department about this.. it is SO GROSS and unsanitary of a place!

8fzpOqaduQdT7wE9_uAfAQ.text: Solid 4/5 stars, I've had some great meals here with my family, we enjoy the atmosphere and breakfast is always great.

f5iFojgmwwi6dsZjpUqBnA.text: The girlfriend and I went here for brunch.  She had the omelet and customized it while I had steak burrito.   Both were good and the service was decent.   The sweet potato fries were amazing.   I would say they were the best part of my meal.   For dessert we went with the "good stuff" which was good.

3EUsKzPHTXHlFRub7zmkYA.text: Well I've been craving breakfast for the last few days and decided on my way from school I'd have a cheat day. Found BLD on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try. I had the tostada and I got the breakfast burrito for my bf to go. Both were very very filling and delicious. I probably are too much to be honest, but I couldn't stop haha. The girl who took my order at the window was very friendly and for getting it to go it wasn't a long wait at all. I also got the BLD iced coffee which was yummie and refreshing. I definitely want to go back and try other things on their menu. Maybe my next cheat day I'll head out there haha.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito &amp; the tostada

_XpqtoyAnBAy6AG2rIFnSA.text: I sat at the bar on a semi-slow night and my boyfriend and I had the attention of the bartender and manger. Suggesting American spirits and samples. Had a fantastic time and will be back soon. Ps the rib and polenta was fantastic and filling.

HnvR3dO4I2u1oodPPWjwxg.text: This place is definitely deserving of its 3 stars. It's a boring place that does nothing exceptional other than be average. Hence the reviews.  The food is decent and the happy hour is pretty fairly priced.  We had the Tacos, Short Ribs and Polenta and the Ahi tuna.  The short ribs had to be sent back they were so bad. The server said "ok let me see if he will take them off, I'm not sure that he will". Who says that??? Of course he will take them off, it's a $7 item and it's called customer service!  The racks were excellent.  The Ahi was overseasones and fairly decent. What try served it with made no sense from a culinary standpoint.  All in all, the chef at this place is confused but he's trying.  3 solid stars. Would we try it again? Probably not.

3s-5FYeUgnPm6YixhVUNLw.text: Great food! Big portions, super tasty. Service was ok, not enough smiles and friendly people to greet you or serve. The food was just a tad on the over cooked side, but good nonetheless.

DZNsgZJeyKMHWf43eEKOZQ.text: I have had breakfast several times lately.  Great food and interesting specials each time.  Great neighborhood place.

hoASPCIa7x3Tb7dvytDrJQ.text: I tried this place after meeting one of the bartenders (Bill) at the bank.  I really wanted to love this place but I found that I only like it a little upon first visit.  They do have some local beers but no porters or stouts :(  For lunch I ordered the green chili pork tostada.  Overall an okay flavor but the salsa drowned out the flavors of the pork and the black beans.  A little less sauce might have created the balance I was looking for in this dish to make it lovable.  Still looking for something to love I ordered the chocolate pudding cake.  My first few bites really excited me:  the flavors well balanced and none overpowering the rest.  Then I hit the portion of the cake that was burned.    Overall this establishment shows a lot of promise.  I look forward to trying other options here.

1SqagkTOwpW-H_86qCewfA.text: Saw this place on Check Please Arizona so the wife and I decided to try it out for dinner on a Friday. We didn't quite know what to make of it walking in. It had an odd sports bar, family dining, casual upscale feel to it. Sounds strange I know but I don't know how else to describe it. We were seated right away though and the staff was friendly, the service timely, and the food outstanding! I had the Rigatoni Con Carne and my wife had the meatloaf. I'd probably wash dishes for a week to get the recipe for mine and the meatloaf was just about as good based on the one taste I had and what my wife had to say about it after (I know right ... meatloaf?!). Can't speak to any of the negative reviews but as for my wife and I, we'll definitely be visiting them again.

263dJOG2mBEkVFA2mSLsqw.text: Had a great lunch.  I had the smoked turkey croissant.  The meat was good, the sauce was fantastic, and the fresh sprouts, avocado, tomato was excellent, bacon was tasty.  Only critique would be was that the croissant was a little dry.  I had the potato salad for the side, and it was ABSOLUTELY EXCELLENT.  It was very flavorful, rife with fresh mustard seed and the potatoes were prepared perfectly.  My wife had the Grilled Chicken Club.  It was a whole breast of chicken, with bacon, lettuce, tomato, dijonaise on Sourdough, and she found it to be excellent.  She had the onion rings, which she was not so fond of, but the kids absolutely loved them.  They appeared to be beer-battered and quite fresh.  Service was a little slow--I would've expected the lunch to be a little quicker on the waiter service.  I didn't mind the wait for the food, but the wait for my check was kind of annoying.  Overall, I had a fantastic lunchtime meal here.  Value for the money was perfect.  It's really difficult to find an excellent deli style sandwich in Metro Phoenix, but I've finally found at least one spot!

6uxUnNEypU0ZuVmXT0GOuA.text: They were able to accommodate my big group without problem (25 people). There was a minor issue while taking our order, but Bridgette, our server, was able to correct the issue and go above and beyond our expectation. The food was delicious as always. I will come again and would not hesitate to recommend bringing a big group in.

QWTQ0zqIUgXblt1Ii9H3mQ.text: Been here before, and the food wasn't bad til today. My chicken fried steak was burnt, and so was my sisters. What topped it off today was my brother found an ant in his potatoes. We told a waitress name Bridget (wasn't our waitress but she was the first one we saw), and this is what she had to say, "Unfortunately there is so many bugs in this world, and one happen to land in your potatoes." It was an ant, not a bug that "landed" in his potatoes. We weren't expecting that type of response. Anyway, needless to say we won't be back. The food today was burnt, and had a bug in it. The service today by Linda was good. She was nice, and very apologetic.  Bridget, and the girl the brought out the food on the other hand may need a little more training on customer service.

yInsZGH8HO4Y1RMg8-5qyg.text: This is my one of my favorite breakfast/brunch places. The portions are reasonable, and the inside setting is really nice for breakfast! Sometimes the food can be bland but they're still really filling.

QnHRAL45LDFripCOQl-Rbw.text: Write more beat salad, green tea, chicken and waffle

begqMjbqJiJ_vuSb0S0mbg.text: I've been to BLD for all three meals and am a fan.  Lately it's been more of the B, but still a fan of all three.  For breakfast I am a huge fan of their huevos rancheros.  It comes with a bean and cheese quesadilla that is oh so delicious!  I like to add on their green chili pork, which definitely adds to the dish and they certainly don't skimp on adding it on!  My boyfriend is a huge fan of their breakfast burrito.  He says it's hands down one of the best breakfast burritos he's ever had.  I don't come too often for lunch since I'm not often in the area at that time, but I do love their onion rings.  They are huge and super yummy with a little hint of sweetness.  For dinner I've had a few of their dishes.  Their menu changes from time to time, which is nice, but at the same time can be a little sad to see some of your favorite dishes disappear.  Lately I've been a fan of the chicken fried steak.  You get the crunch on the outside, but it was still really juicy on the inside and had a great flavor.   The only reason for the 4 stars instead of the 5 is because I don't feel like every dish I've had has been a total winner.  I've had a few that I've just found okay, but nothing that has been terrible.  However, when they do hit the mark (at least for me) with a dish, it's just phenomenal and you can't help but to just enjoy every bite you take.

A0-XAppgyTzdCH2eJNniFw.text: Went here with some friends for take-out breakfast who said it was amazing. For the price and the hype, I was expecting an outstanding, fluffy, and detectable omelet with some great tasting potatoes on the side. Instead, I got an omelet that was smaller than the what I make at home, bland, and lukewarm. The potatoes -the ones I could eat, anyway- were downright cold. Most of them were so burnt and hard, I couldn't even eat them. There was no seasoning on anything. I only gave them 2 stars because I'm taking into account we drove to another location to eat, and possibly the food wasn't as cold when they handed it to us as when we got home. Considering we had to wait for them to get our food ready-I can say for sure the temperature wasn't because the food was ready and we were late getting there to pick it up.  However, I've eaten a lot of take out in my life and I've never had food quite that cold before. Though the atmosphere inside looked fun and inviting,  I don't think I'll be back.

lExuX_WqrnZzp1YRPIDBuA.text: Had an urge to go to our favorite spot today, but we're breakfast people and love finding new places, so we ended up at BLD. Waited about 5 minutes for a table, friendly waitress,  busy at 10:30. I asked for a menu to look at while we waited, YIKES!!! The prices were expensive, I asked my BF if he wanted to stay, we still had time to sneak out before they called our name but as soon as he was about to speak our table was ready. We couldn't back out now... still scouting out the overly priced menu after being seated, I finally decided on The Breakfast Burrito. Even our waiter recommended it, said it was his favorite out of everything on the menu. My BF ordered a simple stack of pancakes. We were sitting and talking, and we were in the booth that had the lovely kitchen view. I was watching all the food coming out, it all was coming out decently fast and I happened to see a burrito and a plate of pancakes pop on the line. Now, I kept an eye on it. I don't care for cold food, no one does. It's just sitting there. It then gets picked up and put on the serving line. It just sits there. I seen our waiter, oh yes! He's getting our food, wait, no... someone else's order he is delivering. A young boy then picks up what seems to be our order but follows our waiter, that was someone else's order, whew!, no cold food. But wait, I kept my eye on him, that was our order he carried across the restaurant, turned back around and proceeded back to us. Man... oh well, someone had to be at work so we just started eating. Mine was warm, was expecting hot, the pancakes were decently hot. A scant side of butter and syrup was served for the size of these mediocre pancakes. A side of green salsa was served with the burrito. As I ate, the first few bites were delicious but as I continued eating I felt like I was eating a greasy meal the more I consumed, I think it was the meat, and the amount of cheese, there was a lot of both but I didn't want to waste it for the price it was costing. It was good but not great, the potatoes were the best part. As I said above, the pancakes were mediocre. For how expensive this place is for breakfast, I don't think we'll be back. I'm still debating if it was worth the stop. When you have a feeling to go to your normal breakfast spot but also want to try something new, I'd go with your first choice.

3rzVVeuD-ycH5AnD9lCp9w.text: Wonderful and fabulous! Love this place!  The food is great!  The steak tacos are the terrific. Bridgette is the best!  I will come here every chance I can get.

GWNmpP98k9GZwH1X0_kO6w.text: I'm having an internal debate over my review.  Did I like it 3 stars or 4 stars?  I can't make up my mind.  I have been here twice.  I agree with other posters that it's refreshing to have new places (non-chains) in Chandler.  So I give it props for that.  The staff is super friendly, awesome really.  I went in there with the kids, and they were great with kids too.  The place is open, clean, big tables and a nice "bar" table.  Trendy, good.  Our food the first day was pretty good, I think my chicken sandwich was the only not-so-exciting dish, but my husband liked his, and so did my kids and friend.  And the portions were pretty big.  The green pork chili is gigantic.   And then 2 days later I went there for breakfast by myself.  Ah, an escapade from work and family.  Again, I love the actual place, it was so bright in there.  But that day the service was not quite as awesome...the waitress kept helping the table behind me (friends I think) and ignoring me, so eventually I had to stuff my face to be able to eat and make it to work on time.  I got the spaniard omelette.  Ok, I'm biased here...since I'm spaniard.  So this may come accross as a snooty review...but cilantro!!!  That's one herb that's not used in spanish food at all.  You got it wrong, chef. It should be parsley, sorry.  Actually, the parsley would have given flavor to the omelette, which was just blah.  Eggs and cheese.  Yes, the cheese was manchego and therefore flavorful.  Also, the saugage in the omelette is portuguese...not spaniard!  Sorry, picky, I know.  But there's wonderful spanish chorizo available out there, that adds incredible paprika flavor to eggs (I make this a lot), so please find some!   Oh, yeah, and my coffee didn't get refilled when the mug went empty...what gives???

CT75F8DoJ0o8_YMfonmoEw.text: Brunch was GREAT!  They got all the bugs out and now its running SMOOTH!  Food is great as well as the service!

iGBnpAM4Pm3wck5BF4i4Gg.text: Been there twice (so far) first for breakfast then again a few days later for dinner.  To me the prices seemed really good for the quality of food I asked and they use fresh and local products suppliers and you can taste that difference.  Loved the bfast burrito with short ribs for the meat and fam loved the fried chix and waffles!  Dinner was equally good loved the pork and polenta with cheese fam liked all they had.  Service was prompt cheerful and professional.  Recommend them and definately be back.

DNNQY3MTL4LaeyQJHsF_oA.text: There is nothing like a Bloody Mary and a great breakfast on a Sunday at BLD's.... The beer selection isn't half bad either. Well worth the wait for a great breakfast!

fzUHXwRmLztmb5_7KTJq7Q.text: Upon arrival, we were immediately seated and greeted by the hostess. But unlike the friendliness of the hostess our server was very rude. She walked up to the table and said , I quote, "What do you wanna drink" no greeting what so ever, didn't tell us her name or  asked us how we were, just what do you want. After receiving our waters she said "Are you ready?" And its not what you say sometimes but the tone you say it in, and it wasn't a very friendly tone. I ended up getting a burger and asked for medium rare, and repeated again that I wanted a little pink and a refill on my water. When I received the burger it was definitely well done, and i had also spilled my ranch. So I sat there and waited for the server for a little while, I wanted to ask to get my burger redone and for some more napkins to clean the mess but she never came by. So after a while of waiting and my Friend being half way done with his food, I decided to eat some of it . I Only ate Half of my burger because it just wasn't that good and cold by then because I had waited so long trying to get my waitresses attention. And to top it all off i still had no water! I had to drink from a warm water bottle in my purse. So I ended up sitting next to spilled ranch, having no water, a wrong made burger, plus no customer service for my whole first experience at BLD.              I'm writing this email in hopes that there is change in the way things are done in your restaurant in the future. I was very excited to eat at your establishment for my birthday lunch and my whole visit was a disappointment and regret. Worst Birthday lunch ever. After all of this, i wrote to the manager and never even heard a response.

QifmxT7Z7KoN8JJVWQZEHA.text: Food was allright but not sure of it was worth the price. The service was pore. Don't see any reason to ever return.

SatCfPPV8Dg8L4vi_aSC7g.text: Place clean and sharp looking, staff friendly, Food above average. The pastrami sandwich and hamburger OK, but nothing really that screams signature dishes or staple to this place. Food like this can be found any where with the same menu. But if you live near by, yes a great place to eat. But if you live far, not worth the trip or gas.

Q6E60A4Sse0R04cqDeJQAA.text: Ugh! Sat outside forever, no one ever came by. got up and left, went to Nando's.

JZv6vzf79IiO2vGXLhoAHA.text: Great brunch, Bill is probably the best bartender in the area.  How he remembers everyone's drink preferences between visits is amazing

wCE21sylsArS4bZLdDghaw.text: We frequent BLD mainly for breakfast but will occasionally go for dinner too.  Honestly, the service is inconsistent - poor!  Today my husband and I went for breakfast, our waiter hardly took the time to listen to our order, brought me the wrong late twice (pumpkin spice late came as chi - gross! where was the espresso?) finally I said I would like a cup of just plain coffee.  My husband got his eggs benedict and enjoyed them, I had a waffle but unfortunately I had to ask for butter and syrup because they brought it plain - really?  My coffee finally came when our food arrived, my waffle got cold as we had to wait a while for the butter and syrup.  Topper of this, the waiter never came to check how the food was or if we wanted anything else, left the bill and made a point to show us by circling the "credit" that was given for the late!  Great, we didn't pay for what wasn't made right and we didn't consume but then charged us for the cup of coffee that came late?  Disappointing!  BLD can be good but the lack of consistency with their food and service is less than desirable.  We will not be going back for a while

RyKQ8Twjzg8h-KepIz-1Yw.text: Great food, good happy hour 3-6pm every day.

_DuwuxZKkpbKtn96mFP1Lw.text: My family and I tried this for the first time about a week ago. The food was unique, and very good for adults, but my kids freaked out about it. They had very unique draft beers and unusual drink choices.  It was a little Spendey, but we really enjoyed the change.  Great happy hour prices and happy hour every day of the week.

buAdVGbaZ7s9OXzNbw1IsQ.text: Best breakfast around! Never had lunch or dinner here, but I've tried many different things on the breakfast menu and have never been disappointed. The food taste great, and they have a full bar. I love that dogs are welcome too!

efHC7WaxuFiwWdyjEYjBOg.text: Came here to build my own omelette. Was thinking Greek style; turkey, spinach, feta, tomatoes and black olives. Well they don't have black olives and when I asked, the server was shocked that I asked. He said, "No, we don't. I've worked here for two years and no one has ever asked for black olives." Well call me crazy then, I guess. I didn't see anything that looked so great, maybe it is. I don't know. Looked overpriced and basic. Based on the attitude of service, I didn't eat here and will not return. No thanks, there's plenty of other restaurants to go to..

HXAOH0BTZQnKJt7da7NedA.text: We called ahead to see if there was a wait, and they said no and if there would be it would be 10 minutes. We got there and waited 25 minutes to be seated at a table that was open and cleaned since the moment we walked into the door. So I am not sure what took so long to seat us. But the food and service was good other than that.

MJE7LAL7qw7nGid7dVIV6A.text: Micah was THE MAN! We celebrated my mom's birthday at BLD and the food was great, no wait even on a Friday night, and Micah's service was incredible. He was just the right amount of attentive and even mentioned the military discount and thanked my dad for his service. Great place with an extensive menu!

ue9o8tWIcv4mgBY2f0n1Sw.text: Great service! The bar was a bit backed up so several drinks were delayed, which the server gave to us for free. The breakfast was amazing, including the Fireman's burrito and breakfast quesadilla. Great atmosphere as well. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

I6MrkWkxzBltio4tO7SgkQ.text: Diann is a great waitress she remembers what we normally eat for breakfast and give us special treatment for breakfast! She has a great sense of humor! I highly recommend BLD as the food is consistent and service good!

0UNjEtTH808h5zNe5bEGRQ.text: Great atmosphere. Very clean. Three of us all had something different and they were all great! I had the vanilla waffles with chicken and scrambled eggs. Very good! If you like spice, the Hatch Hash is wonderful!

7dF1Hw6Dgcw7XYxCs4v29Q.text: Decided to head here because we wanted breakfast for dinner. I got the biscuits and gravy. Husband got the chicken and waffles. Both were just okay.  The biscuits were huge, but had a sweet undertone.  Hubby's waffle and eggs were over cooked and dry.   My Bloody Mary was good.  Maybe it was an off night or maybe we should go in the morning for breakfast.

Rjg9FDQ1GnX5DQrQ_VtC2w.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places. Guaranteed good service and awesome food! I had the biscuits and gravy and it came with two eggs, bacon and country potatoes. It was awesome! Definitely recommend!

vm4knurMsXrFtQMGUjE0VA.text: The wait staff and bartendes are fantastic. The food is great as well, they are on top of their game. However I fell that the price for a side of bacon is a bit much... I mean $4.25 for a side of bacon could be a little high. Not trying to complain just hoping to make a suggestion of dropping the price for a side of bacon.

7M8eSETmmgjGm5yXvoyx4w.text: We had a great experience at BLD! I came here with a couple of friends and our sons while the dads at and daughters were at the Tarwater Daddy daughter dance. We were lucky enough to have Micah as our server. He was so attentive and made sure we had everything we needed, even before we knew we needed it! The food at was amazing and the service was even better!! We will be back!!

8xEwp8Ly6_7ROVkqbgueGA.text: BLD is definitely one of our go to spots for post night shift breakfast and beer. They always have a solid selection of draft beers on tap - Deschutes freshly squeezed IPA? Yes please! This review is for breakfast only as I've never been here for lunch or dinner. Their BLD breakfast burrito is my absolute favorite thing on the entire menu. At $13 a pop it might seem a little pricey for a breakfast burrito, but you're easily getting two meals worth of premium ingredients - this things is HUMONGOUS. It's easily 50% super tender and delicious short rib, finished off with eggs, potatoes, roasted red peppers, avocado and pepper jack. The green salsa that is comes with is fresh and delicious, albeit a bit mild. I wish it had a little more of a kick to it, though there is Cholula readily available on the table to customize your spice level. The buttermilk fried chicken and waffles are also really good, as is the green chili pork tostada. Service is always pretty hit or miss, but generally pretty efficient. We did sit on the patio once and asked if the heaters could be turned on, and neither of the people working at the time knew how to work them. Oh well, their patio is also dog friendly, and last time I brought my lab puppy the server was nice enough to bring him some water and a treat! He was over the moon. My only request would be to bring back the morning happy hour specials!

-CYSeULXawLyfdfXrmzOjQ.text: Placed an order online at 8:00 pm and paid for it online, my husband went to pick it up and said they were closed. I looked up the restaurant again and it says it closes at 9:00 pm. So I called and a guy answered, I said I placed an order online and paid for it, he put the phone down and I could hear him, another guy and two girls in the background laughing because he didn't say anything to the lady on the phone, a few minutes later, after listening to all their conversations, a guy realized the phone was not hung up and someone was still on there.....he made some screeching noises then hung up. My husband knocked on the door for about 5 minutes, even though the two girls at the bar kept turning and looking at him, finally a guy opened the door and started to go through his wallet and handed my husband a card that a manager would give to an employee for doing a good job. He told my husband this was for a free meal. Needless to say, we will not be going back to this establishment ever again and most definitely are filing a complaint and fraud charges with our bank for them charging my card and not refunding it since they did not do our order.

Ua7Odxbc2dVvLCnUpMx3aQ.text: The food is amazing & lots of it. Our waiter Kevin was the bomb!  Very fun, very informative & very attentive!!  We will definitely go back

RWz6MErMZaxwk9tYrhYYUA.text: Best chicken & waffles I've ever had. Delicious breakfast for a hearty appetite. If you walk out hungry after eating this you have a tape worm. The Pig omelet is also a winner. Usually I would say it seems a bit excessive but they manage to load it with meat n cheese and still make it taste good. A friend got the "Hash of the Dog" and I think there was 3lbs of food on his plate. There's still 3 or 4 other things I wanna try on the breakfast menu. I haven't even tried lunch or dinner... I'm a fan! P.S. If you call ahead for take out they have a drive thru. How friggin cool is that?!

iN15Xa5v9T2qXq5PQXMevA.text: Great Way to start a Saturday morning! Even let us in early to watch soccer! Excellent drink and food specials!

NOBhTuoXYT8khxXAGkK23Q.text: I love BLD and is one of my favorite spots for Brunch/Lunch. They have a wide variety of items everything from breakfast items to BBQ all served anytime of the day. Service is usually on point, drink menu is also good with a wide variety of drinks and craft beers. To be honest I really never had anything bad over here. Breakfast omlettes are huge, Tacos are great, Burgers are massive, and smoked BBQ items are very good with a ton of different BBQ sauces to choose from.

_rwbcmZTH8N_KASFGA98cg.text: The worst customer service! Our server (lady mid 30s with long black hair) took 15 minutes to even come over to our table and greet us! By the time she came over we already knew what we wanted to order, but she didnt take it down and told us she'd be right back. Another 10 mins pass by & we see her taking another table's orders when we got there before they did! A total of 25 minutes being seated still NO drinks served or orders taken. Needless to say, family and I walked out of there!

BJCOBK29dufI29Akrwu8DA.text: I tried this place out yesterday for breakfast. Everything was excellent. I ordered the California eggs Benedict which is the poached egg on top of bacon and tomato slices served with avocado. The Hollandaise was delicious and the hash browns were cooked just right.   I will definitely be coming back here to try the BBQ. The service was attentive and efficient.

TgomnX36le0LrnqZ1CaNbg.text: The best part of our breakfast dining experience was our server. He was very friendly and attentive. The quality and food portions do not match the prices. The Hawaiian french toast was good, but not great and not very warm. The scrambled eggs were requested extra dry, and they weren't, and the avocado served with it was almost ripe, but still rubbery. The tomatoes were delicious. Yes, we could have sent the food back, but we were starving and had an appointment to make, so we ate what we had. I was very disappointed in the $6.50 regular-sized coffee cup of pumpkin chai latte. It didn't zap my tastebuds with pumpkin spice flavor, so IMO, not worth the cost. I would say BLD is ok, but probably not some place I would return to in the near future for breakfast.

q8gHfv0AUfryLpLuCODaug.text: First time eating here and tried two different smoothies both were gross and tart.. wouldn't recommend. The eggs & potatoes were good but the chorizo was gross and unappetizing. Definitely will not be returning in the future.

4NNzezusEXZkK0r0GsJE2Q.text: The atmosphere in the entire establishment was outstanding. I was consistently approached and offered help at my table, never wanting for anything in terms of service. My server, Abby,  made sure my drink was full and made several recommendations about the food. I was made aware of the daily specials and unique barista style drinks they offer. She explained the menu and specifics of each dish I had questions about. The prompt and courteous service will certainly bring me back again for many meals to come. Kudos on outstanding professionalism and friendly demeanor, Abby!!

68XUZfWGPZEBwocH4PyqKg.text: Was here last week for the Yelp Breakfast Club UYE.  Even though we were potentially a large group we were seated quickly and had good service throughout the meal.  My breakfast meatloaf hash ( a chunk of meatloaf on a bed of onions, mushrooms, cheese, potatoes and eggs with the whole thing smothered in brown gravy)  was not only good but the serving was huge.  Everybody else in the group had good things to say about their choices.  Splitting checks was not a problem for them.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Breakfast meatloaf hash.

L3WAruwKS-2zSt4wsLaeWg.text: Great brunch spot for food! Service was just okay. The hostesses at the front are not welcoming and very standoffish. But the food and coffee are great!  Love the Cali Benedict! And the breakfast potatoes are amazing. Cooked perfectly every time I come here!

1NnoYQBBnV3A0wzAhQHX1g.text: 1st time was great...but 2nd visit losses stars. -1 star:my food was cold & they scrapped the bottom of the grill for my potatoes. Nothing but burned pieces  -1 star: when I addressed the waitress, she said sorry but did not offer anything else. Reheat my food, new set of potatoes,  discount on bill.....nothing!!  Sorry buy off my list now

Qv-etzjRROB1C_Ci0iAXLQ.text: Overall okay experience, I ordered the Strawberry and Prosciutto Salad.  It was good, but nothing special and definitely not worth $13.  Once the waitress brought the salad I noticed there were no strawberries but pineapple instead.  The waitress didn't even mention it, but once I asked where were the strawberries she said "oh we are out of strawberries so we use pineapple now."  Hmm okay then.  My coworker got the BLD burger and it looked okay, but was a sloppy gooey mess to handle.    Service was slow for a non-crowded time and waitress never brought extra dressing for salad but still charged me for it.  I would probably go back for happy hour or on the weekend for brunch, but experience was very forgettable and overpriced for the quality.

6C-eyGeWecJLpr7ttXc2iw.text: Worst service I've ever experienced. Don't know about the food, never received it. We got kicked out for grabbing our own drinks.

JJHNVB-yL0f8Ao1R43JgJg.text: BLD was no great shakes. Everything was so so not good not bad.  May be a little pricey for dinner with smallest portions of the main entree. Probably will try one time for breakfast. Won't be back for dinner.  Great service.

mTiHJZatA_85IRySmnbF_A.text: Just as AZ has allot of one season (summer) BLD also too has allot of one seasoning salt.   The unanimous talk after the meal was about the the heavy handed slating of many of the dishes people ordered. Yes I hang with foodie friends and we discuss meals in great depth.   We were here for a friends Birthday Party, while advanced reservations were not possible, we lucked out and sat 15+ around a giant high top table that dominates on section of the dining space. There are also booths normal tables a patio and a bar.  At the bar you will find a decent selection of local beers, from san tan, four peaks and even sleepy dog. They also offer larger 20oz glasses. There was a decent looking happy hr menu I would give a try.  I was not too hungry and oped just for the seared Ahi app $9. It came with some green but flavorless hummus and equally bland chips, the two things here that lacked salt. The Ahi was of decent quality and the searing was good, the middle did seemed a bit more cooked that I expected and yes there was an excess of salt. This also came with a dollop of cucumber red onion salad. Over all it was decent, nothing special.  I did sample some of my friends items, the onion rings side was good, but do I need gourmet onion rings, The mac and cheese was nothing special either.  If you are in the mood for comfort food in a fancy setting and don't mind the brineyness of old pirate you may like this place.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

UZGhhNUCbjllU5cDm1rAIg.text: Burgers are ok, when and if cooked properly.   Everything else is beyond salty. I've tried six times in the last three months, and now i officially don't eat here anymore. The food was amazing a year ago.

RzSYK3O18WpY6KIbKKQQ7g.text: Honestly, I don't know how this place doesn't have a better rating. As a bartender and manager myself, I am pretty judgmental about my service. Today was memorial day. One of the busier lunch shifts in a restaurant. Everyone has it off and is usually hung over. I sat at the bar by myself and was immediately acknowledged. The bartender, I don't know her name, was quick on her feet and great with all of the customers. Phenomenal personality, well attentive, and I loved the fact that she took care of the customers for the "slow service". Even though it wasn't slow for mw. Food is always great there. The atmosphere is nice and welcoming. The service is was does it for me though. Good job whoever you are. I'd hire you in a second!!!

6tLj9B6dD4CrHknQloXqZA.text: This place for me is a love hate relationship. Food is amazing! I've been here several times and I always love my dish. Burger is delicious and huge! Salads are amazing! Even my child's captain crunch nuggets are great!  My hate relationship is the service. My waitress is extremely nice but not good at customer service. First time she messed up my order & I had to wait 10 mins to let her know it's not what I order. She apologized then rushed a new order, which later came out burnt! I couldn't eat it. Everyone at my table agreed it was burnt. I would had told her it was burnt but she never came back to check on us. I tried my friends others dishes and they were good!   Last weekend I actually went again. Same waitress btw. My salad was wrong which she corrected but never checked on us. We waited 20 mins for our check, that's after we finished eating. I'm sure if I had just walked out no one would have noticed. But I don't dine & dash.   I will continue to go there for the great food but I will just stick to sitting at the bar probably. Nice decor as well. Nice atmosphere. Check it out for yourself. Hence my love hate relationship why I have three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Turkey croissant with sweet potato fries. Off the lunch menu.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

rpbmX12_3lcW4SLFSo-XLw.text: I was told if we didn't arrive early last Friday morning that we'd be waiting for a table.  Luckily we barely beat the rush and we were sat in "Kat's" section. She was responsive and knowledgeable and from what I could see,   running like crazy.  Our food came out hot, and faster than I expected!  I had the build your own omelet and it was cooked perfectly (not too tough!) The fried potatoes w onions were crisper than I prefer but decent.  The side of pineapple delicious and fresh.  My Chai tea with skim milk was perfect as well. Another in our party loves the sausages as a side,  nice crisp "break" in the skin as you bite in.  His English muffin slightly over done but raspberry jam made up for it.  Decore fun, pretty loud with open concept (& clever bathroom sink set-up!). One in our party said evening bar service good and I can see us returning.  But, the highlight was Kat's service- outstanding...she even referred us to an awesome Thai place...all while very busy & with a smile!

jv-MUIMgywXj6aQdVCZlUg.text: Even though my mom gave a review already I will give one too. :-) I am So thankful we got BLD for barbecue catering. It was a huge hit. Everyone loved it. We got barbecue. Ribs, sausage, brisket, pulled pork, cornbread, baked beans, potato salad, coleslaw, rolls and four different flavors of bbq sauce. I was amazed with how well they packed the food. I had planned to move the food into my own crockpots and heated serving platters but there was no need. We just popped the tops of the containers and the hot stuff stayed hot. I usually spend hours prepping food and cleaning dishes after I have events, not this time. Clean up was a breeze. When we first opened the food I thought we had ordered way too much but the food was such a hit basically everyone went back for seconds. So we only had a few leftovers, unfortunately :-). The guy that took our catering order helped us order just the right amount. I am very thankful to the chefs and staff that made this order so perfect for us. I will prob be having more events and gatherings now that I know how much nicer it is with catering. Oh and the best part of all was the price! I couldn't have made all that food for that price.  thanks BLD!!

2EjtwjVZGTbVX-Nw9dv7vQ.text: Chicken biscuit was very good, eggs and potatoes good but drinks not so much. Odd OJ flavor. Not the best mixology but service was attentive.

rG0zWp0U07JzoTlvN5hPyw.text: Two for service. Food was horrible. 4 meals, 4 fails. Hamburger was a frozen patty, cheese wasn't even melted, fish tacos was all breading, chicken & waffles were beyond dry- talking chicken jerky dry. Mac & cheese was gritty... Cannot even explain that one.

PF4dSdM2ft6VTcK5ga4AKg.text: Don't listen to all the complaining and whining people. This place is on point. Biscuits and gravy +++++ pork tostada +++++. Coffee great service great

zJOrMw1hld4sgEAU06qZfA.text: Our food was terrible, we did not eat it, and we still had to pay for one of the entrees??  That's bad customer business.  We visit BLD often in last 5 years, and we were super disappointed with our recent dinner experience on Friday.  Something is not right.... Arrived 7pm, no hostess, only a few servers and tables.   We sat at bar.  Bartender was the Manager on duty.  Very nice guy, served drinks quickly. Ordered dinner even though our "gut" told us to have a drink only and go elsewhere for food.  Ordered a burger and salmon risotto.  Burger was bloody raw inside (turning the bun red with blood, btw he never asked how we wanted it cooked), and it had incorrect garnishes.  Salmon was crispy black burnt, and risotto was sitting in a pool of oil.  We took 3 bites of each entree and were done.  Manager kindly offered to fix it or buy us an appetizer or dessert, but we weren't interested and just wanted the 2 meals we didn't eat removed from our bill.  Instead only the burger was taken off the check and we still had to pay for the most expensive entree, the salmon.  We walked to a different place nearby for dinner. We will give BLD another try because we have loved it for the past 5 years.  I hope this was just an off night for them.

OYrbk_Y0__YFI3pZuAE6Xg.text: Phenomenal bacon Bloody Mary's and breakfast! My friend and I love coming here for brunch after church.

rLoYOw7BPHswxzOm82yowA.text: Just not again. I used to love this place. Big group of us would come for sunday Funday breakfast here. It was our hangout spot. I just went to lunch today was so disappointed disappointed disappointed. Server came to table NO HI,HELLO WELCOME!! " what to drink she said" we been there often. If you are regular you would know!! THE SKINNY SERVER! Women. She served us many times. She always so racist. Or at least that how it's make me feel. Foods is always good here. Love it. But when you get bad service :( sad. There are so many restaurants around that have good foods and good services that I rather spend my 70$ that I spend there today. So sad. :(.

zTThDt2mNd2590yCXVHVpA.text: Even on a busy Sunday afternoon BLD provided a quick &  enjoyable brunch. Bloody Mary was the best i've had in a long time. Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Green Chile tostada was so filling &amp; delicious!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Amazing menu &amp; they have Bloody Marys &amp; Mimosas!

YnFwo2wP8OZRkpefX-TI5w.text: This place is fantastic and super charming. Well crafted and strong lattes in authentic cafe cups were a huge selling point. I'm the kind of person to eat breakfast for every meal so make a decision with so many options was hard but I made it through with the eggs Benedict.

XEZWALPHscrAN6OscN10yw.text: I have been here twice.  I know they will need some time to hit their stride, but both times I left disappointed.  They really need to focus on the details, and IMO rework the menu.  Little things like the amount of chips they give you with the dip trio VS the amount of dip, show their lack of attention to detail.  There are barely enough chips to finish one dip, let alone 3.  The food was also a let down on both occasions.  It was under-seasoned, and poorly executed.  The guacamole was mediocre at best.  The hummus was the highlight in the dip trio, and still not great.  The "meatball hoagie" I ordered the second time was more like a sloppy joe sandwich.    The Mac and Cheese was bland, and under-seasoned.  They are taking classic comfort food dishes, and actually making them worse in an attempt to class them up.  Additionally I wish they served breakfast items, for dinner.  Actually everyone I was with, on both occasions felt the same way.  The service we had was good, and probably one of the only positives I can give B.L.D at this point in time.  I am a BIG fan of Cork, and go there frequently, so I had high hopes for this place.  I will not be returning until I see the reviews on here start to change for the positive.

WE_to24cHFnX3SZE6DMQvw.text: Great Service!!! Clean and friendly and WI-FI. This is a great place to catch up on some emails and have a great meal. Music is in the back round but not to over powering that you can't make phone calls. Plugs to be able to have power if you run out of battery life. Sean is a very attentive server and made sure my coffee was always full. A new favorite place will be here a lot!!!

SRE1oKqa1W5rnmf_euVWIQ.text: The service was great but the food was sub-par.  When the food arrived it was on the cold side and wasn't very tasty.  I ordered the eggs Benedict my friend ordered Spanish omelet which was cold as well.

yFHqhaqm_Np6OFIt5CaCRA.text: Really good food.  Have to work out the service issues all new restaurants need to figure out.  Floor design and layout needs work.  Ultimately, food and menu is good.  Recommend the cheese grits and shrimp if it's a a special.  Tuna is really good.  Mac and cheese is okay.

v9fScxsZmTrpdmnM0iw25Q.text: Great Food with Healthier options than most places! Prices are a little high, and they aren't a fast food restaurant, so allow some time, but the food is delicious and Fresh! We've eaten here a couple times now, enjoy the food and the healthy gestures, and will eat here again for sure!

RThqG23GBL4pIRIXwHFLqQ.text: We love breakfast, brunch, lunch, and happy hour here. Service is always great. One of our favorites. Yeah Bloody Mary's.

n-04Lxba059lNVGUGMglUg.text: I have came here 3 times since opening for 2 brunches and a dinner.  Everything I've had here has been good: open-face breakfast sandwich, short rib benedict, pork chop.  I think the breakfast pricing is a little steep ($15+ with entree and coffee).  The dinner pricing is more reasonable but still over $25 for entree and 1 drink.  I guess I just do not feel like this restaurant is very special.  I'm not sure if it is the cold setting as another review suggested or the impersonal staff.  Somehow, I am not drawn to go back.  If you are in Chandler and need a clean restaurant with reliable food, BLD is still a good choice.  Just don't expect to be wow'd.

FQMF6yDPYZS_k4Lb-vRzDQ.text: Been here twice and that's enough for me. First time was for drinks and hummus at the bar. The hummus was flavorless and definitely over priced. The second time I sat on the patio for 15 minutes and not a single sever came over. The bartender noticed we were sitting there and did nothing. I won't be back.

bJUNrdn0yKLN7iv-0mlQhQ.text: I wish people wouldn't embarrass themselves by using the term "urban" to describe anything in Arizona.  It's a smattering of highways and strip malls people and it always will be so get over it.   The food here is good, and better than the local chains that occupy the strip mall.    A little overpriced, but everything is these days.   Anyway, I've been to plenty of casual restaurants in NYC and Chicago that have plenty of screaming toddlers around happy hour, so that shouldn't surprise or really bother anyone who is expecting an "urban" experience.   Especially in a strip mall in Chandler, AZ.

Pbkv53Fh7ifkToKxYIACAA.text: We went on a Sunday around 11am we got seated right away.  The menu is trying to be like a new-american style type of menu.  I ordered chicken and waffles and the Bo ordered a breakfast burrito.  Our meals took around 25 minutes to come out and my boyfriend even commented saying how all the people sitting next to us NO ONE had a plate in front of them.  Sunday must have been a new employee training day because there was so many kids wandering around and around the restaurant with no real task at hand.  The coffee.... the coffee was good.  Then, FINALLY our food came out.  My chicken was good and it was a baked chicken breast breaded.  My waffle was HALF a waffle.  Two pieces came out and they were toasted cajun style (like a brick) i think they were seasoned with a pepper or something too?  My scrambled eggs came out already mixed with syrup.  Boy's burrito came out on a green pita wrap tortilla and carne mixed with eggs and some avocado on the side.  The "carne" or meat had a lot of fat on it.  Breakfast was $30.  I wont be back.

aWA6aS5tYYkdTSqV4KaqFw.text: We decided to stop in for breakfast today.  We have been here many times for breakfast and it is an up and down experience.  Today was a down experience.  First off they had fresh squeezed orange juice on the menu and I had to have a glass a small for $2.50, but to my disappointment it wasn't!!  Trust me when I say I know fresh squeezed!!  Second off my favorite dish is the short rib benedict and it always came with red wine hollandaise, and now it comes with brown gravy...WTF??  So I switched to the traditional benedict.  I was disappointed that the normally amazing hollandaise had absolutely no flavor to it, the potatoes had no flavor...it was like they didn't season anything today.  Also the normally fresh shaved ham was now some crappy sliced deli ham.  Needless to say I wont be going back for a while again, sorry to say as it has potential to be good, but they need to go back to the way things were!!

2j1oDdcdckVCk66sEafQPQ.text: This is a chef-driven diner/bar & grill.  The food is straightforward and recognizable but always a little different and delicious.  I'm always pleased that we stopped in, any time of day.

TJwvvs6hCZHSYqHJmQzoFw.text: This place is an amazing pleasure. Best restaurant around for me in 2013. Best cappuccino breve around. Fabulous dirty chai. Green chili pork tostada with poached eggs is great. The staff is phenomenal. They do their best to make each guest happy. The food is excellent. This is better than any diner I have ever been at. Really, to compare it to any other restaurant you must go to a different category. I have never had any problem getting seated. I go here every week. I have been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I have entertained guests, hung out at the bar, wined and dined on date night here. The tacos, meatloaf, hash, burger, steak, salmon, and such are great. I go out to eat quite a bit, travel often, and prefer upper crust, home made, locally owned spots and look for them world wide. I am so happy this one is close to home. Thanks for the great food this year! I look forward to the next. Cheers!

nwvLHNd7SaYZN_1NNUrPLQ.text: My husband and I used to be regulars here. The food and service are both good so we looked passed the fact that a lunch was at minimum $30 with the tip. Then after they hook you, they pull a switch-a-roo. The menu suddenly changes and the prices increased. All this within a few months of opening as a new restaurant. The worst part about this is that many of their best items (which I assume were also very popular) changed dramatically and not in a good way. One example is a wonderful prosciutto salad which complimented fresh melon mixed in a bed of arugula. It is now a mixed green salad with prosciutto and strawberries. Since when does prosciutto go with strawberries? Even a "simple" customer such as myself knows what works best. Regardless, I tried it with the new combination and have decided to go back to Paradise Bakery down the street to get my salad fix. What a bummer! Oh, and this item suddenly increased in price from $9 to $11 after making it a cheaper way! Another item I miss- the grits. You can't find them anywhere and I was so happy to see them on the menu. Well, no longer folks! So save yourselves the money and grab breakfast/lunch where it doesn't hurt as much like the Egg and I less than a mile away. I'm truly bummed out because I was so excited to have a place like this around.

MLPJa86lMXHjZkxsFcNPTg.text: I have been to BLD's multiple times before and was pretty satisfied with the food. But my most recent one has to be put up. My girlfriend and I went to lunch on Saturday just as the kitchen was being staffed for their dinner menu. We ordered off the happy hour menu, a pita pizza and 2 burgers. Apparently though, during the kitchen change, our burger order got lost. The pizza came out in about 10 minutes (prosciutto with goat cheese and veggies, pretty good), but our burgers took about 35 minutes more. Now I have had my food delayed before but at most they give a free beverage. BLDs staff went all out. They gave a complimentary beverage to start. The burgers arrived and were fantastic, the spicy one having a nice kick to it and the goat cheese one being very flavorful. On top of that, the chef come out and apologized with a parfait dessert. At the end of our meal, the manager picked up the tab as well.  I have waited longer for much lower quality in food and not had the great service as I did here. The food being great on top of that. I will definitely be bringing more people here for their happy hour menu.

sOkb1RTq6zirLSUFfexwxw.text: Great food, but service is slow. I have been a few times because the food is really good, and you can get breakfast until 2pm.

GIKIjl0EgX3bD3dRXmrSDg.text: Let's see, good service, good food, good atmosphere.  Decent value for the food.  It all was great. I really liked the Sweet Potatoe fries, just the right amount of sea salt on them.  The Chicken Brie with Apples sandwhich was agreat.  Quick and great service.  Good job guys.

jGNRYep4T5eZEXhjvCWNoA.text: I've been there twice.. once for lunch in the first week that they were open and the food was OK but not worth the price tag.  I figured I'd give them some time and give it another try.  We went for dinner tonight.  Again, the food was OK but not worth the price tag.  I asked if we could get a small bowl of noodles with just some plain Parmesan cheese for my 1 year old and the server pointed us to the 6 dollar spaghetti and meatballs. Children's meals were 6 bucks and didn't include a drink - a 4-6 ounce cup of chocolate milk was an additional 2.75 which seems like a huge rip off.  I had to stop the bus boy twice from taking food that we weren't finished eating and then went to take my daughter to the bathroom, and he cleared off my water glass which I had JUST finally gotten refilled.  You'd think after the first time, he would have given us a bit more space/time but that was not the case.  My food and my husbands food pretty good but nothing worth the price tag. It's really a shame,  We've been to cork and I really, really wanted to like this place.

80lbLNTeeXjjuD38N7YTlw.text: What a waste of time and money Brent the owner is soooo unprofessional

DB3caFbs8mbSgX0GP4J-Lw.text: I was very impressed with BLD. The place was recommended by a friend who lives in the area so I decided to try it out. I really appreciated the mix of the crowd...seems everyone is welcome. The food itself was familiar and unique at the same time. Kudos for that. The portions are larger, so when I read other reviews complaining about the price I say to them "you get what you pay for". Want cheap prices? Go to Micky D's I guess.  Why 4 stars and not 5? While the restaurant was good it wasn't perfect. The server forgot about my champagne despite the fact it was brunch time and never delivered it (also did nothing to accommodate the inconvenience). The barista station is confusing and I couldn't decide if I could order a latte there or not. After standing there for almost five minutes and being ignited I just left it. Also, the hostess is efficient but not very neighborly...she made me feel like just another customer; which I am but it's nice to feel more welcome at a local restaurant.

qhzFgTyV0HA8PJddsE7iHQ.text: Had dinner last. Igor with family and friends.   Brent the bartender was funny and helpful with recommendations for dinner.  He was right the fish tacos were great.   The queso chorizo fries were also very good.   Overall 5 star bar and grill experience.

aUYb5qiNRctmz_2HXnOC2w.text: We had a large group of 13 people. Shasta was amazing and and got every order correct with every card back to its owner with incredible efficiency. If you make reservations be sure to request her.

Nf6y9v97qzEePTc7RY0Tuw.text: This place is phenomenal! It was hard to decide what to eat from the incredibly huge menu, truly something for everyone. We made it on time for happy hour so the prices were great and the service was excellent. Especially loves the queso dip and French fries. The whole family was overly satisfied with their meal including the cocktails and coffee. Highly recommend this place to anyone.

9PORCqkFF2JgsGi3Ys7HDQ.text: Came here for Mother's Day and was not disappointed.  Everyone loved their food. My husband and kids all got burgers and loved them. I got a croissant breakfast sandwich and it was delicious. Our server Abby was very kind and attentive.  Highly recommended BLD!!

qDL0r10vFVyS8p8SAKkzyg.text: Love this place! Love Penny and Bill and the whole crew! Must try the beet salad! Actually, just try everything!!

zfQBdz5T9o1uCKpfZVz6zg.text: The service was alright, nothing spectacular and the food edible. It wasn't disgusting but it didn't leave an impression. Comfortable, fantastic concept . I think if they shorten and tighten up the menu and concentrate on a few items they'd probably do better. The eggs Benedict were ok but nothing awesome, breakfast burrito filling but that's about it. Bloody Mary's? A little over priced for the quality. The food came out luke warm and the servers seemed almost annoyed when we needed to flag them down for something like a refill or simply just utensils. Unfortunate.

jbuC6yLP5nLZMdSyQeNe8w.text: We eat here a few times a week as a family. The food is amazing and the service is even better. We've had two birthday parties hosted by Shasta who takes good care of us. She always remembers what we like to order.

wE1f7hv4eKQ7fYBSN3Z4_Q.text: Big old "meh" from me. I wanted this to be really good because it's right down the street from my house but nothing tasted great just ok. Incredibly salty breakfast burrito. Almost inedible.

TDqlOtSggps3PHuSWIp9xw.text: Tried their new prime rib sandwich for lunch today and loved it!  Smothered in sauteed onions and served with a wonderful horseradish sauce on the side.  It's a knife-and-fork sandwich well worth the $13.95. Be aware, though, that this new sandwich is only available on Monday's and Tuesday's if there's prime rib left over from their Sunday night dinner service.    As always, service was impeccable from Linda who has been with the restaurant over 4 years now.  We like seeing the same faces at restaurants we frequent.  5 stars for the new prime rib sand!

9Zx3ynOPd-2_iKenebuvvA.text: Stoped in for a Moscow Mule and Brent (the bartender) was very attentive and social. Ended up having 3 and good conversation. All worth it. Great environment and great food. I recommend this place for a Sunday breakfast and a Bloody Mary or just a couple of drinks mid week. Thanks Brent. Keep the change lol.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

jGT1dTy0rJ2-P1E9FpsFCQ.text: We really want to like this place as it's in our community, privately owned, and beautiful space.  But over five years or more it just can't seem to meet a standard or figure out what they actually are.   We went again last night after not going for about a year because we bought $30 for $15 on Living Social.  Decided that saving a little money it would be worth a try.  Very disappointed. Only reason for three stars was because our server was delightful.  As the ONLY server in the dining room, she was working as hard as she could to take care of the 8-10 tables she had by herself. There was a bartender and food runner which appeared to be the extent of front of house staff.  Bartender never walked from behind bar as he could have helped her clear plates, refill drinks, etc.   Loud Mexican music from the kitchen was competing with dining room music. Very annoying.   Wings were decent. Chicken picatta was dry, no light breading as a picatta typically would have.  The menu is overwhelming and not laid out very well but it's full of choices that are from too many different types of cuisine...from burger joint to steakhouse to bbq to Italian.   Figure out what one you want to be and do it well. We've been in for B, L, and D and have been disappointed every time.

IMwQ3CaAogHzMfb1vqLgFA.text: We ate breakfast at BLD this morning.  My friend and I have breakfast out every Saturday morning and are "wanna-be" foodies and critics!  :).   We had not gone to BLD in quite some time and are very happy we returned.  Kevin, our server/Manager, is outstanding!   The vegetable omelet and side of the turkey sausage was phenomenal.  The veggies were plentiful, and actually cooked to perfection.  The turkey sausage has a bit of a kick to it, and complimented the egg dish perfectly.  Coffee was amazing as well.  So happy we returned there and can't wait to go back and try all the other entrees for other meals as well.  Just a real nice place to go to.  EVERYONE was very friendly!!  You get a good feeling from the time you walk in until you leave.

_T3BhtLh675aZVsQdfYYzA.text: Our first time here for Sunday brunch....OMG it was amazing!!! Great service and great food. We sat on the patio to enjoy the awesome weather. Our server Gracie was fantastic. We'll definitely be back for dinner, as their menu is huge!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

5XBtPHj0X8sfK1xQ6Y9Fiw.text: Kevin was a wonderful server. The food was excellent and he was very attentive. I had the Salmon salad and it was delish.

Iu_CxQjbBfwqwL_jHFq46Q.text: BLD catered a Prime Rib lunch for my office and it was a smashing success. The Prime Rib was perfectly cooked and all of the sides were equally delicious.  I had a large group and I was worried about there being enough food.  I need not have worried as we had plenty to go around for seconds and leftovers for my staff to take home. Kevin worked with me on price to keep me close to budget and even delivered, set up and carved the roasts.  I can't thank BLD enough for helping me provide a wonderful luncheon for my hard working staff.

uzTiovurLDFaATseYqw58g.text: I ordered the 3 barbacoa tacos And it was not barbacoa. It was real salty tasted like barbeque meat, tortillas fell apart. I would change the name on the menu. My husband ordered a burger and for the price we paid for it let's just burger King is better. The meat you can tell it's a frozen Patty. Needless to say we won't be going to this place again.

WksuLLpVwUH3WBL7Uc1_uA.text: We have eaten at BLD a few times for breakfast. It's always been great food, however we recently went for dinner and Micah provided my family and I the absolute best service! He made the entire experience so awesome!! We will absolutely be back ... and ask for Micah's section :)

8yPXaEwYWpcVQJrrCpSSiQ.text: Super super yummy. I had the cali Benedict and it was so good. I also had 2 mimosas and they were amazing. A traditional one, and you should also order the cranberry one as well. For Sunday it was busy but I was sat with in 15 minutes and food and drinks came out fairly quickly. This is my favorite breakfast/brunch place.   2019 Update: This is still my all time favorite brunch place. The bacon is THE best bacon I have ever had and their hollandaise sauce is to die for! Also the only place have been to that makes their potatoes crispy. Can't say enough good things about BLD!

bEMz7IXyDstJmFtaZVVF6A.text: Whenever visiting family in AZ we always make it a point to enjoy a meal at BLD.   Great menu, great selection, fun atmosphere and wonderful staff.   We are usually served by Abby, who has a smile on her face 24/7 and is so very thoughtful and attentive.   Thanks Abby and BLD!

nX9Py9ituQDQW-jUbab2BA.text: The service has definitely improved over the last few months which is a very good thing. I can't say that I've ever ordered anything that I haven't enjoyed. At times the dishes can be inconsistent but overall I think this is a really great brunch hangout. Also on Sunday they have $20 champagne bottles, not a bad deal. If you're going for the first time request not be seated in the back room, it's kind of cramped and doesn't capture the feel of the restaurant.  Recommendation: the goat cheese burger

8GattJKiV0Lahe0gL8A7Xg.text: We went here mainly because of the location and the dog friendly patio.  The patio itself is very nice and has a lot of well shaded areas to keep you cool from the hot sun.  We had breakfast here, which was a mixed experience meal-wise.  I had the Hawaiian French toast ($8.75) which was disappointing to me.  The only thing that seemed to make it Hawaiian was a few slices of banana placed on top of the French toast.  The menu listed a molasses batter for the toast, but I couldn't taste much molasses flavor.  In addition, the toast itself looked overcooked and tasted dry.  For $8.75, I would have liked to see more ingredients than some slices of banana on top of 2 sliced pieces of battered toast (Maybe some pineapple? Or grilled ham?).  My husband had the biscuits and gravy platter (Around $10), which I thought was much better value wise and taste wise.  The gravy was rich and delicious, and it was a large amount of food since it came with bacon, potatoes, and 2 eggs.  I also tried the short rib benedict, which was nicely cooked, with great flavor.    So while I didn't really enjoy my dish, the others I tried were very good.  I'd like to go here again to try more dishes, but be aware of what entrees to get!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy breakfast platter
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hawaiian French toast

ACW2hvDhlAH_a4TJhT84IQ.text: Wow the service at this place has gone way downhill. My son and I have been here over an hour and still no food.  Giving up and going elesewhere. Loss an hour of my life.

5e2c8MDW0UhPxMu3vfRclw.text: We eat out a bit, and BLD never falls short of expectations. They are always trying new things on the menu and we appreciate the variety.

0ElpLZZVZsbEfHiSGZ771Q.text: Katie M should stick to Denny's for sure. BLD is amazing. Fun menu great staff excellent food!

swfO58mocUq5htqI_ADFUA.text: a few months later and I have to update my review.  Remember how I was saying even though it didn't capture me those first several visits?  Well, I kept going anyway... not out of my way, just casually when there were no other options I was interested in, I'd say "how 'bout BLD?".    So, 4 visits later, I feel I owe them another star.. they seemed to have picked up their game.  The dish I thought was not executed well (green chile pork tostada) was very well put together and so flavorful that I had to Yelp about it.  The other menu items I ventured to try were the scrambles.. specifically the shrimp-chorizo - AH! DELICIOSO!!  quickly became one of my favorite dishes!  See? I knew there was something special about this place.. they just needed to work out all the kinks.. and it seems like they did, I've noticed.  Also, the waiters have been good - prompt, accomodating, and informative.. that helps a lot.  So, thank you, thank you for making improvements.. you now can count me as a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Cali..Benedict was perfect! Down to the well toasted muffins and tangy hollandaise...eggs were perfection...Very delicious!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. No filter!! That is how colorful their yolks are... this green chile pork  tostada was downright ginormous and flavorful.

Ui1FsTK4Jf25zB_e9SS9rQ.text: Go hungry! This is a made from scratch restaurant that didn't disappoint. I had the roasted chicken sandwich and my wife had the bbq beef brisket plate. The portions were generous and tasty. The prices were reasonable and the upgrades were not overly pricey. The service was good despite it being noon on Sunday. They have a full service bar that looked nice although we didn't use it. They also have a dog friendly patio. We will definitely be back!

irAsNdCSJGznJo8iU06r0w.text: Wow!  Great! I couldn't wait to dive into our food and forgot to take a picture!  Very nice place, friendly staff, and fantastic food!  We are fans and can't wait to go back soon!   Please go when you can. you won't regret it!

AvvSwybuKT9kVQ5xdjt7XQ.text: Went here on Black Friday at about 9am. There were some crazy kids running around but that was not the restaurants fault. They brought us waters straightaway, and coffee and orange juice promptly. Upon asking, they said they would do French fries for me (I have a limited diet) even though it was breakfast time. This impressed me. The fries were good and my girlfriend enjoyed her cakes and bacon. The restaurant and silverware were clean, and all of the creamer, sweeteners, and jellies were fully stocked. My water was always full, as they were on top of asking if I wanted more. I've been here before, and I will certainly return.

Xm3MJ8PzYDs3NAoRXHyr6A.text: Love the breakfast here! The breakfast burrito is the size of a small football. Very good! The Bloody Mary's with bacon are amazing! Haven't tried the BBQ yet, but will one of these times!

Ra49TR7L5V7UAlmlHajB-w.text: I came here with DH and it was our first time out to eat since we moved here. We went here for dinner before going to a movie. We went on a around like 4pm on a Friday and it wasn't very crowded. We both got the BBQ and it was very good and more food than we expected. I got the Mac n Cheese which could have had a little more season. Over all I would love to come back here and maybe on a later night with more people to see the atmosphere.

zFy1yjn_uoWIZZppI6yghw.text: Date Attended: 11/13/14   Item Ordered: Goat Burger (white cheddar substituted for goat cheese) and Rocky Road Bread Pudding  Price : $20  Service: I have to confess this is my fourth time at BLD and I have always remembered to write a review after eating the entire meal. The staff is excellent, knowledgeable, and honest about the menu. Even had a chance to meet Brent, the restaurant manager, on one visit and he was a pretty cool guy. He even shared how many green concepts have been used to design the restaurant. Finally, it has always been spotless on every visit.  Atmosphere: It immediately reminded me of restaurants on the East Coast. The booth seating is plush, the patio is a nice getaway, and there is a real cool concrete sink outside both bathrooms. Even when it's busy, it doesn't seem loud.  Food Quality: The burger is PHENOMENAL! Definitely order it medium well. The tomatoes were roasted with garlic and it's like a gift falling on your plate when one falls out of the burger. An can you say "Bacon Jam?" Bacon on a burger is always good, but when it's spread on the bottom bun...you just might drift off into another world. The chocolate in the bread pudding was a bit overpowering, but the texture was perfect.   Overall Experience: Definitely going back again and again and again. Kind of ashamed that I didn't post a review for the breakfast items I had over the past month.  So here's my apology. The chorizo is smoking hot and the steak/eggs is simply amazing. I've never ever been a fan of toast, but the sourdough toast is ridiculous.. Yeah I just gave kudos for toast, but you'll understand after the first bite. The pancakes were kind of spongy and haven't ordered them again. Enjoy!
