Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Goat Burger and Side Salad

p7LsTyyMU0hunvLD7nSYlQ.text: The absolute worst excuse for a restaurant breakfast my husband and I have ever been served.  THE WORST!  We went there at lunch time for breakfast because they tout that they serve it all day until close so we figured it would be cooked to order and fresh.  Boy were we wrong!  I ordered biscuits and gravy which came with 2 eggs, bacon and breakfast potatoes.  The 2 scrambled eggs were fine but that is where acceptable quality ends.  The two biscuits were undercooked and so soggy that they melded into one mushy piece or they sat for hours and got that way.  The breakfast potatoes were thick sliced fresh potatoes with no seasoning whatsoever (not even salt, pepper or butter) and had been deep fried to a crisp. Imagine the bland taste of a slice of baked potato with no seasoning, butter or anything on it?  They were so dark and overcooked that neither my husband nor I could even cut through many of them and he actually bounced a couple on the table which made a smacking sound so the waitress could really tell how overcooked they were.  She tld us "Well, that's all they have put out right now." (whatever that meant).  They were also supposed to have onions in them per the menu and because my husband did not want the onions, I made sure she knew that I did want them.  Though I did not expect bland, seasonedless potatoes, the onions would have definitely added flavor.  But guess what?  Neither order had onions.  I sent mine back both for being overcooked and because I did want the onions.  The new order was not overcooked but was just as bland and seasonedless and again had no onions.  The waitress shrugged and said "There's no onions again and I don't know why" and just walked away.  We could not believe that she accepted them a second time from the cook without the onions.  Then there was the bacon.  It was almost black it was so overcooked and was so dry that when you picked it up, it crumbled.  Three or four pieces were curled and stuck together.  You could not break them apart.  When we later spoke to the Manager, she said they bake it all in the over ever day at 7 a.m.  Then they apparently throw it in the deep fryer to warm it up when someone orders.  (They also deep fry the potatoes).  Thus we were served six hour old overcooked bacon at 1 p.m.  Pretty disgusting.  It appears that they hold all the food they do not sell at breakfast to support their claim to all day breakfast.  One can only speculate about whether they are meeting health department standards for the temperature they hold the food at.    My husband could not eat hardly anything on his plate and the manager noted that even his scrambled eggs were overcooked.  The burnt bacon he tried to eat resulted in terrible heartburn.  The young bartender-manager eventually did the right thing but initially was very condescending and patronizing.  She refused to accept our description of the bacon as overcooked or burnt and kept interrupting us (we were very courteous) to correct us by calling it "extra-crispy" and actually rolled her eyes two or three times over our comments which were relayed quietly and very respectfully and constructively.  She said she wished she had known about the issues as she perhaps could have done something such as substituting something better to our liking.  When we told her that we DID ask the waitress to let the Manager know she brushed it under the table by saying "Oh, well maybe she was too busy" (the restaurant only hand a handful of diners in it at that time).  Her attitude remained condescending and non-apologetic until I asked her about the owners then everything changed.  She comped our meal (which we had not asked for), gave us a $15 coupon to "try them again", and gave us a business card with the General Manager's name and email address that she added to it.  Thus in the end she did more than enough for us but it was a long road getting there.  I see some good comments here on Yelp so perhaps this was an aberration but I don't relish the thought of trying them again even to use the $15 coupon knowing that what is served to us may not be freshly cooked.  Any chef that would put what we got on our plates in our view is not to be trusted.  We used to dine there a few years ago for lunch or dinner under the previous owners and the food was fine.  It is a clean and pleasant atmosphere but we don't like to look forward to a meal only to be disappointed.  If they have a practice of holding food for hours, it is in our opinion to risky to go back both so that we are not disappointed and because of possible health risks.  Check out the two photos I posted here and see for yourself.  Ask yourself if you would confidence in a chef that served you that bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Soggy, undercooked biscuits for biscuits &amp; gravy. Inedible with overcooked unseasoned deep fried breakfast potatoes - many hard as rock.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Burnt to crisp stuck together bacon. Mgr. admitted that they cook it daily at 7 a.m. and hold it until ordered. Served too us 6 hours later!

iHoAmr_tx41jp8LxCtOedA.text: My wife and I have eaten here twice.  The first time was an absolute disaster.  My wife had the french toast with the jam on it.  She did not like that combination.  I had one of the Mexican breakfast dishes; the downside with it was there was way to much green sauce. The server removed that from our bill so that was great.    We returned a second time to see if that was just an off day.  The second time I had the chicken fried steak breakfast and it was okay, but again I've definitely had better.  It seems like with all their dishes they have tweaked them just a little to be unique, but for us it came off as just undesirable.

7FtrRXAOYXOGdwAOwnncJQ.text: Decent enough little place. Was greeted and sat quickly. Super cute server Amanda, suggested the 4 size ribs, I'm a bigger guy so obviously I chose the 6 and I regret that decision. She was correct. Ribs were good with lots of meat on them. Coleslaw was great. Beans were good. All around good experience. Great service by Amanda, thank you.

5SH8LOGC2RYMamxoj2RVEg.text: Found hair in burger which was cooked very well done when asked for medium rare. Manager said "our cooks are Mexican and the Mexicans burn the heck out of everything"... to my Mexican wife. She comped the meal, but obviously never going back.

tqQEOW5c6To_06V3PPODnA.text: Food is really good, I have been a few times now without the owner or staff knowing who I am. I'm stilling not seeing great service. I have been there when they are busy and not so busy.... Staff was much more attentive the second time around, I have been there 4 times now. It's all the little things like making sure we have utensils, more drinks, napkins, checking up after we get our food. Things like that.  I guess my recondition would be to order 2 beers at the same time and be prepared to chill.

yuWn8hIs-2c3uxybGt7umA.text: Breakfast croissant. It was very yummy and the breakfast potatoes were baked to perfection. The only thing that was not ok was that for those three pieces of bacon I was charged $3.75! So keep that in mind if you order a side of bacon. Otherwise everything was awesome!  We went in on a Sunday at 12 and they said it was 30 min wait for two people. We sat outside to wait and the wait only ended up being like 1 min! So that was great!! Yummy!! I will def be back and just not get bacon :)

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Breakfast croissant.

UyuforOccAPb4prTc0zyfg.text: Sad!!  This used to be our favorite restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Their decline in service squarely rests on the shoulders of the managers and the owner. Both inept.  The wait staff acts like they're doing you a favor serving you. Quality of food not as good either.

TgW7rF_VrML-i0fit0EBVg.text: Best Bloody Marys I have ever had!! The bartender, Bill, makes a homemade spicy vodka mix for the Bloody Marys that is scrumptious!!! Their hash of the dog is the ultimate hangover cure! Great patio and very dog friendly!! Friendly staff! Ask for Bill or Penny!

OfiBQBwey3V7f2Ef4-uOnA.text: Service was good, coffee good.  Would prefer real cream.  Ordered the biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs over easy and bacon and potatoes.  The eggs were good after I scraped them off the biscuits and gravy.  Bacon good.  I don't like my food mixed like that and had no idea they served the eggs on top of the biscuits and gravy.  The egg yolks ruin the taste of the biscuits and gravy and there really was not much gravy.  I want my biscuit and gravy by itself, not under eggs.  I took the biscuits and gravy along with the potatoes home for dogs.  If I eat here again, I will order just eggs, bacon and toast.

zEzRaHMx5XCuVBLtqZQAqg.text: Sarah was our waitress and was very attentive and personable.  the food was really good.   Had a good time.

u2XUYQ5U_Poc35NEVtqMuA.text: The new management that took over about a year ago have completely changed this place from a place that we loved and frequented several times a week, into a run of the mill eatery. Everything has been cheapened from the music they play, to the condiments, to the events. Really miss the old BLD! Wont be back

OxC7JpDtCJfFkrAXuqKzgA.text: We decided to try BLD for dinner last night. One of the things that jumped out was the fact that they now offer a barbecue menu. The brisket was tasty! We also ordered a few cocktails. Kevin's suggestions and execution were perfect! The fact that he had to run the bar and several tables simultaneously was an amazing feat. Service was on point.   We will definitely be back!

33AxWIy-oILlNEapSE_zuw.text: Very disappointed! This was the first time we tried BLD for dinner. We had out of town guests and wanted somewhere we could talk since the Cardinals game was on. The good was just OK, but the service was horrible!  We ordered appetizers and 4 entrees. The appetizers came out with the entrees . No excuse! The place was dead, we were almost the only ones there. Appetizers out with 3 of the 4 entrees! The other three ate their meals , while the 4th waited almost 20 minutes. HORRIBLE! The original server must have been embarrassed because we never saw him again, they did take money off the bill. DONT THINK WE WILL BE BACK. maybe for breakfast but never again for dinner.

c5WxfOxMikCHRs2XYbmrMw.text: Bill was unbelievable.   Our first time there last week and he made us feel like celebrities.  Which all tenders were like him.   Great place.   Great food   Can't wait to come back Thanks to him.

zMydaSc6dQ4FqOijpJv-fQ.text: We went for a late brunch on a Saturday with our dog. This is a dog friendly restaurant and based on other reviews we came to this place so we could hang out with our dog. We got a nice table on the patio, and as soon as the waiter realized that we had a dog he brought a bowl of water and a biscuit for our dog. The food was great and actually came out super fast. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. The food was very tasty. We got the South of the border omelette and the one of the hashes (I think the farmers). I would definitely come back, good food and dog friendly is always a great combo for me

q0LM5tNgeQg3edlyCmJlmw.text: Love, love, love BLD!  Love Bill!  This place won't disappoint.  Food is great, drinks are amazing!

8VSNY_xVoj8rGJ9SkOtCeg.text: Came here for the first time after having this place bookmarked for over a year!  My coworkers are constantly raving about their food, but I just never found the time to head over in this direction.  Fortunately I had a friend flying out of the Mesa Gateway Airport and figured it would be the perfect time to check this place out! We got there fairly early on a Sunday morning, around 10:30am and we were lucky to get seated right away.  They have TV's throughout the restaurant, which is good for all those Sunday football fans.   I ended up getting the Hawaiian style French Toast - captain crunch style, and my friend got the BLD Benedict.  Both were amazing!  I tried my friends benedict and I enjoyed how it wasn't a thick slab of ham like other places serve.  It was thin sliced pieces which made cutting so much easier!   And their french toast was amazing!  It was sweet enough with the captain crunch, bananas, and powdered sugar that I didn't even need syrup.  Although I still ended up using a very small amount just so that it didnt' feel like I was eating dry bread.  I will definitely be making it out here again sometime soon!  Hopefully to try out their lunch/dinner menu!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

XIfuecwO_Xz8qxeuwLpXLA.text: Hosted the 2nd Breakfast Club UYE last sat and this time I picked BLD.  Even though BLD did not take reservations they were able to seat us right away, which I was happy with! I liked the way the place is set up, its bright, cheerful and opened, liked the opened ceiling, my work has the same type, also liked that they are dog friendly and have patio seating for the dog lovers, and they even have a drive thru so you can order food and go. Like the overall vibe BLD has. Our server was Tara, and she was super! Always making sure our table had everything we needed and seeing how we were doing. Love good service!    I picked BLD because I heard they had eggs benedicts and I have been craving hollandaise sauce forever! I ordered the Cali Benedicts, came with bacon, tomato & avocado, poached eggs on top of a English muffin covered in hollandaise sauce with a side of breakfast potatoes. The plate looked beautiful, bright yellows, greens and reds; I like color so this pleased my eyes. The only thing that was a bummer was it was lacking in flavor, everything was bland, the hollandaise sauce was creamy, but no tangy taste too it, and that's the part I had been craving.  So I wasn't blown away with the flavor of the food, but I was happy with checking out BLD.

qFBGLONgbV6ixI4byE-2kw.text: The food here is terrible overall. Management is unresponsive to feedback, even when they reply to a comment posted.  Ask for contact information in a post on yelp to "appear" as though they are attentive to correcting this issue.  I will never return here as I am not a fan of getting stomach issues when dining out.

xXk3s4TrgNMj5qhASbfunA.text: Top 5 worst transaction with a business, overall worst for a restaurant. I hate leaving reviews, and have never left a negative review. I usually show dissatisfaction through never going back. However, the manager's inability to do their basic job makes me feel like I need to spread the word. We went Memorial Day, it was busy, but expected. Coming in we had eaten there last year and it was awesome, so when we were told it was a 20 min wait... we thought it would be worth it.  During that time I overheard 2 people getting checks "adjusted" and I thought "hmmm cost of a busy day."  We were seated in only 5 min so I brushed it off and thought "home run".  Service was typical busy restaurant, slow but friendly. We waited 45 minutes for biscuits and gravy and a eggs Benedict, which came out cold. After 2 bites, we asked for the check and we told her the food was cold/gross.  Waitress apologized and offered to adjust the check. I thought that was fair and it was my mistake for coming on a day in which they were overwhelmed. The check came back with 5 dollars off a 30 dollar tab... And she acted like that was fair and left. I was sooo pissed I paid, left no tip and left as quickly as possible because I did not want to embarrass my girlfriend.  In the car, she asked why I didn't ask for a manager and proceeded to call.  She got a hold of the manager who claimed she would get me a refund and call back... no refund, no call back.  Never going back.

G8SEo6HXqaIIANmLWC_f_w.text: I received a giftcard for BLD and immediately looked up the menu. True to their name, they do breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The menu has a wide variety of items that all sound really good. However, I've only been here twice and both times for breakfast. For my first visit, I used the drive-thru. The drive-thru allows you to order drinks or call ahead and pick-up your meal. I was unaware of the call ahead portion, so I just ordered their signature iced coffee and was on my way.   On my second visit, I brought my husband and his sister for breakfast. The place was extremely busy inside, so instead of waiting 15+ minutes as the hostess advised, we asked if we could sit outside. We were seated immediately and our waitress was quick to come over for drink orders. I ordered a hot vanilla latte and my sister-in-law asked for an iced caramel macchiato. The waitress was quick to quip that BLD's macchiatos were nothing like Starbucks. My sister-in-law assured the waitress that was fine. Shortly after, the waitress came back with an iced drink and an apology that she doesn't know how to make a macchiato and was waiting for the barista. Confused, we all thought the drink she brought might be the macchiato but it turned out to be my drink. Somehow my hot latte became an iced latte. Seeing the waitress was already frazzled, I didn't say anything. It still tasted good. Finally, 10 minutes later, my sister-in-law's drink arrived. It was basically a latte with tons of caramel sauce. My sister-in-law said it tasted bitter since the caramel wasn't mixed in well but she liked it nonetheless. For breakfast, I ordered the chicken and waffles, my husband ordered short rib eggs benedict, and his sister ordered the chicken fried steak with no cheese on the potatoes. My fried chicken was a little dry but the waffle was delicious drench in syrup. (We had to grab syrup from another table - the waitress never brought any nor did she offer it.) My husband enjoyed his short rib eggs benedict - no real complaints. My sister-in-law liked her chicken fried steak, but the potatoes came with cheese despite her asking for no cheese. Near the end of the meal, the waitress finally checked in on us and our food. We asked for to-go boxes and the check. Another 10 minutes roll by as our waitress stops by her other table and finally gets back to us. We paid using my gift card and cash.   On the drive home, my sister-in-law commented that she would never go back and I agreed. The food was decent, but the waitress was really inattentive and messed up several items we ordered. To be honest, the waitress acted like we weren't worth the time and left us feeling neglected. Maybe it was an off day, but after seeing how the waitress treated her other table much better, it definitely felt deliberate. Additionally, the restaurant is more than 30 minutes away from where we live and definitely not worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Short rib Benedict
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles

GbIVI1hvZJ4f-PtWwXqpJQ.text: I met a friend here for lunch. The outdoor seating was nice but it was still a bit too warm outside so we ate inside. The facility was clean and staff was nice. The service, however, was not so good. We ordered burgers and drinks. It took us about 15 minutes to get our drinks (Arnold Palmer and Coke). After an additional 20 min of wondering where the food was, I looked around and saw that none of the tables had been served...35+ min and tables were bare. When the food did come out, it was fantastic! I had the goat burger and let me tell you, the angle of my pic doesn't do this thing justice. This burger is HUGE! I hurt myself just trying to finish this meal. My mouth says more and my gut screams, STOP!! So yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Arnold Palmer / Goat Burger / Sweet Potato Fries...they never brought out my side of ranch tho :/

4eMSDGYo7x9JvntRyHt9ww.text: If you can get past the dogs barking on the patio, kids screaming inside and the flies that come through the open air bar, you'll love the food.  Maybe takeout would be best if that bothers you.   Admittedly, the food is excellent and the portions are generous.   Today we ordered the breakfast meatloaf and chicken & waffles.   Delicious!

Z0MbAEzipoDTgjFK_RD8kw.text: I hate to take my 5 star review down to one star however the last few of times we've come here it hasn't been good at all. Today was exceptionally bad and the last time we will be here. The service is good however the food has really slipped and gotten to the point where it's horrible for breakfast. This used to be a weekly breakfast spot for us. I am very disappointed because it is a cute restaurant and close to home but we gave it a few chances and it didn't redeem itself also it's a little bit pricey especially for breakfast.

ggQAiedBfOaNyz2zxKKuUQ.text: The service was not so great, do not ever order a burger here. It was terrible. I wish I would have taken a picture of the sloppy thrown together burger so you could see what I'm talking about. The meat was super thin and over cooked. It was all bread and shredded lettuce. The so called caramelized onions were not caramelized and the shredded lettuce was old. Awesome bloody Mary though. I would have stayed to drink another bloody Mary but it didn't seem worth my time. I was so over the experience because of the service and poorly made food.

2zlAp-YB_yhEiQddo1InJA.text: After having bad service last time Troy my waiter gave me excellent service ice and the food was great.The food was excellent as usual. I will be back

dDAeOHy9RdMn8wIKVzN9zg.text: Great food as it usually is, and has been since we have gone to BLD for several years now. But today  I found out the manager didn't care when I pointed out that the loud drunk patrons  two tables over in the middle row were cursing loud enough for all in the restaurant to hear. I was told it's ok to be rowdy. When I again pointed out the foul language with children nearby, on a Sunday afternoon lunch, I was told I was being difficult.  This is not a family friendly place anymore.

jop7rSRDl9Z3aU9QBWc9Sg.text: Three strikes...you're out!! BLD is close to our home and the food is decent, so we gave it 3 different attempts, only to decide we will not be returning. The girls at the front just stand there and have no idea what a customer experience is supposed to look like. You're lucky if you get a smile from a single member of wait staff, with the exception of the girl from the kitchen when she brought out our plates. Not for us.

ZsG-EqNJZQELLrODi2-zRg.text: I've been to BLD many times. Love their concept of breakfast, lunch or dinner at anytime. I was a little disappointed in my last visit. A group of 8 teenage girls came and sat in the booth next to me. They were so loud and laughing and just being unconcerned with other diners that I left. When I called the manager to express how unpleasant the girls made not only my dinner but others around me, he replied "I apologize. There's nothing we can do. It's like if there's a crying baby we can't do anything." A crying baby is very different than 8 rude teenage girls. Perhaps he could have said "hey would you girls like to sit on our patio so you can giggle all you like?" Or how about saying to me "I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your dining experience, the next time you visit how about a desert on me?" Instead I won't return to a place that is pricy and cares nothing about the comfort of their  So my second review..went back because this is one of my fav places! So very yummy. Taco night..great deal..yummy food and beautiful presentation. Hh is awesome and my server was attentive w/o being intrusive, helpful and friendly! No teenagers making dinner uncomfortable! Beautiful place, great service, warm/beautifully presented food!

aoUJKjsX2Q3IIp1-44fjSQ.text: Best breakfast in town with the best service from Jay! Thank you Jay for making break every week awesome!

7hbEHF6FuNzT2O3XTLd4pA.text: In from SoCal... returned to BLD for the Papago Orange Blossom.  Great meal, great beer, and great service by Micah.  He took great care of us from start to finish!  We'll be back.

AanhLKPkCovzteLcN058Og.text: Love BLD!  I'd call it a fancy diner with a bar. I've been for breakfast and dinner. Love the breakfast burritos and mimosas. Their burgers are fab as well.  Abby was our server and she was really great as was everyone else that we encountered. Next time, I'll try the bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy burger- yummy!

JnsTkrypC8WWtTEjsLIfKQ.text: I highly recommend BLD. The atmosphere is awesome the staff is great and the food is delicious. There's a lot of choices to eat in Chandler And BLD is among the top. Try out their short rib breakfast burrito if you're looking for something hearty,  it's truly amazing. Also their server, Micah , is a True pro in the food service industry. He makes his guest feel wonderful and is super helpful on menu recommendations as well as making you feel special!

goYp_IzAAjY0MdVufhuwOA.text: What a great dinner experience!  Food was great service from Micha was exceptional.  Kids had a blast and the atmosphere was fun and open.  I had the Reuben and it was perfect!   Kids had breakfast for dinner and they loved it as well.

L2xO7WjaJNKC6GB3ImdQZQ.text: Food is fantastic. Drinks are overpriced and don't expect to have a conversation during breakfast. The staff likes to listen to their music. Too loud for me. Now I have to find a new place. Sorry folks, inexusable at 8am.

7TurRAhNSa4wlo9UPUzRcA.text: One of my favorite local brunch spots! Try the Bloody Mary and make sure you get it spicy (honestly it is more flavorful than spicy) and don't forget to add the bacon!   The portions are huge, especially brunch time! If you don't share you will probably be taking home left overs. I've tried a few different menu items, but the chicken and waffles has to be my favorite! The breading on the chicken fingers is perfect! Also will go great with your Bloody Mary!  It can get a little loud inside, but with the beautiful patio (plus dog friendly) I would rather eat outside anyway!

r0cvOdRjTDzh6asqKqDGYQ.text: Love this place.  The food is good and the service is awesome.  You should always ask for Stephanie because she's efficient and a lot of fun.

8epOR6wlhRcEEhG53hhoyw.text: We showed up at 8pm for dinner and the chairs in the front half of the restaurant were up on the tables.. we thought they were closing (but it wasn't 10pm) no hostess to seat us so we asked a couple at a table if they were still open .. we grabbed menus and seated ourselves after being assured the place was open and the food was great .. several minutes later a waitress appeared ..  I had the rib eye steak salad .. it was ok.. definitely dinner size, lots of avocado, bacon, egg & steak .. the crispy onion on top was stale (fried earlier in the day), steak had good flavor but was cold..   My bf had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes & glazed carrots .. he really enjoyed it..  Maybe another try on another day will change my first impression
