bJguGktXSHB1wKWXu2smrA.text: Great food, even better service! Our server Kevin was awesome. The food was fantastic. We had whole wheat pancakes fabulous omelette.

N96_x2OY1wkCU8YnRmaScg.text: We loved  this place for a group party. The food came out fast and organized-all at the same time for 15 people and no mess-ups. Our server, SHASTA, was amazing and handled all of the orders and requests like a BOSS! She even gave us all separate checks. I'm sure it was a pain but she was cheerful and professional throughout the whole evening. I would highly recommend BLD in Chandler!

Et0tlYDA18KyXajphoi0AQ.text: Fish & Chips were some of the best I ever had! Abby our server was super nice! This was our 3rd. time there in a week. Great food & great service! Huge menu and definitely recommend going there.

DaRFlv7vgkynZ4l--2U_eQ.text: Trendy, open and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. My husband and I were hungry but no specific craving so we knew to visit BLD. I've been here two other times and always remembered the interesting and appetizing menu.   It was a quiet Saturday morning, just after 11a and when we visited this time we walked in and the hostess didn't greet us. We stood at the front for about a minute right in front of her before she said she'd be right with us. We weren't in a rush and that was fine however we asked to sit at the bar instead.   The vibe is modern, clean and very welcoming even if the staff was a little less enthused. At the bar I ordered a Bloody Mary and the bartender asked my preference of spice and if I would like some bacon. When I got my drink a new bartender took over and took our orders.    We ordered the chicken and brie on sour dough and the bbq brisket special. Although the food was good, the side dishes were wrong and that was the last time we were approached. We had to ask for water, napkins, utensils and the side of bacon that never came. When asked about the bacon the bartender said, "Sorry, do you still want it?"  In the end, I'm sad that the food was good but the experience wasn't. We would have stayed longer and ordered more drinks but it didn't seem like we were worth their time. I hope they improve because I think this place is great with a unique menu.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken and Roasted Chicken &amp; Brie
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Texas Style Beef Brisket

NUHWzpqhqwAVwS5L8chNjg.text: I've loved BLD since day one! Recently we've been getting take out due to being pregnant and now having a new born. The past 4 times our order has either been wrong or just horrible quality. From forgetting specific order requests to the menu item not being consistently made to order the same way.   Yesterday was just an all time low for us, We love the fish tacos and we've had it prepared two different ways with some different ingredients as well. Yes it's not a big deal but when you're expecting yummy tacos and you're expecting it to be a certain way it frustrating,   Also With our taco orders, the tortilla were so cold it was like they just came out the fridge and they popped them right into the takeout boxes. And the chicken tacos were not even assembled like tacos all the ingredients just in a big mixed pile and three tortilla sitting on the bottom!

GD_aiH8SWsSsXqXRedfNBw.text: Food is everything at BLD Chandler!  Meals are prepared by experienced chefs and taste is absolutely delicious!  Experienced the Brisket Stuffed Ravioli, the Fried Cauliflower, Fried Chicken Breast, and the Mango Cole Slaw. DELICIOUS !!!! Customer service is outstanding - wait staff, Falcone, is very friendly & informative answering any questions. Food served in a timely manner.  Great place for a party of 2, or a large group.

amhvYN9fnOMfmCQBddfgeg.text: I gave this 2 stars because: --My husband liked his short rib breakfast burrito --The server kept our coffee refilled  --My food was ice cold when it came out but I never got an opportunity to tell anyone because our server didn't check back U til much later --The coffee was super weak and watered down  --My English muffins came out without butter and there was no jam on the table, which i had to ask for after waiting to see our server again --Had asked for scrambled eggs hard and they were still wet in the middle  Lesson learned: Don't eat here on a weekday morning after the breakfast rush. Food will be old, cold and not as tasty, hot or fresh as it is on a busy Saturday or Sunday morning.

_Go-vs5WPLO2rjf0JN0NGQ.text: Best brunch and morning drinks in chandler! We have been coming for years and love all the staff. Penny is the best, she is always so friendly and takes great care of us. Bill is fantastic too, he can talk to anyone about anything and is always working hard. I would recommend BLD to anyone looking for delicious food and drinks.

TqVW1phwgspUqAztIp_E1g.text: I always love coming here. The food and service are excellent! Special shout out to our waitress,Abby. She very sweet, helpful and took great care of us. Looking forward to our next visit

JtAiJqCLribuSMGR34tdlQ.text: This place is great! I always complain that the chandler area does not have a good brunch/bloody Mary/mimosa place. I ALWAYS go to Scottsdale for my Sunday funday breakfasts. Surprisingly enough my 9 year old daughter recommended this place since she goes w her father. I was blown away w the atmosphere and food. It was like I was in Arcadia.

8c9SJ7Kxc4S8NE_TaTkpDA.text: Very bad experience at BLD this morning.  On our last vist the waitress forgot to place our order, after 30 minutes we left.  Today the service very poor and slow.  The wait staff just doesn't care about customer service.  Stopped woman manager and told her we had been waiting 35 minutes for our food.  No apologies, she brought our food and never stopped by our table thru the meal to see if everything was okay.  Too loud and too much of a bar atmophere for breakfast.  Never again and I live just down the street.

huaj_ZXiUfzb4GFSuCvFFA.text: This morning was our third trip to BLD.  We want to like it, we go out of our way to support local non-chain businesses. SALT, SALT , SALT is all we tasted again.  I appreciate that the cooks can poach an egg correctly, and make a proper over-medium egg.  Why where they covered in salt and pepper?  The biscuits and gravy were almost inedible due to having too much salt.  The breakfast potatoes had visible gains of kosher salt covering them. I ordered a bloody mary, which is unusual for a Monday, I know, but it took 25 minutes and the server said they dont have a bartender in the morning during the week.  Well, there were at least 5-6 servers standing around talking, I think it took all of them to make the drink. We've had a similar overly salted meal at dinner a couple of weeks ago. We want to like BLD but wont be back any time soon.

r1h1-1debCUrDONs3PN06Q.text: BLD (Breakfast Lunch Dinner) is great. They have a great menu for all three meals of the day, and I'm a fan of each.  The breakfasts I've had there are great, specifically the pancakes and the eggs benedict. Both were delicious and filling. I've had dinner there too, which was called the "pound and a half burrito" which consisted of eggs, potatoes, avocado, and shredded ribs. It was delicious and I was very pleased. My parents both enjoyed it as well, and have stated their want to come back soon!  The look of the establishment is very modern, and they have a wonderful patio and bar that I have yet to sit at. Im hoping to do so very soon.  The waiters and waitresses are very pleasant and know what they are talking about.  I  look forward to my visits to BLD, whenever they are planned! I would recommend this to anyone who is in the area, and even anyone who doesn't mind driving a bit farther for a great meal.  I hope that this restaurant stays this way, as I would hate to have it change management or owners and go downhill. One of my new favorites!

rHZIs9xqroZKAz44joDANA.text: Went to BLD last night. What a great meal!   The food is a wonderful healthy portion and so artfully put together ... But the best part is it taste great.  Great happy hour till 7 pm so that's a treat.   The staff was charming.  We will be going back for B and L too.

X8TPakkqksFVoAAVddg7tA.text: My wife and I have been here for both breakfast and lunch. With breakfast, I had the Hog and I believe my wife had the Breakfast Burrito. The Hog was good, although I was searching for the cheese, the Breakfast Burrito however was a different story. My wife isn't a fan of onions and this was onion overkill. It totally overpowered everything else in the burrito and she could not eat anymore. Now to lunch. We thought/hopes it would be different since it had been months since breakfast (breakfast was around Thanksgiving), however one of us left hungry again. This time it was me. I had the Steak Tacos and she had a Chicken Sandwich. My tacos were incredibly overspiced that I couldn't enjoy them, although I tried eating 2 of the 3. My mouth was on fire and so was her's after a small cut of the steak. We got a check back a minute after the food was dropped but I hadn't eaten much at that point. The next time the waiter stopped back, which was about mid way thru our meal, he dropped the check off and said I'll take this for you when you're ready. I didn't know I was finished with my meal! We were disappointed for B and L, I don't think we'll be going back for D.

dCCResoywNuh9YyS-gKtYA.text: Tasty home-style food dressed up...service was great

020SwBboDhWPA-bHyLR0vg.text: This place is more over a 41/2 but at least a 4. The breakfast, lunch, and dinner are all worthwhile.  We've tried them all.  Been here many many times.  The bar is fun to grab a drink at during games or on a weekend night.  We love the servers, bartenders, and managers.  Great place.  When they get super busy it can be a little slower but nothing major and frankly no restaurant is perfect.  Since the other places have opened in the strip mall the whole area has really picked up, which is nice to see.  The Cali Benedict, shrimp and chorizo hash, and the Florentine are excellent.  The eggs and sausage with a biscuit are very good.  Love the biscuits!  The coffee drinks are always tasty, love the Americano and Soy Latte.  They also have many coffee drinks that aren't on the menu so ask or tell them what you want.  For lunch, the goat burger is really good.  As far as dinner, the short rib pasta and the short rib dinner are very good.  Really a nice addition to the local east valley breakfast, and overall restaurant, scene.  This place is one of our staples.

-QhE-ZgsMTNYM1Ty6517uA.text: I have heard a lot about this place being an awesome spot for breakfast. So after church this morning a few girlfriends and I decided to give it a try. We were each well pleased with the service we received and the quality of the food. I had the BLD Eggs Benedict and they both enjoyed vegetarian omelettes with avocado and a side of toast. We will definitely return. My only complaint is that my cranberry juice was served warm. I requested a glass of ice and to my surprise received another glass of juice with ice and an apology. I ended up with two glasses of juice which was not bad considering they are small. Overall, enjoyed the atmosphere, food and service.

GmuTlN3o2IISTotmZsBoLQ.text: This place is pretty cool. Nice atmosphere, good food. I think the pancakes are REALLY good. I've only had a couple of things though. I did not like the bacon waffle because it didn't seem cooked enough. Kinda blah. Overall I look forward to trying this place for L and D too!

nxIMkWeQQfExVDy_smCe6g.text: 3 stars is generous and only b/c Cork is fantastik. Another very medicre offering. Very pleasant service but food has no taste. Dishes are uninspiring and blang and not visually applealing. Tastes like they microwave dinner. I can stop @ the frozen food section in Fry's and likely do better

ImumCyQTPJ7w9PY7izu2SA.text: We got the artic char with potatoes, sausage, and bell peppers. Amazing. It reminded me of a jumbalaya, it was creamy and perfect. They threw leeks in the mix making it the perfect dish. My husband had the appetizer ahi tuna and hummus. The hummus was refreshing, but the ahi tuna wasn't as rare as he likes it, but for me it was perfect. It was a slow night when we went, but the staff was nice and service was fast. I can't wait to go back and get more potatoes.

yhtlYQsXRnFl4SasjZcfQw.text: Horrible service, mediocre food and overpriced.  Definitely won't be going back.  Called in an order to go and picked it up from the drive-thru.  Got home and opened up our packages to a huge disappointment.  I ordered the South of the Border omelette and couldn't believe that the fruit and sour cream were both thrown on top of the omelette.  The fruit should have been packaged separately (hot and cold don't belong together) and the sour cream should have been in a cup by itself.  The pepper jack cheese in the omelette was of the processed variety (think Velveeta.)  I would think that a place that tries to be higher end would use quality ingredients.  The second order was fried chicken and waffles but that's all we got.  No butter, no syrup.  So instead of eating our meals we had to make a trip to the grocery store to buy syrup since the restaurant was too far away.  When I called the restaurant to point this out I was told (after a very long and awkward pause) that the chicken and waffles would be taken off the bill.

9RHps2YWt6DojynEhrGENQ.text: We are so happy that we found this place about a year ago! We've tried breakfast and lunch and have yet to be disappointed. The staff is friendly and the service has been great. They also have a great little patio area, which is dog-friendly and a drive-thru to pick up to-go orders.

uCYdyvHDUuGL-rEajcYZkw.text: Had breakfast at BLD on Sunday morning and had amazing service at the bar. Not to mention the food and drinks were great too!

S1vGgvATOUcvNvE3ADxb-A.text: Finally! A non-corporate place in Chandler that doesn't try too hard, yet knows how to please with high-end ingredients: local and organic when possible!  I ordered the Chef's Burger from their lunch menu. Grass-fed, ground in-house 8 oz burger with arugula, Gruyere, and onion rings.  I personally would have liked the arugula melted under the Gruyere or tossed with the Russian dressing.  It was too ordinary undressed on the top bun. But, it IS the Chef's Burger and if that's how he likes it, then that's the way it should be enjoyed. Oh, and the onion rings are awesome.    The service was genuine and friendly. The food came out reasonably fast and HOT!  It would have been nice if you could hear the music...it was just too quite.  I will definitely come back and try other menu options and I highly recommend BLD!!

Jc7MLYMySjWeEF5KL-gwDQ.text: Had a very disappointing experience today.  All four in our group were disappointed in the quality of the food, especially the overripe cantaloupe and soggy potatoes.  The place was busy which won't be the case much longer if they don't improve their fare.  The service staff was friendly although I thought it interesting that no one asked us about our experience.   If they were interested, now they know.

P3bagUwMcuSpJ3dGfGwsIg.text: Wife and I had dinner on sat, April 30. I ordered the organic chicken with shrooms . This is a signature dish and she ordered the beef short rib dinner with Mac and cheese. Well the chicken was like med rare beef, pink and oozing pink juice. Not good. Sent back to kitchen and came back, kinda medium, still pink near the bone. Sent back again and manager came out and said what can we do, so I ordered the tuna which was good. Wife's short rib was not what I am used to for short ribs. No falling off the bone here. Just chunks of beef that was kinda dry and overcooked. Like brisket really.   So not to good a first experience. As I tell everyone, if you want good chicken, check out Banderra in Scottsdale. They set the standard for all chicken in the valley. Sooo good.

tuXqay3nbiW0xq7CuY4ntQ.text: first time, might be last.  had high hopes.  capuccino was very weak, filled cup with coffee after.  went for the monte cristo, my favorite.  the french toast outside was soggy and flat...like pieces coming off the cheap buffet.  the cheese was all in one place...poorly constructed.  potatoes were ok.  place was packed, nice enviro, but unless I find myself around there, I likely won't go back...good idea poor execution

ohxR7KZBXAp81qwaHCusrw.text: Oh lordy lord lord. where shall we begin? Let's start with Breakfast, shall we? 1st thing is 1st; the Disclaimer ya'll. Ive only been for breakfast. however comma the lunch menu looks epic and anyone who can make a person who hates breakfast fall in love with breakfast all over again deserves props for the whole menu. i will update my review for lunch someday...problem is, I'm not allowed to go to the same place more than once a day and i come here for breakfast. so, hence the problem. Also, since my Delorian is broken (Popsicle gas sucks), i can not currently go backwards ( IE: delete button broken, ramble shall continue on). Well, any great breakfast joint will have 2 things IMO; fresh, home made Mimosa's and NFL on the TV. check and check. parking? a cinch. easier than a valet. Greeting? always warm and inviting. Cool bar seating/normal seating? you guessed it folks, the price is right. Food? O....M.....G...... my goal is simple: try the entire menu. the problem? I'm stuck on item #3, on my 19th visit. do that math. Luckily for me, my girlfriend has amazing will power and is on item 14 and is a small eater. guess who gets her dish? This Guy!!! i haven't had one bad thing. My favorite is BY FAR the Chili Pork Tostada. The braised short rib egg Benedict is so good, you'll literally O Face at the table. no joke. for you followers of me, you know how i feel about places that make your wet dream a reality. seriously. incredible food. also, 2 other awesome things; the patio is legally allowed to have dog's on it and they have a dog menu! how cool is that? answer: freaking cool man! also the bathrooms are so weird and unexpected...its like the Blue Man Group, i could try to explain it to you but it just wont make sense. you have to witness it for yourself. PLUS - if you want healthy, they have egg whites, turkey, spinach omelet. AND a drive thru for phone ahead orders AND AND protein shakes also. whats that now, like 8 PS's? told ya, backspace button has been deleted.

CMao_B9zTEnw7beBLp_9CQ.text: WOW WOW WOW...Such good food!  Spicy burger with sweet potato fries and the HOT PASTRAMI  ***AMAZING***.  Coming back for more!  And btw, I never yelp any restaurants!

Uj0nuGo2UQtn65bbWiSvRQ.text: This was hands down one of the best experiences I have had dining!!! Their pet friendly patio was so welcoming and amazing! My pup was immediately acknowledged and given so much love by the staff along with a water bowl and dog treat! The food was fantastic as well!! Spencer was our server, he was superb! So great that we didn't want to leave!!! We will definitely be back!

-JvaqF_bAs0t8t4o_1n89w.text: BETTER BURGERS THAN Cold Beers has.. no lie. I went to BLD with a coworker friend and it was my first time, today in fact. We decided to try the burgers and each of us were torn between the Goat Cheese Burger and the Jalapeno burger... SO.. we decided shed order o e and id order the other and then cut them down the middle.. problem solving geniuses we are! Anyway we both decided that each of these burger were THE BEST burgers we've had in Arizona and went as far as THESE BURGERS ARE THE BEST WEVE HAD IN OUR ENTIRE LIVES.. AND were practically 40 years old so.. that's sayin something. I mean perfectly cook to our desire, the bun was flawless, the Jalapeno sauce was unbelievable as was the Goat cheese.. I cannot say enough accept for that I can't wait to go back and try their breakfast next.. it was soooooo frickin good.

Z3zbyWiqzpq_qPHK2bSb6g.text: 7/6/11 Arrived early for the OYE party at bld, so I decided to check out their happy hour. It's a good thing I did, too, bec. the margarita I had here (priced $3 on the menu card, but I was charged $3.50) yelp.com/biz_photos/bld-... was one of the beverage highlights of the evening! The meatball mac 'n cheese, however, needs a tweak-- while I enjoyed the mac 'n cheese portion of the dish, I found the meatballs and sauce to be too acidic. yelp.com/biz_photos/bld-... If I wasn't trying to slow down my body's absorption of alcohol (I'd just gotten a massage before, too, so circulation was revved up!), I wouldn't have eaten as much as did, and I left more than half in the bowl. Still, what I had tried was enough to keep my mind open for more happy hour adventures here. Take a look at the interesting HH food menu!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. HH menu and my $3.50 draft margarita.

DBc0SCLlrMI_nsFY6MwExg.text: My husband and I found this place today and tried the breakfast. The place is adorable and super clean. Staff very nice. More importantly, the food was amazing. Will be back for sure! So excited about finding a new great place!!

of8zK4Qu8KoTDmkYl4aoZQ.text: Good.  That's what I think of this place.  The patio is good.  The location is good.  The food is good too.  Overall, I enjoy it.  The prices are a little high but the quality is good.    Good.  It's all good.  Nothing was great, nothing was bad.

285BJEEHKtOBliLSyXWMwg.text: BLD in Chandler had been a "go to" spot when visiting Chandler in the past.  However, things change.  The chicken waffles was always my favorite.  Waffles used to be a decent size with bits of bacon baked in.  Now, the waffles are round, the diameter of a tennis ball.  Really?  Why even bother.  No bacon bits and service is very "mechanical", not much personality.  So we'll have to scratch this one off the list

2I1pD5WN0wUuwEgXaeuVIA.text: Visited for the first time 1/25/18. Allow time to find a parking space. First person my party of three encountered with a smile was Luis who is so friendly and nice.  We sat in Diane's section, ordered brisket platter, BLT with avocado, and mini burger.  Thursday is $5.00 off BBQ and burgers. Food was good, and sweet potato fries were good. Food came out hot and fast. We arrived right after the lunch rush.  BLD has an inside community table, dog friendly patio, and the bar opens on the patio side so you can sit at the bar outside with your dog (how cool is that).  Great customer service, everyone is friendly and Luis, as the Host is always checking up on everyone to make sure everyone is "good". I actually thought he was the manager he was so good.  We plan to return for breakfast soon.

Adl1LTtqaDVh8MHZ5Dz1pg.text: Great service and food was delish! Try the Short rib burrito or monte Cristo. You won't be disappointed

ztdWIvdKYw_x_dsIUtVBrg.text: Something for everyone!  Creative menu items,  great flavors,  and lots of choices. Love that breakfast is served late.   Cool atmosphere. Very open and chic!  Friendly staff.   Try the breakfast burrito with braised short rib or "goat"  burger!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. &#34;goat&#34;  burger with sweet potato fries.

ahtis0Et-G1lzf7x7Zwmug.text: Came here around 10AM post 5k on a Saturday. It was pretty empty for a weekend. We were sat immediately and our server was quick with drinks.   I'll get to it quick- I just didn't love my food. I wanted to sooo badly. I got the huevos rancheros because I typically love it at other places. It was basically a very over flavored quesadilla filled with mashed black beans and a lot of pepper jack cheese. It had a small spoonful of salsa on top and 2 fried eggs. Personally I think there was too much going on and it was too heavy. The salsa made the tortilla soggy too. I only made it through half and didn't keep the leftovers. I am a leftovers gal so that should tell you a lot!   I might give it another shot someday but for now...no thanks.

Cdvj4FfelzChxhkgO-mJKQ.text: BLD has been really, really good the last few times coming here, I've been really converted to the good side of the force.  The omelets are great, I choose the Build your own, or a southwest style. Cheese is gooey and hot, onions great, fresh and fluffy. This is a great breakfast!  Sweet potato fries are great, serving sizes are hearty, I just cannot complain one bit. I love coming here now.

B6vgIwTFxu9FonjM7bYbLQ.text: Food is usually decent, but unfortunately the atmosphere leaves something to be desired. There's never any music being played (especially on a friday or saturday, really?) It's like a church on sunday in there.   They also never open the window ledge that leads to the outdoor patio--which is a huge plus for most folks that want that "outdoor experience", like Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers or Zinburger's.  Half of the fun of being in arizona is being able to sit at the bar outside, while having the inside feel of the bar.

DbwWZiP7qA5RQku3yoCEaA.text: I'm sad it took me so long to find this place. I had a protein shake that was awesome. I also had the bld quesadilla which was amaze balls as well. The pico would stand on its own but when added to he quesadilla it's even better. I may be back tomorrow. And no, I wasn't able to finish all of it. :-)

N87m2048FsszivuSGtMFKQ.text: One of my favorite stops in Chandler dining!  Creative menu, that never disappoints!  Breakfast time is a blast.  Overall good hangout and family dining location!

pXIU0RBP6wtJ-UaCKgQpqA.text: Found on yelp. Great choice lived the biscuits and gravy. Bacon was so yummy! Next time I'm in AZ I'll hit up bld again!

YI2mlWHGuz0AtulZfm4i9A.text: This place is a must try!!!  I came in for dinner and fell in love with the decor. It's hip, and very friendly. The service was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I loved the beer menu. It wasn't too big but had a fantastic selection.   The menu had a lot of unique choices. Everything was paired with wine or beer. I chose to have the pork tenderloin. It was very flavorful. The combination of cabbage and black beans with the tequila pork was tantalizing.   It was too hot but the patio outside is gorgeous and dog friendly.    The breakfast menu looks amazing!!!  They have appetizers for breakfast!!!!!!  How cool!!!!  There is also a drive thru. When I read that is scared me a bit. Don't be fooled. This is a classy, reasonably priced place to eat 3 meals!!!!!  People......TRY IT!!!!!

aBIbIRcaJyk14ZN3dqh03g.text: I'm very happy we finally tried BLD for breakfast.  We arrived around 8:30 and it wasn't busy at all, which is fine by me.  I don't really dig crowds because that usually means there's the potential for loud talkers, drunken sluts, and unsupervised crumbsnatchers.  I'll take peace and quiet where I can get it.  Anyway!  I had the Green Chili Pork Tostada which was a beautiful and flavorful dish.  I should have taken a picture of it, but I'm still Yelp-shy when it comes to taking pics in front of the staff.  Beautifully presented, the pork was tender and plentiful, and I really enjoyed the black bean puree which smoothed out the spicy pico de gallo.  I have mentioned before that I'm a heat pansy, and this dish was good, but a little spicy for me.  Overall I think the flavors blended very nicely.  I brought home half of it and I think the leftovers will make some very nice breakfast burritos tomorrow morning.  Mr. M had the biscuits and gravy, bacon, breakfast potatoes, and eggs sunny side up.  His meal was cooked perfectly as well, and I really like it when onions are fried up with the taters.  I was sticking my fork into his plate more than once, and used one of those potatoes to soak up some of the flavorful broth on my plate.  Delicious!  I enjoyed the B & G, but he said he didn't care for the gravy very much, that there was something sweet about it that he didn't expect that reminded him of hollandaise sauce.  Maybe they got their whisks mixed up.  I dunno, but I liked it.  We watched the chicken & waffles and the meatloaf hash get walked by our booth and I'm looking forward to a return visit to give them a try.    Our server was friendly and fast with refills and the atmosphere was nice.  I like the calming grey color scheme.  The coffee was nothing special to me, but not bad.  Next time I would try one of their specialty coffee drinks.

pJCdRWbT-kLGP2-E5TWWNQ.text: As a Central Phoenix/Arcadia snob, I know little of the "east valley"...but was brought to BLD by coworkers.   I am now a member of the BLD clean plate club!  YUM. Short ribs eggs benedict! !!!  Wow, delish, and they allowed me to sub tomatoes for potatoes,  no fuss.  Great service, delish food, clever menu, totally worth the drive!

9K65Ja9GjsDItLI-Lw83yA.text: This place is amazing. We stopped in while in Arizona because the reviews were so good and I am so happy we decided to stop in. The food here is so great.   I got a breakfast burrito and a pancake, and I cannot even express how much I loved it. I couldn't even finish the burrito because it was so big. Pancakes are an essential part of breakfast. And the pancakes here are definitely up to par.  Our waiter was pretty nice, he always came to check on us and refill our drinks.    The atmosphere in this restaurant is great. Everyone seems to be having a good time, enjoying their food, no complaints.   The rest of the people I went with also liked their food. I tried some of my uncles breakfast potatoes with cheese on them and they were sooo good.   This place generates enough business itself without all of the good Yelp reviews. It's definitely worth stopping in. The next time I come to Arizona, I will be coming back for sure.   How soon can they start building a BLD down the street from my house?

ffO0LpnrrxTcEcaj5C_7xA.text: I thought long and hard before writing this review- I want to start off with the positive- the atmosphere was great- it kinda feels like a hidden little cool spot tucked out of view a bit. The inside doesn't disappoint either. The bar is set right next to a large out door area and gives off a very cool vibe. The chalk boards everywhere are a nice touch and the wine closet is cool to look at. The staff seem to be happy to work there and super friendly and helpful. The restaurant is also well kept up and very clean. So why three stars??? The food, it was just so average. I really expected to be wowed walking in there and I just was not. I had chicken and waffles it was served with bacon and scrambled eggs. The eggs were over done and not salted at all, the chicken was properly breaded in some areas but not in others. It also could really be brought to life with some seasoning. It however was not dried out. The bacon was good. The waffles were cute but not yummy, they were a bit chewy and had no crisp at all. They were labeled as malt waffles but that flavor did not come across- if the syrup was flavored and served warm that would be a huge kick up for this dish. The portion was generous and you would not leave the table hungry. I see a ton of potential for this place - and if I ever hear that they revamp the menu and really go for flavor I would test them out again. I hope they do!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

vYDNCVFY5DE_bkEGEZWg1Q.text: Really wonderful neighborhood restaurant with a huge selection of food leaning towards mexican. Not many places do breakfast, lunch or dinner at all hours. Incidentally, happy hour is a great time to try out some of their offerings like the green chile pork. They make their own sauces and salsas and are truly delicious.  Whether you are looking for a pancake as large as a platter, or simple healthy meals, this is a great place to bring family and friends as it surely will have something for everyone.

AHuGQhkeK1eRTyrw130KKQ.text: You would think that with barely 3 stars on Yelp & a plethora of guests complaints that the owners would actually DO something about the issues... sorry guys. Send the same generic response to every negative review isn't getting you anywhere.

M5-zyiSpP8s5i4vkCw75lA.text: I was a patron here for a couple of years. Came back to Chandler after a year & visited my old spots. Terrible terrible service. No welcoming. Entitled staff. Awful feeling.

8gQPJgRi0qzgVPRVE6I0wA.text: Nothing really wrong just not my jam.  Seated quickly by door and cold air came in every time someone entered.  As a single, I did appreciate that one side of my small table was bench seating.  Waitress efficient but no personality.  Food came out incredibly quick.  Eggs, potatoes, OJ and bacon good.  I paid $1 extra to get a biscuit instead of toast and that's when it went downhill.  First it was served with no butter.  Second it was huge but that meant it wasn't cooked enough inside.  Third it crumbled when I tried to butter it.  Maybe a great biscuit to go with gravy but definitely not a biscuit to serve instead of toast.  Plus the price was high on a basic breakfast.

iWrfJSOasHajjgSRcU2dbw.text: BLD is our Go To breakfast spot 3 times a week.  Breakfast quesadilla is out of this world. On the weekend it's half off Champagne Bottles those Mimosas keep us coming back.  Chef Hector is doing great work !

9nmK6pZelY0hvSPLhqN-Kg.text: Something has changed drastically here. Used to be great food. Now everything has changed and not for the better. Service was barely adequate and not friendly. Bacon was so thin and cold it was inedible. Chicken fried steak used to be so good now it is so thin all you taste is breading. This used to be our favorite breakfast spot, not any more! Over priced for below average food. Sad

IwLFagY8qTM-MASH-qCI5Q.text: J Cole is the most Amazing Bartender we appreciate him so. Drinks are the Best Food is Amazing !! He gave us tips on the area and delivered such great service.

b-mtMWF6GjCd0FMP2xwIEA.text: Food not so good, days old baked potatoe, dried out corn muffins, very disappointed!!

ES7D65JFY520eJGlH__VbQ.text: Had the BBQ. Very disappointed. Chicken was dry. Brisket did not taste like it was from the BBQ. More like it came from a crock pot. And prices were high for food that was disappointing. We love BBQ meat places but I don't think we will be returning to this one.

tbOJOq0DngGrV4XWoBnn4Q.text: My friend and myself ate brunch time breakfast here, it was delicious and good portions!

BDDfkyQmIwwEoYD2UM3CJQ.text: I've been here many a times for breakfast and it's good. However, today we sat on the patio for about 20 minutes without any of the many, many wait staff even acknowledging our presence. The wiener dog mutt friend was with us, but he was behaving amongst all the other patio dogs. It felt like we were actively being ignored when all we wanted were some eggs. After numerous meals here, this very much soured the experience. So strange.   Update: Went again for dinner, and even though the food was good the service was yet again verging on terrible. Sigh. I want to like this place, but it's gone off our rotation for good at this point.

YBsADGXK_2h4p9rD8g8kKg.text: We were all excited to see an ad on Facebook that they had Friday night all you can eat fish n chips for $15 each .   The parking lot was full but the restaurant seemed fairly empty for a Friday night .  The 'hostess' didn't acknowledge our presence with a 'welcome to BLD .  Is this your first time ?  Our Friday night special is all you can eat fish and chip made from rock cod'. Nope .  We got the eye roll and the slouched walk to the table.   The server was nice enough but not intuitive.  You've got 3 ppl ordering fried fish .  Break out the malt vinegar !  We had to ask for it .  He was on point getting us more fish tho .  It was a shorter wait for fish than Fibber Magees .  The food wasn't too bad .  The restaurant is clean .  We'll be back for breakfast one day . The bright spot of the night was the bartender that said 'good night ! ' on the way out .

I3QRM4SvyI8cUmWzQqMGQQ.text: I came Tonite to celebrate my 12 year anniversary and my bff Sam Barlow's 62nd birthday The food was wonderful as well as great service It was a quiet memorial day night so we could hear each other talk I am very happy I picked BLD for these special occasions and would suggest others to do so also

uF5TNZrn_cXWwv3_kWck2A.text: French fries- top of the line; mango coke slaw- delicious; vegetarian omelette- the best! Will be back!

akrZILjo1ZIMMJK1jsdKrA.text: Visiting family so this gem is a quick drive for Delicious food. I came here for breakfast and lunch on 2 separate occasions. Large portions for breakfast, dont be overwhelmed. I cant say anything bad about it ..attentive staff and food was fresh and as expected

-xr19VMgplJ_mP94esHiJw.text: BLD was a pleasant surprise. I was a little worried when it wasn't crowded on a Friday night but all the better for us. I had the braised short rib pasta, it was excellent and they didn't skimp on the short rib. The latte was great as well. The place was well lit, clean and modern. The menu was affordable and they even serve breakfast all day. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

OjnvhGOc-bi4ljTGmtghXA.text: One of my wife and I's favorite places to eat. Excellent food and service. This past experience our server (Shasta) was amazing. We went on Super Bowl Sunday, place was packed and yet we had the best service. We highly recommend.

iBy2A57J7KPuvGaKVfaN5Q.text: We have been here once before for dinner, but after seeing awesome reviews we stopped in for "Brinner" (breakfast for dinner).   My son and I ordered our favorite breakfast items (see pics) and the scrambled eggs were fantastic, they made the potatoes with out onions for both of us (Delish) and everything was really tasty.    On the downside, all three drink orders were messed up, and my eggs were over cooked.  I didn't prefer the sausages (matter of taste only) but all in all it was worth going back again!  Note: our waitress was super accommodating and really nice and sweet!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Martini (with a little lipstick on the side)
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kids scramble with toast and bacon and a side pancake.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sausage and egg (side or tomatoes). If you want hem cold ask for them on a side plate - mine were cooked because they sat on the hot plate.

jCfPROKs8Nrr43aw67FM5A.text: This is a place I enjoy eating at offer. The southwest omelet is one of my personal favorites.

Nnayn_tkhm0hBm3o6pDNuw.text: They offer a HH between 3 and 7. We had their sangria and thought it tasted terrific. The quesadilla and other appetizers we had were just okay. Once we had a very personable server but twice we have been served by a fellow with absolutely no personality. If you are going to get a job in a restaurant working with people, I think you need to develop some people skills or you won't make much money (don't worry, we tipped him anyway). Also ate here for breakfast, which was super - I had the chicken with waffles, delicious and very generous, but at $14 among the most expensive breakfast entrees I have ever had.

QWYz8pi2NwoKlCjeLyeHEw.text: We stopped in on a Friday morning at 8:30 ish and there was no wait. The service was friendly and quick. Very modern clean decor. The morning happy hour mimosas were great. My fiance had chicken and waffles and I tried the bld burrito, both really really good. We will def be back.

QrTuQx3iif9Ohozpbt2tZA.text: Excited this place is finally open! The short rib dip was delicious, and the mac and cheese couldn't have been better. Definitely get the mac and cheese.   Atmosphere is just what we need in this neck of the woods. The bar could definitely be a nice place for happy hour in the future.  The service left a lot to be desired, but I'm hoping that gets better with time.    Overall, great new place! Looking forward to going back to try more.

WfGtHdR6pc5IXFyIqFawVQ.text: BLD I really wanted to like you, I really did! I gave you three chances and each time your food just sucked, plain and simple. You make a decent Bloody Mary and for that 2 stars instead of 1.

JV9USMC2QmOj3FEEe-K1mA.text: My husband and I went here friday night we usually like to try a new resteraunt once a week, SAD to say it was TERRIBLE we had ordered short ribs which u could tell it wasn't short ribs it was a chunk of roast sat on a plate..It was very bland had no taste at all!! we were very disapointed for what we spent that night we could have gone to a really nice place... Oh well live and learn unfortunantly we will NEVER BE BACK!! I GIVE THIS PLACE 4 THUMBS DOWN.

F5YliPYqGOrdi0k6xYPTmA.text: Went to BLD for dinner tonight and I was not happy at all..the only reason I gave them two stars was because the service was good and I had there 1 dollar sangria ( who knows what kind of booze was in there) ..so the menu looked  promising ..we started with the crab cakes, they were just mushy and no lumps of crab mostly fillers ..then we split the fried chicken and waffles and there bld burger, I started with the chicken which was just breaded breast which was dry with no flavor the waffle was blah ..then just when you think u can't mess up a burger they did, my girl ordered it medium well and it out extra well extra burnt extra blah.. seemed like someone was pissed because there was no love in any of the food...and finally there prices are pretty jacked for the quality of food you get..never going again

dPf14ugxc2xuJkSve0NkqA.text: It took around 15 minutes for anyone to approach our table. This being said the manager passed our table at least ten times in this time period. The restaurant comes across as very new age hipster-esque but I must say is very lacking. It is very clear this restaurant is new and not managed well. The food is good I ordered the grilled cheese with Havarti and Brie cheese, tomatoes and bacon. The chicken and waffles was sub par. Please don't try their homemade ranch.

sGuRyE4IGeIQrWWrATU8ZA.text: Great breakfast! Love the french toast monte cristo! Owner also has great high end restaurant in south chandler called cork. Surprised at some of the low reviews for BLD.  We enjoy coming here on the weekends and also have a nice happy hour.

LA8QwmE41AtH-stJomAhTg.text: We feel lucky to have a nice, casual, non-chain restaurant like BLD in our area! We have been there for B, L and D :), and have never had a bad meal or a bad experience.  The atmosphere is perfect - very nice, clean and unique. I feel like I could sneak in there for breakfast in yoga pants or come a bit dressed up for date night with my husband and never feel out of place. I keep meaning to come here to hang out at the bar for a happy hour or girl's night as well!  I have made a point to try a lot of things on the menu, and I have never been disappointed. Their wine list is good, coffee is excellent and the portions are generous.  I think it is very difficult to successfully combine, in one restaurant, all three meals, a bar, a dog-friendly patio, a date place, a family place, etc. - and BLD seems to do that seamlessly! I can't think of an occasion that this restaurant wouldn't be a good choice.  If it tells you anything, I can rarely get my husband excited to go sit down somewhere for dinner - but he will often proactively suggest we go to BLD!

jCd5o7eOg3AicS5XYVzhyg.text: I love the goat burger and the sweet potato fries. The waiter is always super nice and cracks jokes, makes for a great atmosphere.

qVJxqbv23UJpepczf1-tEA.text: This place is my kiddies favorite. We've never gone together until today. I was impressed with the food, but the service could've been better. The server only came by twice and ignored me the rest of the time. When you're dining with kids it can be difficult because they always need refills since the cups are so small. It would've been nice to receive some attention but other than that - no complaints!

5bzHcWVvVv957cb3e7uvzQ.text: Just had lunch with hubby here. We walked and was immediately greeted by the bar attendant. We waited to be seated after 5 minutes. Our server Joshua was not as out going as the rest of the high spirited staff. We ordered chorizo fries that we had to send back because the fries were stale. We could here him say to the cooks, can you make a new order of chorizo fries without stale fries. The new order came and they were hot and steamy, but you always second guess yourself after sending your food back. We ordered our entree which was good, a grill cheese and salad. We had left over salad that we asked for a togo box and extra dressing in which they charged us .50. I couldn't believe that. Although this is my third time here and I've had much better service during the previous visits, it will be my last. As we exited, the waitress at the bar greeted us goodbye

JEGAw06TyqsSd8Juhu_Y-A.text: I have been here twice once for breakfast and once for lunch.The service was great my first visit and awful my second. Both visits offered terrible food and was overpriced. I had hoped for a better experience the second time around. I will never return.

5BlB4Iu_CMkUjUoho7pCHg.text: The main reason BLD is getting 4 stars is because of the happy hour! $3 for sangria, any of their beers, well drinks etc. and it's until 7:00! We got there pretty early so we had no problems with the service like some of the other reviews.  I got the caprese salad which was ok, I've had better, but the toasted bread was not even worth the extra $1. My husband ordered the special which was a seared yellowtail. It was super dry but they remade it for him and he said that one was really good, and it wasn't skimpy at all. It seemed like their prices were a little high for their other entrees but I can't say if they are worth it or not. My salad was about $8.50 and the yellowtail special was $18. We would go back for happy hour - they have some good deals on appetizers too!

XUwUdEbw2yH19X8sn1qk7Q.text: The food was ok, but not on par with the price point.  The service wasn't good.  It was worth a try but there are too many other options out there, I doubt we will return.

p4pqArWXQwkbkmy9nOaA_g.text: I love the pancakes!  They also make an excellent short rib breakfast sandwich!  The decor is nice, friendly staff.  It's a nice change from a chain restaurant!

idn_PO6l53OrmJCz2pkVOw.text: Just ate here for breakfast. Not good at all. Service was great. Food was not. Potatoes were cold, bacon was cold and greasy. Biscuits and gravy were hardly edible. Only great thing is the coffee. We will not be back.

SP041HxO8J7wx5DeoAZ47w.text: We keep trying to give BLD a chance because we have been there about 10 times but, seriously, today was the LAST time.    The food has actually improved but is still just average.  What really kills it is the service, it's horrible!  Today we waited for an hour and 15 minutes for our food to come out.  The menu isn't that complicated.  Both the server and manager said, "Well, that's how it is on Sunday."  Really?   Then you should be prepared for that.  Had either one of them apologized and had even the slightest hint of customer service in them, they could have turned the experience around.  Unfortunately this wasn't the first time we had bad service and those times weren't on Sunday, so what is the excuse for those days.  Definitely wouldn't recommend going here.

mg11g4CQYcUFXT1sAINBMA.text: BLD is a good place to go for happy hour - good food, great prices, friendly service.  I used to frequent the place quite a bit because it is so close to home.  The staff knows me, remembers my drink order, and provides excellent service.  I do not recommend BLD for any type of event though. Because of the great happy hour, it seemed like a good place to have a get together with friends for a birthday.  When I inquired about reserving for up to 20 people no one there seemed to know how to handle the request.  I was finally given the business card of a manager and asked to email him.  I did that night.  The reply was a week later and I was told there was a $750 min food and beverage charge not including tip.  I responded that I was disappointed and never heard from him again.  Does BLD not want business???  I booked the gathering at the Tortilla Factory with no issues, no minimums, and with prompt and friendly service - just the standard 18% gratuity which is expected.  I can't bring myself to go back to BLD.  Their wait staff is awesome but the management is horrible.

doFUQKEpSdUiK2dNfhez3w.text: Great breakfast and lunch, food is excellent.  Great Bloody Mary's.  Friendly staff, bartenders and managers.  Always a good time!

yHfCre7H5D8W_XY8VOwc4w.text: Gotta say, I was a bit disappointed.  All my friends seem to rave about this place but I wasn't a huge fan. The food was a bit pricey but  you do get a lot of it.  I shouldn't sacrifice taste because I'm getting a large portion.   I had the fried chicken which came with mashed potatoes and it was around $15.  I think the real clincher was the service.  I realize this can be hit or miss but our service was not good at all.  The gal seemed like she really didn't want to be there and you felt bad asking for the basics such as a glass of water.  We did order drinks with our dinner as well.    Maybe we will try it out for breakfast sometime or lunch, I hear the mac and cheese is delicious.  I really doubt I will go back for dinner though.

qgZuf3KJuNbzhAFNctEjIg.text: This is a great place. We came here for breakfast and all 4 of us had the best food. The Beni was great huevos rancheros were fabulous. Coffee was superb and the service was spot on!  Perfect breakfast

MLjxa9o39S5J5eSOrdIqkQ.text: Let me start out by saying that I know many people who LOVE this place and frequent it on a regular basis.  Also, I have worked in a restaurant for the majority of my life (serving, bartending, managing...) so what I am about to say is no exaggeration.  That being said, why does it seem that every time I go there I feel like I walk in with a giant stamp on my forehead reading "PLEASE IGNORE ME AND GIVE ME TERRIBLE SERVICE"?????????    Every time it takes about 10 minutes to be greeted and another 10-15 to get our drinks (even while sitting at the bar)!   Last time my fiance and I bellied up to the bar the bartender didn't even make contact with us for 15 minutes because he was too busy bragging about that he is the "best bartender in the world"- I kid you not!  It was obvious that there were several regulars at the bar, but a bartender needs to know how to schmooze them and pour drinks for others at the same time.  I honestly don't think that guy could walk and chew gum at the same time :-/  Next, when we have actually hung around long enough to get food, it hasn't been that great.  The pancakes tasted like they are the frozen kind you pop in the microwave, the carne asada and eggs dish was sooooooooo greasy we ate about 2 bites, and the bruschetta was bland and the bread tasted like it has fake smoke seasoning on it- which needless to say was totally weird!    I feel like my family and I have just had bad experiences at BLD and as mentioned above, many people I know love this place!  Having drafts like Papago Orange Blossom will ensure I try this place again sometime- perhaps we will sit in the dining room since the patio and bar have been a bust so far!  PLEASE BLD- I WANT TO LIKE YOU!!!!!  PRO'S- Protein shakes, dog friendly patio, and great craft beer!   CON'S- Service, food (so far).....

pZxRdc2tosVYuER28kmwkg.text: The food and drinks at this place are excellent no matter what time of day you go. Breakfast or brunch is especially good! A very unique menu with some really interesting items. The brisket here is outstanding. The pico de gallo is HOMEMADE and one of my favorite things. The hollandaise is excellent. And I love the happy hour specials. Fun atmosphere and a very friendly staff. This one's a keeper.

LtOoIEzwVWEJadEkGfTCGQ.text: the food is good, really good, but the service is usually ok, and not much better than that...they seem more interested in the other staff than in the customers....it's the only downside to the creative and good dining experience.

SuIiIjtvdcpxm4XVAB1bCg.text: We just tried this place again this weekend, because I really want to like it. The menu is so enticing. However, this was our 3rd time there, and it's been a huge disappointment every time. The inside of the place looks very modern, and the food sounds amazing from the description. However, once you actually taste it, it's hard to believe how disappointing it tastes and how much you just paid. I have been there with my family every time, so I have sampled quite a few dishes. Every single one was a big let down. It's not inedible, but not very good, especially for the price.  The service has been poor each time, and we had a different server each time, all bad. Each time they have forgotten requests, 2/3 times had to come back to ask what someone ordered, and they are generally inattentive.  With regard to kids, their kids meals are ridiculous. My daughter got a plate with 3 pancakes nothing else, no meat, fruit or veg. for $6; they weren't even good pancakes. The last time we were there we asked for some fruit for my youngest. We wanted a side order of mixed fruit, and we were asked which fruits we would like. We gave a few that he might like and expected one small bowl of fruit. My 9 month old received each fruit individually in an adult size bowl nearly full, and we were charged individually. An adult couldn't have eaten all the fruit he was given, and the bananas were beyond the point I would have served them.

-i6zJQZ7PaQg9NTaQ6PKaA.text: If you're looking for a hearty breakfast with a flair of the unusual -BLD is the place to eat!!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Short ribs Benedict!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Short Ribs Benedict with potatoes topped with chorizo queso. Yummy, delicious!!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hands down the best Bloody Mary ever!!

dFaKRvNqT40nb6F6Wjsaaw.text: Great place for brunch and a Bloody Mary with bacon.  Yep bacon.  Kickback place and you can bring your pet on the patio.  Had the breakfast burrito with my road dog today and it was yummy.  It gets very busy around lunch time so be prepared to wait.  My next endeavor is the chocolate chip pancakes.  I have a feeling that they will be very good.

UP1SmDV7O-L35DLzJkzLWQ.text: This place is great. I love the food, and have always had exceptional service. Very friendly staff. The fried chicken biscuit is awesome, and the "leg day" protein shake is delicious. Their patio is dog friendly and shaded, tvs for the sports fan, and clean restrooms top it off. I'll definitely keep going here.

b3h2TsygE-LBTY5PHl6uQQ.text: I really like coming to this place. I remember when they had bacon in there waffles its was so amazing. Out of all the breakfast joints I've been to this one is the one I always never regret coming too.   My 2 go to favorites are the chicken and waffles and the green chili pork dishes. My only problem with this place is it's inconsistent. Me and my wife and sister and really my entire family really, will come here and it'll be awesome, other times...it's average. I don't know maybe they chef changes or what but its meh.   My wife orders the eggs Benedict and sometimes the egg is runny, other times its cooked. She just quit ordering it all together. Lobe hate relationship with this place I swear.

xk-2O9BKMFm0MwgTvWWTdA.text: I decided to give this place a second chance after my first visit ended in extremely slow service and nearly raw eggs that made me sick.  We expected slow service on this visit because it was a Holiday weekend.  After waiting over an hour for our food, we asked to speak to the manager who told us that this should be expected because of the Holiday and offered no apology.  He went back to the kitchen and advised us that our food would be out in five minutes. After waiting another 10 to 15 minutes, the food finally came out one meal short. We were offered no apology or discount for the forgotten meal and slow service. Nothing on our ticket was comped. I was super bummed and wanted to like this place, but for "OK" food and bad service, it is not worth it.

WQQg6eekUK1zYvbz0Ittzg.text: This place is pretty good. I had the huevos rancheros, it was a tad bit bland so I asked for an extra side of salsa. Definitely open to going back and try other entrees. Heard good things about the "Hash of the Dog".

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros

wiYtERKaFmeAdLfYCKjXRA.text: Enjoyed breakfast on the patio on Sunday.   The service was excellent, food came out quickly and warm.  Always enjoy going to BLD.

7BX2cg31mNGczOlp78TF0w.text: The services was good, but the food honestly made me feel sick after only eating half of my breakfast. Would not go back..

9q28nGHBGcqvaiXKqN2zyg.text: Our waitress and food was great, unfortunately this place has 2 of the worst hostesses I have ever seen. Spend less time being petty with each other and more time paying attention to your wait area. At one point one threw the pen down so it bounced off the clip board. Don't show that you're annoyed your busy. Unfortunate as I don't know that we'll be back.

Kcg7EYhEDhWXuPWiO-NoUw.text: The first time I went here with my family it was crazy busy and the hostess was so rude and had such an attitude. Their food is good, but way over priced. Every time I go to eat their for breakfast the waitresses are rude. I get better service at IHOP or dennys. Maybe good if you're just calling in the order.

a93BqihooXCkjVrt6HiPDw.text: Chicken and Waffles here are awesome! However I should venture out a bit next time and try something new next time (2nd time ordering it).   The lunch and dinner menu look great, too! We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

_Al1sncc91LZZEviI30SqQ.text: Recommended...So, heard about this place while watching the D-Backs pre game show. It is a wonderful place! Great service ( Christine and Linda)..awesome food and a very nice, upbeat atmosphere yet relaxed feeling. The food exceeded our expectations and the coffee is great! Not that usual bland, so-so taste but a  real, flavorful, rich tasting cup of coffee!  Oh.. the restroom design is unique, too!  the prices are in line with what you would expect and the portions match  the price so it was a reasonable tab.   Do you like bacon jam? Yep! They have that!!!

SfvwAi04AmQzsN-mysyfHA.text: After hearing so many people talk about this place we decided to try it. Not impressed. Food had no flavor and it wasn't just my dish...everyone at my table didn't care for it. I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt they had an off day and I may try them again.

VWCN60dIZiq9lnxddFb_fA.text: This place is a bit of a drive from my house, but so far it seems worth it.  I have had excellent and quick service on my visits. It's a very nice restaurant with friendly staff.  I have only gotten the Benedict Florentine for breakfast as it was so good I haven't switched up.  My eggs were poached well just enough hollandaise sauce and the marinated portabella mushrooms are great.  Special mention for the potatoes that come with them.  It's not your run of the mill hash-browns.  They are skin on baked russet potatoes with onions and they are delicious.  I will be back.  They even have a drive through to call in and get breakfast to go, very cool.  Try:  - Benedict Florentine - The Potatoes

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Benedictine florentine, yum.

w-InxIA89D7qmG1eTqaL2A.text: Tonight was our second time at BLD.  I think the service is great! The servers we have had were both very attentive and nice! They visited the table just enough and even asked us how our drinks were! normally servers don't ask about your drink:)    The first time we visited was for bfast! Yummy! We had the Monte Cristo sandwich and the Green Chili pork.  Both were yummy! The chili was a bit sweeter and milder than expected so if you like spicy- add tabasco!  The Monte Cristo yummy! Ask for extra jam on the side!   Visit 2- happy hour!  We had the chorizo chili fries-yummo! Meatball Mac and cheese- score!  Prosciutto salad- perfect!    We like to support local small businesses and this place is really good!

_mO77sb4Aj_BTl-eaHwGlw.text: My current favorite restaurant!  I have been coming here since the first day they opened and have watched the menu evolve.  I am sad that some of my favorite things disappeared, but there are still a lot of amazing choices.  Thick cut bacon - this is really more of a bacon-steak than any thick cut bacon I have had elsewhere.  You have to try it!  Mimosas - on Sundays, bottles of champagne are $10.  Order a bottle and a glass of oj and mix your own :)  Sangarita - they have a not so amazing margarita on tap...mix it with the red sangria though and it is great.  Prosciutto and fried goat cheese salad - This is so good, I have started making my own copy cat version to take to work for lunch everyday (minus the fried part.)  Since I am usually dining alone, I almost always sit at the bar.  The bartenders and servers are friendly and fun to talk to.  The owner and managers greet me by name (ok, maybe I come here a bit too often.)  I would give it 5 stars, but I don't like any of the food choices on the happy hour menu.  For happy hour, I would much rather go to their sister restaurant, Cork, a couple miles down the road.

aljpRFlby6rd7aKHEvVoEA.text: Meh.  This is a 2.5 star review that I've rounded to 3, because 2 seemed a bit too brutal.  Food is expensive for what it is.  Sandwich I had was OK, but iced tea was SO bad, and was clearly out of a tap, not fresh-brewed.  Really?  What restaurant does THAT?  No doubt more expensive than using the "real" stuff, and everyone who had it in our party asked for something else to replace it.  Potato salad was acceptable but kinda supermarket-ish. Not bad, not great, likely won't be back - nothing compelling and lots of good choices in the area.

azUuhwCT1aSihD91OIiOyQ.text: Sat here listening to obscene comments by other patrons. Hmm? Mgmt didn't do anything to rectify or make things more comfortable. Hmm? Food is ok.

ysSFHrGqYWOvAmlICJgUGQ.text: In a word: underwhelming. I'm saddened and frustrated, really. BLD is a cool place with a fantastic pedigree that I want so badly to like, but it just won't let me.  Today's breakfast was my second visit. The first was for lunch shortly after opening. It was an unmitigated disaster. I gave them the benefit of the doubt at that time, but can't avoid Yelping at this point.  Had the short ribs Benedict. Although the eggs were poached nearly perfectly, they were covered in a bland red wine Hollandaise that looked like melted Silly Putty and lacked the citrusy brightness that a good Holalndaise should have. The short ribs were pot-roasty, rather than the velvety melt-in-your mouth delight that you'd expect. Overall, the dish was under-seasoned and wan, but you couldn't complain that the short ribs were too rich.  The side of potatoes and onions was good with the exception of the fact that the onions were inconsistently cooked; some were crunchy while others were soft and beginning to brown. I'd prefer better browning and a nice crust, but seasoning was spot-on here at least.  My wife had the Spaniard scramble, which arrived looking more like an omelette gone bad than a scramble. The linguica provided the only seasoning; sadly it was underrepresented and the rest of the dish needed salt.  My latte was great, and at a $0.50 premium over brewed coffee, can't be beat.  On both visits, the staff has been a disappointment. Today's server was clearly trained NOT to ask how things were. Either that, or she was oblivious. She didn't return to check in once during our meal and delivered our check silently. The hostess was cute but clueless. I forgot my morning paper in the car, and when I went outside to get it, she welcomed me for a second time when I returned. She did an admirable job of pretending she remembered I'd already been seated in the half-empty restaurant when I told her I had a table, at any rate.  As a big fan of Cork, BLD has been a tremendous disappointment on two visits. While I'd like to be a regular at one of the spacious booths every weekend, I guess I'll have to settle for a trip to Cork every few months instead.

us9pID1FkNPVNWfFGRKhZQ.text: The first time I was here I came with a friend for lunch. The steak tacos were good.  My friends chicken sandwich looked awesome and the sweet potato fries were crisp and fresh.   Just tried the $3 house merlot at happy hour and so far I'm a believer. Waiting for the food now. Be right back.    Ok. Tomato bacon soup and grilled cheese worth the $5 price tag. Beware: the tomato soup is spicy! SIZZLE!  The steak quesadilla in a green tortilla could have used less cheese but the steak was tender and reminded me of Korean BBQ. Yummy for $7.  Finally, we had the pita pizza which was a meal in itself. Tons of arugula with nicely melted goat cheese and a fair amount of prosciutto made this OK for a $7 pick.   The place has a great decor but I can see where it is hit or miss. I was fortunate to have a great wait staff on both occasions but then again the restuarant was empty. The vibe is wonderful but they have to have consistency in service or food for it to survive.  I wish them luck - I personally would like to see a place like this survive.

C0QjkxOlFX8Co_st7sfHWw.text: Excellent brunch specials servers and unique food delights that are an excitement in your mouth and senses...wine and fun with friends

hvLPq4c-Qq9ijuyyYlwVlg.text: We used to love this place and would go for breakfast a few times a month. The servers used to be great and i loved the short rib benedict. However, the past two times were just plain bad. First they mess with the menu too much, they don't seem to be able to handle peek times anymore and they mess up the food orders. This last time we had to send the food back twice and we saw two tables get up and leave they were so irritated. We have crossed this off and will not be back.

W8AILAEJS17jQHJ4ZDG72Q.text: Will have to try this again. Used to go every Saturday for breakfast and a couple times a month for dinner and happy hour. After the ownership/management changed everything that made it special disappeared, including the staff. As the prior poster commented, don't even get me start on the clocks. Always wondered if they stole them from The Good Egg.

xjDOI6cYILGBHYqHsdgVsQ.text: I wanted to like this place, but I think for me it fell short. The interior is great, very clean, and I love what they've done with the space. I ordered the seared tuna and a beet salad, and the tuna was just.. eek. I understand "pepper crusted" is right there on the menu, but it felt like eating a tablespoon of black pepper! The salad was okay, but the beets were undercooked, and the dressing was kinda bland. The service was good, and my partner enjoyed his meal, but for me I'm not sure I'd come back again.

MwnBu6o8dOpRnbpZkRZhiw.text: I've eaten breakfast here twice and lunch once so far. Our base this review on breakfast.  My wife and I headed there on a Thursday morning around 10 and had our pick of tables.  Service - Our server was particularly friendly and my coffee never went empty.  Food - If a breakfast place has chicken fried steak, I usually get it. I'm glad I got it here as it is the real deal. Not some over processed frozen brick, but actual cube steak done up right. Comes with side of eggs and potatoes.  Price - You pay a bit for atmosphere, which speaking of, this place does have a "cool" vibe.  I would definitely recommend you trying this place out. I think it would be tough to be disappointed. I'd like to try happy hour next as their food prices look amazing.

isZbZxYp6ZduyU5xhUkGeA.text: Thought the fish tacos were pretty good, wifey got the chicken wrap and that was darn tasty! Definitely a fan of bld!

oOoCWDcJq64cFgv27A9EHg.text: The patio sucks!!!! We waited 30min just to get a menu 47 minutes past and still nothing!!! We thought it was a great place for my dog! She even saw us!!!Not even water or coffee!! She didn't even take our drinks!  Terrible service!!! Never going there again. Wish to give it zero starts.

jrrNP2Ait97pp3Z6oVQtPA.text: If I could give no stars I would. We hadn't been to BLD in about a year because the food was so awful but we came back to give it a second try. Huge mistake. Food was cold. Tasted like it came out of plastic wrapper in the freezer. Disgusting. And none of us feel well after our meal.  Friends side of potatoes took FOREVER like 25 minutes forever. Then they wouldn't take it off of the bill.   Service was extremely slow.   We will not be returning. Ever.

WPRHpxXL1MlFIdkx3IxjKw.text: We have been here before and are a fan of Monte Cristo sandwiches so we decided to go for lunch today. The service and atmosphere was good. A few Chandler workers were having lunch but the place was not full by any means. The side potatoes were very good. But, the Monte Cristo had a funny flavor that both my wife and I picked up on. It was ok... but not something I would go back for. Something just tasted strange. It seemed overpriced too. We had two Monte Cristos and one iced tea. After the tip it was over $30. Too much for a couple sandwiches for lunch. I don't think we will go back..

0yrkK4du7tU6u676yIqxuA.text: I'm not much of a reviewer unless I feel it necessary, maybe 3 or 4 times, but I finally saw the picture perfect 1star review at BLD so I have to share. I have been here a handful of times but obviously in last 3 or 4 months management or ownership has changed.  Food portion was small and subpar at best and the service was almost the worst I have ever had. Totally cold and unwelcoming.  I won't go into detail where it was wrong specifically but I will not be back to BLD.

7CErSw0Esm3LSpL7RmISPg.text: Our first time at BLD was tonight (11/15/11) and it was absolutely FABULOUS!  Rick was our server - everything went perfectly. Since it was our first time, I took some suggestions from him and I am very glad I did!  I had the braised short ribs with Parmesan Risotto...(if you have never tried it...it is a MUST!!)  The service was very good, the food even better!  I am glad that Chandler is starting to get some really good places to eat like BLD.  I highly suggest that you go.  Loved the decor, atmosphere, and everything about it...can't wait to go back!

weqV3V_a4QEhFk5zbmjGaw.text: My boyfriend & I  came here for brunch. French toast was yummy..a little dry though. Overall it was a good experience. Service was prompt, very nice decor & ambiance. Portions were sizable. Hands down the BEST dirty chai latte ANYWHERE! and I travel all over the for work. TOTALLY worth the trip if only for the Dirty Chai!

GT5hdBN9dsF_GDInxtDkWw.text: I have been coming to BLD for a while. Their breakfast is what is the biggest draw for me. I really feel that they are competitive for one of the best eggs benidicts in the valley. the classic ham eggs and hollandaise. They do offer other versions, however I am a purist in this sense and they nail it. Another big draw for me is the barista. Their lattes and Iced dirty chai drinks are my favorite. I feel like they are at a high level of quality. They make a great spicy bloody mary as well. BLD has a good happy hour with several apps and drinks on special. I used to think they were trying to go to big with lunch and dinner in the past and it was a bit of a turnoff for me, but I have recently tried them again for lunch and I was impressed. It looked like their menu had been simplified a bit and I really enjoyed it. Pro Tip - if you go for breakfast on the weekend go early! there are a few big churches nearby and it can quickly fill up. Also if you are in a hurry in the AM they have a drive through for the barista. I even think they accept call in orders to be picked up at the window.

wZ9t2vzL8CBhgna5o8qWAw.text: Met some friends here for breakfast. The server was friendly enough but it took FOREVER  to receive anything we ordered. Attempting to pay our bill took a really long time as well. Nice atmosphere, can't say I was duly impressed with this place. In a pinch I would go back. Nothing to write home about. Food was standard.

7ilrTl2JgBuDb4eC-Oq87w.text: I was surprised at the quality of the food that I ordered; the breakfast burrito. I had looked at the photos on yelp and to be honest I was really hesitant to stop in here as it didn't look appetizing to me. Burrito was pretty large - maybe 10 inches. The salsa that came with it was fresh and had a good flavor. Staff was friendly. I sat on the patio and there were some people out there with their dogs; not something that I appreciate.

b1R_UcZg5h20Wbs_wnuhSQ.text: Been here numerous times. I like to give restaurants a number of chances in case its an off day, for me or them.Two times my daughters have gotten sick off fish( salads and dinner plate). Been there a five or six   times for breakfast, cold biscuits,gravy and hash browns. Biscuits didn't taste fresh and ask them to heat it up and still came out cold. Servers always seem like there in a rush, even if there are 6 people in there.  I would go during a busy time and get a hamburger so you know   it's fresh.  A much better breakfast place is Biscuits cafe ,down the street.

sWA1YYf1unNmy7jKrxfmEw.text: BLD has early morning Happy Hour from 7am-9am.... am I still dreaming???  It's an excuse to enjoy a cocktail before Target even opens! So. Much. Yes. We ordered, and kept ordering. The drinks were strong and our server was ambitious. No photos because... well, we were enjoying ourselves too much. Order the captain crunch waffles, green Chile Benedict, biscuits&gravy, croissant sandwich we walked out $70 poorer but we had tons of leftovers and a great breakfast!

x_9KFlG-bb2SMgp4_t3Yfg.text: Our service was incredible but not only that the  Cajun citrus chicken tacos were delicious. The family got pancake breakfast and simple breakfast, both were good and tasty. Also got an order of fried cauliflower with aioli that was spectacular, I could eat this everyday. Pancakes were good but average but I would definitely come back.  Mules and mimosa's are a must.

b_Y06xXuuDADetqbUf4XzA.text: I'm not sure if I loved the food or I was just awed by the fabulous service. Gregory who was wearing all the hats this evening gets the 5 stars . Amazing knowledge of the ginormous menu as well as keeping cool while running around. The Tuna appetizer was delicious My sandwich was huge and dessert had me licking the plate clean.  I would recommend this place to family and friends especially when Gregory is on his shift Friday Saturday Sunday and Monday nights . I'm a fan   They are lucky to have such a wonderful employee...if I open a restaurant I'm stealing him . Lol

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Best Bloody Mary in the East Valley

cVNmZ0fM1vbjHfj57vhfuQ.text: Great bloody Mary's and a great breakfast menu - servings are gigantic - great service here too - sit outside!

7Kti50DHOunpqdxUzw666Q.text: Jay is a fantastic server, so attentive and polite to all needs. This restaurant is FANTASTIC. Hands down best brunch and lunch in chandler ! The food is hot and fresh, I absolutely love the Monte Cristo and the wings and the bbq....just don't even give it a second thought and come here and freaking enjoy yourself! Oh they also have superb mimosa flights.

BIgOEpVVNRgYPhBozlOVWg.text: I know be are a handful, 20 hungry people drinking cocktails wanting late lunch on a Saturday.. but the service and food at BLD Chandler is fantastic. I'm so glad I chose this place. Upscale food and cocktails, and such friendly service. I would do it again in a heartbeat. Thank you Micah - for making my birthday special.

pFYJSP6zTBVAA6X3Z2fqoQ.text: My sister had brought me home some food from BLD last week. It was a deep fried cauliflower and chorizo fries. These are appetizers on the menu, but the serving size is humongous! But that's a good thing because it's plenty of bang for your buck and it tastes amazing. Like the name of the place clearly states, they serve breakfast lunch and dinner all day. So I decided I would come try out the food for myself. The one bad thing about that is they have about 6 menus with a lot of food items on there, which makes it really hard to make a decision.  They had a special for a bottle of champagne for mimosas for only $18, so I got that with my sister. I also got the turkey croissant sandwich with sweet potato fries. If you read my reviews you know I love blue cheese dressing and or Ranch dressing for my fries. My server told me they didn't have classic blue cheese dressing but they had a red wine blue cheese dressing. I said oh that's nice let me try it please. It ended up being more of a vinaigrette... Pretty watery and highly "vinegar-y." It's clearly more of a salad dressing that a dipping sauce. Luckily for me they had ranch dressing so I was able to enjoy my fries the way I like them. The sandwich was pretty good, but I have had many like it before.  We went there on a Sunday at about 1PM and it was busy, but no wait times. There were a few large parties and plenty of smaller groups dining. The restaurant space is a good size, so it did not feel crowded. Overall it was an OK experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Turkey croissant, sweet potato fries and red wine blue cheese dressing.

Just an unfortunate experience overall.
