xhrLa_t-rYmm6S0Rgc9xhg.text: Good food. Slow service. Our waitress had to continuously apologize for their kitchen.

CVIRpFdQxT3um2e9JfSqJQ.text: We showed up on Saturday morning with a party of 8, unexpected as our "reservations" at another restaurant were not honored. BLD staff went out of their way to get us seated at a big, comfortable table that could accommodate the elderly people in our party. Wait staff was fantastic, the manager of the restaurant truly understood the value of customer service as he retrieved a blanket for my 91 yr old mother to provide her comfort in her chair. Food and drinks were delivered quickly and the food is terrific. You have my business going forward BLD, thank you!  You made our morning a happy success after being treated poorly by another restaurant.

IWSHtxIC2_2Fy-ZKU_jRbw.text: I came here for brunch for the very first time. May I say their food portion is huge! I really enjoyed their portion size. I liked their sangria drink and their chicken tacos. Would I come here again? Of course, it's a great place to just sit down and socialize with friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

Bmz9dKmrq3SJFhoQX-Umnw.text: I give it two stars simply due to the food. I would never eat here again but the server was very considerate, her name is Linda. She understood we did not like our food and attempted to accommodate anyway she could. Maybe try lunch or dinner here but surely not a breakfast place to eat!

O-hWbXJMOj1gFQiEtdjOCA.text: This morning my wife and daughter ended up here by accident. What a pleasant surprise.  We were seated right away and the place was packed.. Smelled really good too. Kevin Falcone was our server and he was awesome. The menu was rather large and a lot to look at so, as I usually do at a place I've never been to, I asked for his recommendation and it didn't disappoint. I got the craziest spicy bloody Mary with bacon and all kinds of stuff in it. It was delicious.  I said I could do with something hearty like maybe a burger? Well... This thing was not only a monster, but super tasty and holy moly... If you like to just blast your taste buds (and have a strong heart) get a side of the hickory smoked garlic butter. I dipped my burger and sweet potato fries in it, cause.. garlic butter. It makes anything better lol.  So, anyways... Can't wait to go back and try something else. To sum up... Great food, comfortable and casual atmosphere, Kevin. I'll be back.

KXPqqmMOAWTOuNU8zAUrCw.text: Blown away!! This place is an incredible place. The interior is so cool and the staff was super friendly and helpful. I was overwhelmed by the options on the menu. It took me 10 mins just figure out what I wanted. Everything seem amazing but I ended up getting what I know and normally get. Most of the meals are make by order so it s super fresh when you get it. I highly recommend this place.

dNvEyPtIfsPAr_D74E7wyQ.text: Wanted to give kudos to Micah. Exceptional service and very attentive. His recommendations were spot on. I can't wait to go back!!!

TPd5QESW4e1jgylFRLJLKQ.text: Love this place!!  Visited today on my birthday and they surprised me with ice cream for dessert!  Falcone "Mr. Clemson" is our favorite even though we are Bama fans!  Always GREAT food and SERVICE!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Visited today and the gracious staff treated me to ice cream at breakfast for my b&#39;day! Great food and staff!  Falcone is our favorite!

CwozNjmJlFatVMJg5wcmuw.text: Great food, great decor, but no atmosphere. Pump the music a little louder to create a hipper vibe and take the jelly carrier, plastic photo holder, and wire hold-all of the table. The phone chargers at the table are awesome, but the place feels like Grandpa with 50 years of diner experience had too much input.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Jelly carrier, plastic photo holder, and wire hold-all, the place feels like Grandpa with 50 years of diner experience had too much input.

Ri06VVaw99Z9yhdIOoV_TQ.text: We've been in a few times recently for breakfast, once in the dining room which was a good experience but my review is really based on the last three times we sat at the bar. Each time we've had Bill as our Bartender/Server, each time he has done an awesome job. He is completely in touch with the bar and patrons dining at the bar and never leaves you hanging waiting for drinks, food or answers to questions. The food has been amazing each time (today I had the corned beef hash which was awesome) and we always leave glad we came. The unfortunate thing is we're moving to the Cave Creek area and now our drive will be much longer to get there. We wished we had visited sooner. Great environment, positive energy.

dVw3Q9nPxfaGa4B6Y_10Og.text: The green chili pork breakfast tostadas are so good!  Service is good and they make a decent drink at the bar. I like that they treat me like family when I go in.

dSSDlA-_aMEZ8exUZREaeg.text: Brunch: Making morning binge drinking seem classy since forever.  I woke up this morning, checked my texts, and suddenly I'm at brunch with the guys and a boy [the cutest 4-month old baby boy at that!].  Everybody ordered their food, some bussers knocked over a huge trashcan, and suddenly champagne bottles were rolling across the floor.  Surprisingly, the baby doesn't cry.  Phew.  Our hostess was pretty unfriendly but the waitress was a peach!  I had ordered The Cali Eggs Benedict [bacon, grilled tomato, avocado, topped with hollandaise, and includes breakfast potatoes.  $12.25] and it was alright.  The hollandaise was creamy and smooth but lacking that lemon juice tangy tartness.  Still though, those eggs were poached beautifully.  The bacon was also pretty fantabulous and cooked perfectly.  As for a random wedge of avocado on the side, it kind of felt like they forgot to put the avocados on top and just stuck it there.  Oh well.  The bites I had of the House Made Biscuits and Sausage Gravy [two eggs, apple wood smoked bacon with breakfast potatoes.  $12.75] were super flavorful.  You can tastes the fat in that sausage gravy.  I can see myself gaining 5lbs just eating that.  Oh man.  As for breakfast potatoes, there's not much you can say about them.  They're crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, and needed some ketchup love.  Overall, I had a decent brunch with great company.  Perhaps with all my attention on making faces at the baby, my meal wasn't too note-worthy.  I wouldn't mind coming back for brunch though!

BXqfsHZefz6RAyAfKgjKPw.text: This place just keeps getting better. Had the special which was Chorizo Chilaquiles and it was amazing. Would love to see this on the breakfast menu. We always sit at the bar and the staff is wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

g9HljPeYKcsPJVRr17fgmg.text: Good local brunch spot. We love that it has a dog friendly patio. . Any of their  Benedict options  are all good to choices. The wait times can be hard around brunch times but  they do a decent job moving people in and out.

icqPH4JahnZOZ1_nSrs1bQ.text: Food was good, service was decent, atmosphere was great.  Our server was a little short here and there but I think she realized this and tried to make up for it later in our stay. I got the steak tacos which tasted good but maybe could've been cooked a little less. They had a great kids menu and lots of options for the adults.

3ma-j9elkDqCp_8HuW7oyA.text: Excellent food. Amazing homemade spicy vodka for their bloody Mary's and great coffee. Host and wait staff, however, is consistently subpar.

rQbMOFe2nDcNb_aaO53QBQ.text: I found a Retaraunt called "bld" yesterday that I am going to call home. It was such a treat. We sat at the bar where there was a very knowledgeable bartender(Tim) He took the time to answer ALL of our Menu questions.I had a fruity Moscow  Mule,and it was delicious !They have a Vast array of Beers also. The steak and BBQ were to die for. I highly recommend this place !

bjeQ-qePDNEQfmduiF7pBA.text: BLD has a really cool patio to sit on. Ordered the Cali Benedict and was not impressed. The hollandaise sauce was not my favorite. My friend ordered the other burrito which she said was delicious. Service was quick and fast!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

zPRbz3-_RKZ77-Mq2kqnjA.text: It's a shame that I felt the need to update my review after our last visit to BLD.  We used to live close by, so we'd come for happy hour quite often.  I still love the sangria, although I didn't notice it advertised on the menu anymore.  I had to ask the bartender to make sure they still had it.    This time, we ordered the chorizo chili fries.  We had ordered this previously and loved it.  It used to come with a dollop of sour cream, green onions and tomatoes on top.  It now just comes with the chili.  It was super disappointing because it needs that bit of cool creaminess and crunch on top to really make this a dish worth ordering again.    We also ordered the seared ahi tuna, which we had also ordered here previously.  It had about 6 slices of tuna and a blob of hummus with roasted red peppers on top.  The tuna was sitting on a tasty wasabi cream sauce.  When we had ordered this item before, it came with pita chips to eat the hummus with.  This time, there were no pita chips in sight and the bartender told us they didn't have them anymore at all.  What is the point of wasting money by putting hummus on a plate when there is no medium by which to scoop it up?  They might as well lower the food cost of the menu item and delete the hummus all together.  I think if they added a sesame slaw or something on the side, it would go much better and it would actually look like a cohesive dish.    I think the problem with BLD is that they have too extensive of a menu.  If they narrowed it down and concentrated on making fewer items into more stellar dishes, people would be more likely to return.  That's just my hospitality degree talking.

ZTyJViynmue3aBrVVKpucg.text: For the Women's Cup Final, 14 of us went to BLD to watch the game and to have a drink. There were 3 parties there. Our big party, 2 women in a booth and a sad lady at the bar. We arrived a little late and it looked like my friends had ordered drinks and snacks and when the US scored, we cheered! How exciting! We loved watching sports @ BLD. Then...the female bartender "shushed" us. She shushed us? For cheering in a bar/restaurant? In a very, very empty bar I might add. This is not a library, my friend. Game over. My girlfriends saw that terrible act and gesture as well and said the other bartender was giving them sass so that was the final straw. He said something along the lines of, "You guys need to be more quiet since there are other patrons here." Right, ONE other patron. Give me a freaking break. We asked for checks and left. The sad lady at the bar seemed to be the female bartender's friend. She looked like a hot mess and was visibly frazzled. Sorry, not my problem. She was still drinking champagne though so it couldn't have been THAT bad. The two girls in the booth left by the time we got our checks. They were most likely not impressed by the staff as well. It was appalling. Did something change? Ownership? Management? BLD just lost a TON of business. Yesterday and the future. It was convenient since we all work at Intel and live within a few miles. BLD you have lost patrons that used to love going to your place to watch a game. But this type of service has unraveled the fact that your menu is mediocre and over priced. We found out later that evening from a friend that BLD has had a number of food code violations. No wonder the place is empty. Link for last year's article: phoenix.about.com/od/hea... BLD - Below average, Low quality Dining. I'll be going to The Ivy Mediterranean Lounge right next door from now on and so should all of you.

baOGJ2JsIWDumZZfihDR8w.text: Love this place!! Sunday morning it was just great!! We took my mother-in-law for breakfast and she loved it... I always order a BLT and I guess it was to early lol I had to order something different so I went with the Hawaiian pancakes not bad but not a BLT :(   Overall great food thank you!

-W6OiEQBCTt70k00IVfVYQ.text: Okay, let me start with a few things that we absolutely LOVE about BLD:  - the food is awesome!  Bring your appetite because the portions are generous.  We've tried breakfast & lunch and haven't been disappointed.  - the vibe is pretty cool. The setting is really clean and comfortable.  - they have a super pet-friendly patio. The staff is all very accommodating and bring water and treats for your four legged companions.   Okay, here's what we didn't like:  - our server was SUPER slow. Our drinks were never refilled and our plates were left on our table until we had to ask for them to be removed.  We also had to ask her to bring our check AND pick it up. It's annoying and totally detracts from the overall awesomeness of the restaurant.   We'll be back. It was isolated (we hope) and I hope to re-write this post. For now, this is where it is.

8a9PdlVrGzqExI6eIXKhAA.text: I like this place a lot. It is a clean modern style with a full bar and amazing drinks. Everything on the menu has been delicious. It is not a place to come if you are in a hurry. It is relaxing and laid back.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

jlF6T0ysUdWPTZuTM4LzSQ.text: Great spot for brunch. Food was very tasty and service was quick. I would visit again. They also serve mimosas and Bloody Mary's for those that are looking to pair off your food with a nice drink. Staff was very attentive and ambiance was great. Next time I will try the seating outside.

RkUb98PzPAK3Rzzi2XZCVA.text: Ok I must admit, we were expecting the original BLD when we pulled up for breakfast. Decided to stay because the wait wasn't too long and the menu looked to be vast. We were sat on the patio, which has heaters galore but not one of them was lit (it was one of Arizona's cold mornings and since we are Phoenicians, anything under 70 is chilly!). It took 7 minutes for a server to come and greet us. We said we wanted to order right away since our daughter was doing the baked pancake. It took another 5 minutes to get the drinks out (water, coffee, apple juice). The server was kind and even made a remark that they rolled out a new menu and she wasn't one bit familiar with it (bizarre). I sat at the restaurant and started reading the reviews on Yelp. Seems like 3 stars is the going rate and that this new BBQ place is riding off of the original BLD. The food was mediocre. Overall, not worth the $75.00 we spent and we won't be back. Menu must have over 60 items and everyone that works there seems to walk around stressed. Owner always responds saying he appreciates the feedback but where are the changes being made? We miss the OG BLD.

Lrkx3GWUdjVRUu1CW5X_2Q.text: Yeah grumpy pyscho Nickie is gone. Hopeful BLD puts that train wreck behind them, staff is happy again.  And get rid of the clock wall thats just bizarre and creepy.

IfWLBJaizep4vF9rY4QYQQ.text: Another hidden gem in Chandler. We tried this for dinner and were wowed. The sandwiches are so large and unique. Easy to share we learned so next time we can have a dessert. Fresh cut onion rings. Great selection of beers on tap. Can't wait to try for breakfast. Did I forget our waiter Marcos. Awesome! We will be back. I do have lunch waiting for me tomorrow in my fridge.

REN6UfSOUMfVrV8ERFWEXw.text: Nice casual atmosphere. Fast friendly service. Great burgers! Great sides! Decent craft beers. Yummy coffee desserts. Fair prices. Definitely will be back. Bonus: dog friendly patio.

HvP_hdvf6PdDi4zYwjLPqQ.text: Great job Kevin - service and food were awesome! My husband and I were in the mood for BBQ AND IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!!

jdOYKwKQyDA0PhQ2gW6hbA.text: Worst service ever! I would leave 0 starts if I could. My family and I were seated pretty quickly but waited over 20 mins just for a server to even acknowledge us. The server finally came around but took drinks order for another group and this group came in AFTER us. When she did come around to our table...10 mins after checking in with the group who came in after us...we told her that we were ready to order. She didn't take our order and instead let us know that she will be back. We waited another 5 mins and decided to walk out. I would NOT ever recommend coming here unless you want to get treated like crap.

aGCN1qs90UpPX6pvRWCyaA.text: Very basic breakfast fare at super expensive prices.  Also ordered a burger.  Very good beef, but the $13 price tag is steep.  The ambiance is a bit modern and cold, and service is hit or miss.  Lots of competition for the buck right in this mall, so I think they need to offer some items that are a bit better value.

s45dT5AlvutsuEWlSxFlsQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants great service and the food is delicious, . I found the establishment to be very clean. Enjoy my visit to BLD.

5j8HlFEDcvV4CAQB2wrmQg.text: After 10 months we decided to give BLD another chance. Another fail. Got our order wrong and then some kid tried to give us someone else's food. When we stated we had already finished our meal and that he had the wrong table, he had the gall to ask, "Are you sure?"  Seriously? On top of that, we basically got Denny's food. BLD, you had better right the ship quickly, because you are sinking faster than the Titanic. (And pretty empty for Sunday afternoon) Won't be going back.

OD6nItXahHLt6IjyolRUjA.text: Wife and I stopped in for breakfast on a whim. Inside decor is trendy/chic and the service staff were all amazingly friendly and helpful. We did not experience any sort of disinterest from any of them as some of the other reviewers have noted.  My wife ordered biscuits and gravy and I ordered the California eggs Benedict (bacon, egg, avocado). Food came quickly, but unfortunately my wife had to send back her biscuits and gravy because it was not the traditional white sausage-gravy she was expecting and hoping for. Instead, it was some kind of brown gravy that had an odd taste. It would have been great on meatloaf, but not breakfast biscuits. The waitress apologized and offered something new, to which my wife requested French toast. The manager stopped by and also apologized that she didn't enjoy the meal and told her the replacement would be out asap. Once received, the French toast was adequate enough for her to eat half, but not to finish.  Meanwhile, my meal was also just mediocre. The hollandaise sauce was exceptionally sour/tart and not rich/savory like I've always had from other restaurants. I had to look up recipes when I got home so I could learn how hollandaise is made to help pinpoint what I was tasting. Turns out most recipes call for lemon juice, so I'll just assume my breakfast got a triple shot. As heavy-handed as they were with the lemon, everything else lacked notable seasoning and flavor. The eggs were watery tasting and bland, the bacon appeared to be standard, thin-cut Oscar Mayer, and the mashed up avocado (nearly guacamole) lacked salt and was a bit bitter; possibly under-ripe.

wcKnk06mola9nIXx1gfTOg.text: Great place to eat! We went for lunch & it was my friend's first time there and got the Monti Cristo and loved it. The service was great & our server was attentive. Will definitely go again. While the weather is good, great to sit in the patio!

6uFQeg2iBOMZYLDqMCxlxQ.text: The best food I've had a long time! The kids cheeseburger was enough to feed my husband. Super yummy and really fun place for a drink and hang out

3y3dhPPC92PY3J5Z_o1syw.text: Food was decent. Not the best ever but not bad, at all. The prices are like dinner prices. My wife and I spent about $30. I had the carne asada and eggs and she had the biscuits and gravy.   The portions were large, though. They get you on the sides and drinks. Not that cheap, but again, decent food.

VqAJo5VjEMC7wLG2q0x_1Q.text: This place is really nice.   Would definitely come back for a date night.  I would recommend splitting a meal.  Proportions are HUGE.  The BLD burger is awesesome but just tooo big.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Eating area with bar behind

B6h11DGSdteuNMXUj2L39A.text: We love BLD's food and the service is usually excellent.  We have felt unsafe on the dog friendly patio though in the past due to dogs fighting and large dogs we felt were poorly controlled.  If you have kids with you, you should think about sitting inside.

C07wVeE2p3Vw-_ZlvE5TZg.text: This was my first time here. I liked the ambiance. Very nice looking restaurant. Clean. Staff seemed friendly. As far as the food goes it was good but not impressive. Nothing made me say "wow this is really good. I want to keep coming back here." Nothing wrong with it. I just left with my socks still on. I have had better breakfast food elsewhere. Now I might go back and try some other things and see if my opinon changes but that remains to be seen. The menu did look like it had some good options and the price was pretty good. So I might give it one more try but for now it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine

qaQgTGA9jNfhFCsLKtrdag.text: The only good thing is the service was decent. The food is way overpriced and the flavor is off. For someone who is counting calories, I chose BLD as my cheat meal. I'm so mad I wasted the calories & money. My chicken and waffles was bland, the chicken taste likes nothing, literally and the eggs are the same story. My husband's plate tasted like onions with some steak on the side (he hates onions and was not told it was on the fried steak). We both agreed McDonald's has better tasting food. The mimosa tastes like cheap champagne. I will not be back. A tip for the chefs at bld, don't try to recreate the wheel. At this rate you'll be wanting to sell square wheels, figuratively speaking. You're trying too hard to make your food look good, and it tastes pretty horrible.

zvasf0gokwWc9w4QwRzo5Q.text: I used to love going for breakfast at BLD especially because they are dog friendly. I haven't been back since they apparently changed management. We were there after a morning of hiking and there was no one there... it was 3pm their slowest time. We were the only people on the patio. They took forever to take our order and then didn't even seat us. Two girls were at the bar and pointed to the patio. My daughter ordered a smoothie that was on the menu they finally brought. The food was good however very plain. The server seemed irritated that we were there. She asked if she could bring more water and my daughter asked for another smoothie....to this the server said, "no, could you order something easier" !!!! we thought she was teasing but wasn't. She said they were very difficult to make and took time so she couldn't do another one. Mind you, there were two girls at the bar and NO customers. My daughter then asked for juice. the server said, "as long as it was easy"!!!!! WHAT! I tipped her 20% because i work in retail however i am livid that i allowed her to refuse us what was clearly on the menu. These new servers are a reflection on the ownership and management and the sad part is that she was probably the manager!!!!!!! Needless to say I was highly disappointed! the only reason you got TWO stars is because I could have my dog there. AND she never offered the dog water or a treat! Take head from other pet friendly restaurants!!!!!!

-0QfSYBlrlE4MzbEdB97IQ.text: We used to love this place and perhaps it was just a bad visit but there was a table two down from us that complained to management.   The food was hard and cold and tasted like we were the last ones to the buffet when there is no buffet there.  Our table was near their computer so we heard a lot of personal conversation but when the manager pretends to fire everyone and asks them why they do what they do in such a tone, it brings down our dining experience mood.  Even with us being so close to where everyone congregated, we left feeling much neglect.   I won't be back for awhile to give them time to go through the people that they need to go.

_URfHGjodg-FqzJbIgy7-w.text: Solid upside to BLD. I'm rounding up a tiny bit from 3.5 stars. They're still working out some consistency issues. But they're new; so, growing pains.  I really like their focus on quality. Looks like they source their food well, and do their best to produce some tasty dishes. I've had a couple duds, but also some winners too. Don't get the waffle. Do get the THICK cut slice of bacon. Yes, so thick it's only one slice.  Great ambiance. Well-meaning staff. I'll give it a more in-depth review at a future point. But for now, this place is "solid" with potential to be "outstanding." I do recommend BLD though. And, I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict

nMVyK7MaJ2Sw2lYwdKBX6A.text: This place is amazing. The portions are huge and it taste great!! It's a good modern feel with a lot of options on the menu for everyone to enjoy. The service is excellent but can get busy at times and the waitresses get over whelmed.

l3ewONSJrfU1gNL-UA47kg.text: I agree with many of the other reviews. Summary = Food is so-so, Value is not good, Service is inconsistent, Decor is nice but Atmosphere is terrible.  The Pork Queso was very good, lots of flavor but the chips not good. We ordered the pork  tenderloin special and had a lot of problems the dish. Pork had a nice taste from the marinade but was over cooked. The butter nut risotto was more of a soggy rice dish than a fresh risotto. Way over priced for quality and quantity of the dish.  Service was good at the start and then he disappeared. Not once did he check in on how we liked the dish.   My main problem was the atmosphere and how loud it was. They have speakers pointing down over the tables with loud music. It raises the sound level and soon everyone is screaming over the music and each other. Add to that a happy hour and it carries a loud bar atmosphere and not one of a restaurant.  Will I go back? I might go back to try the breakfast but will not go back for dinner.

mo1RFeGQAFHeg_I3l1olBw.text: Service was great. Everything came out in a timely manner. The food was good. The wrap was a bit in the chewy side. The croissant sandwich was good, hit the spot for a sandwich. The salad w tuna was cooked to perfection. Only down I have is the waitress smelled of cigarettes. Bit overwhelming when getting food places in front of you. Overall it's a good spot to grab a quick bite.

M44BMxTmDdLELn7b-AlVcg.text: The best breakfast in chandler......I'm a big fan of the eggs benedict - especially the BLD, the Cali and the Florentine. The best chocolate chip pancake that I've had in AZ. The south of the border omelet is just perfect. The flavors combine perfectly!  Services is great and the server we always have - Jess (blonde), she is the best!!!!!!   I've been for happy hour as well - so affordable, great prices, small plates, easy for sharing.

cRFdHe04BFTgzsr_5lzq_w.text: Was hoping this would be a new go-to place for us but everything was just a little off. I just think they aren't able to handle busy times. The oatmeal that I asked for out first came last, and way last and had a hint of a burnt taste. My waffles were cold, making it impossible to spread butter on. Would've sent them back but didn't feel like waiting for replacements. Wife's potatoes were burnt and everything just seemed rushed and sloppy. May be a great spot, just not on a Sunday afternoon or holiday.

tNgOUuyB9QFeFDIGO1qe2w.text: I've seen this place for a couple of years now, but didn't drop in until yesterday.  So we ordered the short ribs (I was told it was the house specialty) and chicken fried steak.  Chicken fried steak was good.  Oddly its served with a brown gravy.  The veggies that came with it were very good.  Garlic mashed potatoes were half way decent.  The short ribs came with butter nut squash hash, greens (spinach) and some of the braising liquid.  The dish was ok.  The braising liquid didn't really add much to the dish and the butternut squash has was so so.  The greens were good.  Overall the dish was missing something.  I expect we'll go back again, but I'm pretty sure I won't order the short ribs.

q6A6jh9g53J-uHr0VKzvqg.text: 1st time here.  Both ordered Monte Christo sandwiches.  You know its not good when the food comes out in less than 10 minutes.  Soggy sandwich.  Cold potatoes.  Ice tea and coffee just plain bad.  Won't get a second chance... plus side-waitress very nice.

6bC9vVzh6Z5j55f3kzAIVA.text: I have been here several times and have not had a bad experience.  I have to say everytime I have been here I have had different wait staff and they have been very friendly and knowledgable.  The food has been consistently good, I had the veggie scramble, chocolate chip pancakes and a few of the startes over cocktails.  Good price point, nice welcoming venue and good staff.   I will definately be coming back.

mD745JHz0_gzMxHFa7kc_g.text: Great Risotto selection and always changing specials with unique recipes!

31cx-5n-QK15RqLc11MWlQ.text: We love this place!  Quality ingredients, great yummy salads, nice breakfasts as well and they also do a great job on the happy hour.  Wine's are $2 off and their appetizer menu is always good.  We enjoyed the flatbread and cheeseboard and both of them had good sized portions.  We regularly eat here and highly recommend to anyone looking for fresh quality food!

QPBxljtrx4xuBrNyNQjxoQ.text: If we could leave negative stars we would. To start I ordered a Bloody Mary that was mediocre at best, it didn't have any condiments in it not even a celery stick. Our meal was atrocious. I had the peppered seared tuna salad and in my third bite I chewed on a twist tie. That went back. My son had a pasta dish with meat and he received a piece of cartilage that was the size of an egg yolk. They did take my salad off the bill. I guess that was a plus... We won't be back. See ya BLD

ZP4ZeYnQPlpsEcmie5YdYA.text: I've had both breakfast and lunch here. Both very good. Service was great. Location and ambiance is great too. Manager's are very friendly and supportive of other local businesses.

nzI6atU5G5AS2iOA3tQuIA.text: What a great addition to our neighborhood!    Our server, Joe, was amazing, he was quick to serve us (on a crazy busy Mother's Day to boot) and helped us pick from the line up of yummy dishes.  A few growing pains yes, but overall a wonderful experience.  Can't wait to go back!

MX5aD89BanIzFKJR-NGQ8A.text: The food was amazing and worth the dip in the pocketbook. A downfall was the atmosphere felt like a cafeteria. Service was passing.

F1TXLULYHqWj-p9M6q-Rlg.text: Nice.  Sister restaurant to the Cork in Chandler, and it shows.  Great menu, great service, and good vibe.

yjWQdeEO8gR9_qS9TmeaTg.text: One of the best breakfasts I have had.  I had the breakfast sandwich with the chorizo potatos and my wife ordered the eggs benedict with a short rib on top.  Both were amazing but I have to say my favorite part of the meal was the thick cut bacon, its kind of like a ham steak.  This was incredible.  I liked it so much I ordered my second bloody mary with a side of bacon in it.  Don't knock it till you try it.  The best part was the bloody marys are $3.50 all day.  With bacon you do pay extra though!  We have since been back for lunch and several other breakfast and were equally impressed.  Also try the BLD iced coffee.  I will try and post a picture of the bacon mary.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bacon Mary

HINQThmeORrBzezDU5BDLg.text: Very disappointing. After reading all about this place and its noteworthy chef, I was excited to try it tonight. I thought the spaghetti squash would be interesting to try, something out of the ordinary. I explained to the hostess/waitress I was a pescatarian and asked what she'd recommend as far as fish or vegetarian. Without hesitating, she excitedly said the fish tacos. Went with her recommendation and they were just a little better than terrible. The fish pieces were much more breading than fish, grease oozed out during each bite, the spice was non-existent, and the semi-warm corn tortillas looked and tasted like they came out of a 99c store package. The only thing that saved these meal were the decent pico de gallo and red chile aioli layered on top. The presentation was pleasant as well. I also liked the cilantro-lime dressing on the small (and kind of expensive) side salad. All told, I probably should have tried Planet Sub next door.

LKoV2ypOaltfm8Pe_izfpg.text: I had a friend in town and wanted to take him to a restaurant I know is unique, has a decent atmosphere and has great food. Well, I found out on Friday night that BLD is not one of these places! We had possibly the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant...our waitress (Anna) was absolutely horrible! Because there were 10 of us for dinner, we called ahead and the hostess had a table ready and waiting for us by the time we got there. It was busy...so without a reservation, it was great to have her set aside a large table for us. However, our positive experience went south very quickly.  Our waitress came up and asked if we wanted something to drink. My friend asked if they had any Makers Mark. The waitress did not know and said she would check, but I was reading the cocktail menu and noticed a mixed drink that had Makers Mark. So he went ahead and ordered a Makers Mark and the rest of the table ordered their drinks. Guess what showed up along with the rest of our drinks, the cocktail that has Makers Mark in it...this was just the start. After returning the drink we did not order, we started making decisions on dinner. I knew I shouldn't ask her any questions about the menu, but I couldn't help myself. The first question I asked was, "How is the special tonight?". Her response, "I am not sure about tonight, but our specials are usually a mess!". So my friend asks, "How is the meatloaf?". She said, "I am not sure, but is it usually REALLY salty!". I would think the management of this restaurant would highly discourage any of their employees to respond about their menu items in this manner! So we all order our food and it comes out in a reasonable amount of time. One of the dishes came out and it was just not good. Because our waitress was nowhere to be found, I grabbed the hostess and she got the manager for us. He was nice and said, "What would you like instead of your current meal?". Our friend chose the fried chicken and it came back to the table fairly quickly. I also asked for some crushed red pepper for my pasta. The waitress said they did not have any crushed red pepper, but the other server that was bringing us our food went into the kitchen and grabbed some for our table. I showed the waitress what the crushed red pepper looked like and her response was, "Oh...I thought you were talking about..." and she then jestured with her index finger and pointed to her head. That stopped everyone at our table...it just got quiet. What does that mean??? We were all speechless! Then when it came time for our bill, remember how the manager asked my friend what he wanted in place of the first dish he ordered? Well, it just so happened the replacement dish was $2.00 more on the menu. So she removed the original and put the new item on the bill...for an extra $2.00!!! In my experience from working at restaurants and by dining in several, you remove the meal completely from the bill. Instead she charged us for the more expensive item and her response when I questioned her was, "I didn't know what you wanted to do..." The manager never came back over to check on us after the issue with the first dish and when I asked for the meal to be removed, they just removed the extra $2.00 it cost for the different meal. I looked out for the manager and he was laughing it up at the bar with what looked like some regular customers. There was no follow up or attention paid to the table that got stuck with the waitress that was clearly not qualified to work at any restaurant! It will be very difficult for us to go back to this restaurant. We go here frequently for breakfast and have always enjoyed the food. There are a few good folks that work there, but service is spotty at best. This was a very disappointing visit and I was embarassed to take a friend from out of town to what we thought was a good restaurant!

gTl3BGXRcA9ajtO_Q-GFhg.text: I am very disappointed in the service of this place. Fist the server was very unfriendly and we had to remind him every time we needed something. I bought a $9 protein shake that tasted terrible. I brought this to my servers attention yet he did nothing to correct the problem. I thought he might of taken it off the bill but he didn't. The breakfast was actually very good so i still gave this place a 2 star.

T5gnjXrkLXhbQYjbMoD9lw.text: Our party of 4 had a terrific brunch. The service was top notch, and the green chili was very good. The Bloody Mary was better than most.

XJSzOUh9qJ6z8H8G3BRFTA.text: Remembered that the have a drive thru window, so decided to swing by & see if they had good stuff. I got the nonfat white mocha, & it is nice w/out the bitter over roasted coffee. Hubby got the nonfat mocha. Friend tried their irish nut, basically hazlenut with irish cream.They both said the were good, but the irish one disappeared quickly!  Nice to get a great cup of fluffy coffee that did not have a burned over-roasted coffee taste.

2fGXnQJLJkpdiecEgYImsw.text: Here's the thing.  We're pretty big fans of Cork, so when we learned about BLD we were super excited to go.  Sadly, our first experience was really bad.  Because we loved Cork so much we decided not to write a review until we had gone a 2nd time.  Could be a fluke, right?  Wrong.    Here's the breakdown.  Visit 1:  1. We received chicken that was still releasing pink (not clear) liquids.  When we asked them to give us new chicken the server literally asked "oh, you want that more well done?" as if there is another way to serve chicken. 2. After getting the chicken back we found that they didn't actually replate the dish, they just put new chicken on it.  So if the pink liquid did contain any bacteria it was definitely still there. 3. Both my husband and I had some pretty terrible "digestion issues" that I wont go into detail on. 4. The servers seemed genetically engineered to avoid their tables.  In the 2 hours we were there I'd say we saw our server three times.  Visit 2:  1. The service was a bit better today but... 2. Both my husband, myself, and a 3rd guest had "Bridesmaids" style reactions to the food within a few hours of our visit.  I'm talking total upper and/or lower GI evacuation.   Both visits I'd say cost roughly $30 per person and we ended up sick and annoyed.  I will never return.

QAvRNZ9I9dCEvzpO08cX0g.text: A friend and I went here just for coffee after lunch one day, so this is just a review on their coffee. Wow - it was really tasty! We've been trying to find a place to have dessert-y type coffee and chat and looks like we found the place!

wZ0YKjhiAhUsYqtajCzxHA.text: This place is awesome! I usually get the Grilled Cheese and it is probably the best grilled cheese i have had in my life. I also really appreciate how it comes with a hearty side order of fries, onion rings, salad, etc. Whatever you want- pretty much. Additionally, last time I was here- I had exceptional service! I am usually rather picky when it comes to tipping well but I left around 40% tip. Would recommend 10/10!

tku0Vxm1fu_t6rycUcZBjg.text: The baked ziti was good as was the Green Giant salad.  I spent $120.00 for 10 people to eat from my office and we didn't finish the all the food.  The salad was probably my favorite as the dressing was different but very yummy.  I've heard from other employees say that breakfast is really good.

z5OFoNU3MhybHMuHow-35g.text: The service and atmosphere was great.....but it couldn't make up for the super greasy food. Even the spaghetti squash dish was swimming in butter. I like comfort food but this wasn't comforting it was just oily.

amPXKHq23bebjKGBLHeS4w.text: Went here yesterday for breakfast and today for dinner; Spring Break'll do that to you.   Breakfast- ordered the bacon and eggs which doesn't sound exciting,  I am well aware. But this was the best damn bacon and eggs I've had in a loooong time. Maybe ever.  And I'm not much of a breakfast potato fan, but their home fries are beyond delish. Made with Yukon gold potatoes and clearly a lotta love, they were crisp on the outside and buttery/creamy on the inside.  The portion was filling but not gluttonous. Who wants leftovers at breakfast anyway?   Dinner, oh dinner. You are fresh in my mind so I love you most of all. Ransom was the most attentive waiter we've had in a long time. He was more than happy (dare I say eager?) to answer the 492 questions my husband and I asked about the menu.  I ordered the short rib entree with Boursin mashed potatoes and asparagus. I did finish pretty much every bite, so I can attest to how uberyummy it all was. What my husband ordered for an entree doesn't matter (he loved it,tho) b/c he got the mac and cheese for a side. I can't even think about that mac and cheese without hyperventilating a little. Ransom said they used a white cheese from Ohio b/c we asked. Because it was in a class of its own. Because it puts all other mac and cheese to shame.    Now that I've had the B and the D, I need to go for the L soon,I realize this. But I had to review while this is fresh in my mind.  If they are this good on their second week open, I tremble to think how scary good they'll be given a little more time. So I don't sound like a total brainless lunatic who drank the Kool-aid, I have to make one suggestion. Plain iced tea instead of just mango would be a nice option. And that is truly my biggest complaint.

fuhV8uitl215WSYgTWtdLw.text: I was very disappointed with BLD's service.  I have been there a number of times - the food is good.  But the service is so poor.  This last time I was there, our server did not come up to us for almost 20 minutes and that was just to get our drink order.  She was rude, unhelpful, did not know the menu, had no suggestions.  Then when we told her we were ready to order she no joke blankly stared at us.  So there was this awkward silence and I just started ordering.  Then she interrupts me to say she will be right back to take our order.  WHAT?! alright.  So anyway, i'm looking at my bank account statement today 2/2/2016 (I was just at BLD on Sunday 1/31/2016).  And I see I was charged twice for the same thing on the same day.  I am like, great!  I was already not happy with my experience from there.  Then this.  My rent just took out and I overdrafted because of them double charging me.  So obviously I call them right away.  This rude girl answers the phone - doesn't give her name.  And basically tells me there is no manager and there is nothing she can do about it.  I even told her about how I overdrafted and this was affecting my account and me paying my rent.  She did not seem to care at all.  Told me to call tomorrow.  CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT?  Like what kind of place runs their business like that.  I will not ever be back there again.  OH AND even though there food is good for the most part.  They do not know how to poach an egg for the Egg Benedict's, and that specific plate typically comes out cold.  THAT IS ALL.

2QN9fOJ_06IHzTROL4G_5Q.text: I really enjoyed the breakfast. I had the short rib benedict and my friend had the green chili pork tostada with 2 eggs over easy on top. For the restaurant just being open for 2 days I thought all in all things were good.  We sat at the bar and had very good service and the prices we very reasonable. I will be going back for breakfast at least once a week.

OnmSX9z-ni4cvILhjre15w.text: I heard about this restaurant from the radio station 103.9. I was listening to Monti's morning show and she began talking about how great the food was at BLD. We decided to visit for lunch. The menu was interesting and had a lot of choices that were different. Not the same old same old. I asked how long BLD had been opened and was very surprised when he said two years. I had never once heard of this place until now.  We ordered the Dr Pepper BBQ pork sandwiches. He got onion rings I got sweet potato fries. All of it was delicious.  The only reason we may not choose to visit this place is that while the waiter was helpful, and he eventually warmed up...it appeared to be an effort.  The manager, or whom we believed to be the manager never even said "boo" to us. He must have walked by us four times and tried hard not to make eye contact. We were there at a non busy time of day, not the height of lunch hour. He wandered around the restaurant, visited their wine cellar. We just felt, like in other restaurants where management cares about their customers, he would at least stop by once and ask how we enjoyed our meal.  He didn't stop at any of tables, so everyone was neglected. Once again, I'll say that he was not too busy.  I read the other reviews after our visit and it appears that many others feel about the same way as far as the service/servers/management treatment of customers. There are many restaurant choices for my family to choose from and we like to go where we feel welcome...not just another person to hand food to and pay the bill. I'm  not sure that we will go back, even though we saw some items on the breakfast menu that we thought were unique.

HOPiEuYaug7Atne5jl69CQ.text: I've been back several times since my first review! One of my favorite places to eat for sure! The menu is amazing! Sunday brunch is great! Football, food, mimosas. Prepare for a wait most likely but I usually get right in without one.

aHA_5KHNfJ-WlDBTygJclg.text: We were at BLD for a Saturday morning breakfast.  Place opened at 8, we were there at 8:10...so it wasn't busy and there was a gaggle of wait staff...all waiting around.  It took forever to get OJ, coffee and waters.  I am an Eggs Benedict fanatic and try them wherever I can.  These were the worst.  The eggs were way underdone.  The waiter was kind enough to remind me that this was the case with Eggs Benedict.  One of the eggs was so underdone that the yolk literally slid out of the runny poached egg white.  It looked like it gave birth in my plate!  On top of that, the Hollandaise was way too tart.  The waiter brought out another poached egg floating in water in a cereal bowl as a replacement.  I looked at him with a "what the h@!* am I supposed to do with this" look.  He took my plate and the bowl and returned with it on a toasted English muffin on the same plate...sans Hollandaise.  The general consensus:  there is nothing compelling enough to bring us back.

tlrpC6FZIiWtxn-_Xwz3UQ.text: My wife and I go here almost every weekend. The food is great and the service is always great too. Good beer selection and the mimosa's and bloody Mary's are awesome as well.

kf9E8nmFzDatYkCsBZiRXw.text: We've been here for all meals.  Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. We definitely have our favorites, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Pick what calls you.    It's fresh, it's yummy, it's great.    Happy hour is your best deal, if you can make it in before 6.    Some of my favorites: Bloody Mary, Veggie omelet (add a meat), mac & cheese with bacon, an iced latte, anything with the pork, meatloaf, waffles with bacon, anything on the small bites/happy hour menu.    The patio is dog friendly and will bring your pup water.  Some of the bartenders give out doggie treats.  They'll also make your pup a meal if you order one!

DntuCINjWmXkDj2YWig9VA.text: Ate lunch at BLD on what was their 2nd day open. Summary: Good food, but unorganized service.  There was no signage on the main door or any kind of indication they were open for business. (There was still a gate on the patio waiting to be installed). But we had called ahead and knew they were open.   The food: I ordered the iced green tea and the grilled portabella salad. My friend ordered a fresh squeezed lemonade and the turkey/brie sandwich with sweet potato fries. Our food was all very good.   Service: A waitress was attentive and tried to answer all our questions, but it was clear she didn't know that much about the menu. They were even out of whatever bread the sandwich was supposed to come on (seems odd for opening week). And when they brought us our menus, they brought us each a breakfast menu but they only had one lunch menu left. This seemed odd since there were only a few customers dining at lunch time. How do you run out of lunch menus?   They were very polite and tried to be helpful, but it just seemed like they were all "new" and not quite ready to be open yet.   The breakfast menu looked the most appealing to us -- so I will be back to try it. Hopefully they have the kinks worked out by then.

FoDCKx6fwvYASuLGSs0RuQ.text: I love this place, let me repeat, I Love This Place!  I have been here several times now (not sure why just reviewing now) and I will continue to give them my money and shovel their food and drink into my soul.  I have be here for breakfast, lunch and dinner and all meals have been delish.  I especially enjoy the short rib anything (breakfast burrito, short rib dip, and the dinner platter).  Oh and those damn sweet potato fries are the best I have had.  They have set the benchmark for SP fries.  The wine selection is good and I like the way the break it down on the menu.

zv2TCciPGsSMgexh7aZj3A.text: The food was good. The service was nice. I had a reuben with sweet potato fries and a iced green tea. The bill was average. I'd go again.

Lrv1wmyD4nqMWn5TEbPklw.text: I'm not from this side of the valley. I was in need of some really good breakfast and decided from the picture this was place I was trying. So happy I did. It's amazing! We called and picked it up and everything was great. I got the eggs Benedict, my boyfriend had the breakfast burrito, our friends had biscuits and gravy, and friend chicken no was disappointed. Definitely a must try!

sEl1Z-g_yC65CRxfjxfJnw.text: If you don't serve an egg substitue, say so. Chopped egg is not an egg substitue. Egg Whites are not an egg substitute.  A tablespoon of watery "gravy" over a nearly flat biscuit doesn't work. Bacon should be crisp and unburnt - ready to go. Not charred, flaccid and greasy - as if already spent.  Scrambled eggs should be fluffy, or at least not dry and rubbery. Unless stated on your menu, your eggs should not contain quantities of Black Pepper or other spices. This is dangerous. You don't know who might be violently allergic. Tasted bad to boot.  The chunk potatoes were undercooked, even though asked for crispy.  The tastiest part of the meal was the Chorizo potato soup. The Chorizo could have had several tablespoons of grease drained in the kitchen and would still have been quite greasy - and not floating across the plate. Still, it was the best dish of the morning. .sigh.  What was looking to be a promising new place is showing signs of apathy towards is customers already. Quality slipping, lame excuses by staff "we make our own egg substitute", - it's just disappointing. I may not be back for a while.

zwViyuIQh7JipKQ9E6YlcA.text: BLD used to be great! Their bartender today was rude and annoying and had very poor customer service and the waitress who helped us wasn't nice either. They have poor hiring practices.

vLPS7nqnrl4bAEb7vza78Q.text: We went for lunch and we were very pleased! The food was delicious! Nice variety to pick from, portions were awesome, atmosphere was good, kid friendly, employees and manager were great! Prices were a tad high for lunch however, it would be nice to see a few cheaper lunch specials offered for those not looking to spend $10+ on lunch without the drink. Either way, it won't stop me from going back because the food and everything else was fantastic!

84zJDyQPsaP8UsZKiXJ9LA.text: We heard good things about this place and decided to try it for Sunday breakfast.  I had a simple bacon, eggs, and potato plate and an extra pancake.  The potatoes were obviously cook hours prior and dumped in the fryer.  Just potatoes, no onion or other stuff.  One slice of bread, not two.  The pancake was $4.50 for one 12" pancake.  The syrup had some type of film on it that kept it from pouring from the container.  She had country fried steak.  Awful.  Overcooked and the gravy was greasy.  Oh, I wanted a simple iced tea...nope...had to be green tea or mango.  You will get a better breakfast at a Waffle House.  We may try again for dinner, but I was very disappointed.  What was good?  Very short wait and the wait staff were friendly and efficient.  Oh, and they can scramble eggs.  About the only positives.

D7cWeWmKyAhZCmqMPWXRww.text: The appetizers, when we went for dinner, stole the show:  mac & cheese was insanely good, the brussels sprout chips (they're frying kale with it too, now, I guess, and it's a welcome addition) was delicious, and the chips were good (but not life altering...too much Frank's sauce, for me).  Two of our three dinner entrees were great (burgers), too (one was a total disappointment, unfortunately - beet and arugula salad that was so wilted, it never should have left the kitchen).  I'm giving them a 3.5, owing to that salad (fortunately, my girlfriend was full enough from the appetizers).

mfuLmMPURsIyjTVK_6OORA.text: Had breakfast here a few weeks ago. Menu didn't offer up much of a selection. Portions were ok and price was only a bit higher than it should be. Service was slightly below average, waiter was obviously new to the trade.   All-in-all, an average place but I have several other favorites and won't be calling this one of them. If lunch and dinner are similar, I'd be shocked if this place was still around this time next year.

ZxXmq259T9DNvoxf2WLfmg.text: The food is great! The service is impeccable! Our server was amazing, but everyone that past or table checked on us, said hello, said have a great day, can I get you something. Clean, friendly, relaxing. Reasonably priced.

3jfML96-GEDhNqHV4eN4vQ.text: This place is horrible for breakfast. They were charging a ridiculous $5.00 for a cup of hot tea so we stopped going for a while. Thought we'd give them another chance today. Bad decision. Our kid's pancakes came out with pieces of spinach in them instead of chocolate chips. My wife's potatoes were so burnt and nasty that she switched to tomatoes instead. Then they overcharged us (stupidly we didn't realize it until we got home). So we drove back there and after a diffucult time getting anyone to help us find the manager, she didn't even apologize. Just said "ok I fixed the total." Bad, bad, bad. Go elsewhere.

l3M__Q6Ux1Gd6jOIIwCYLg.text: I go for lunch with my special lady friend. Its been good every time we go. The service is great! Lots of good drinks. Maybe its just as good for dinner? The only problem is they have funked up my wife's order a couple of times. They fix it but kind of sucks waiting. I did not like the Dr Pepper pork sandwich. They acted like it was straight from Georgia. Eeehh, you could do the same in a croc pot. Other than that, I recommend the hot pastrami sandwich. The spicy burger is good too. All in all a good local spot. Couple beers, couple laughs, couple of burgers.

w0JmcPC07XAC02uamepNLw.text: BLD is always a good bet. Outdoor patio is dog-friendly and they have some nice loungers outside when all you want to do is sit around and have some appetizers or drinks. I also really like their kids' menu. It's refreshing that a place that has some really good food also has really good food for kids. In fact, that's probably the number one reason why I come here SO often - I don't have to compromise on my meal when I want to eat out with my child.   Atmosphere is pretty hip and modern. They did a nice job with the space. Only thing is that the music they play can get pretty loud in the evening. Hard to talk to friends unless you're right next to each other.   My favorite part of their menu is their green chile pork tostada which is only served for breakfast. It's also a HUGE portion of food and could easily be shared.

6JIxLSKx9RE2O0CGtswVFQ.text: They have one of my all time favorite "cheat" meals, chicken and waffles. But today the food was cold so I sent it back and the replacement plate was cold too. Made me wonder if they are keeping a bunch of plates lines up waiting for orders. I do like the menu variety and beer choices.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Biscuits and fried Chix sand.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chix N Waffles.

TGWKNEGJocTsb5rM-MJeUw.text: Dee-lish! Their menu is always changing, but you can bet on anything with their Braised Short Rib. I also LOVE their Goat Burger.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Open-faced braised beef sandwich with herb fries
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chorizo omelette with tomatoes instead of hash browns.

KZ7V2e8COb-FmgcWQrKHqQ.text: I've been here on quite a few occasions for either lunch or breakfast. I don't have anything bad to say, but I've never really had my socks knocked off either. I definitely think it's the best place for breakfast in the Chandler area though. The Pork Tosdada is good, and their breakfast potatoes are good too. Cute, modern decor and a dog-friendly covered patio. I will say I've never really had a good group dining experience here though.  Overall, it's a pretty solid place. I have no reason to stop coming!

0lOScfHARsAx1VIerWcGRQ.text: A classic diner with a bit of charm.  Lots of flair on the menu and items made with quality ingredients. Goat cheese burger had a real wow factor, but they do basics well to: their pancakes might be the best item on the menu.  Great inside as well good plac eot meet people or bring others.   Why not five? Well, there is a wait to get food and price is high for the amount of food (but I'll admit I'm a big guy and they do use quality stuff).

nkGDpTtnWOnJdtENhKVxiw.text: Wow. We used to love this place. Great weekend breakfast environment. Super fun. But since the new manager came in the fun and open environment is gone. Hate to say it but we will never go back. There are other more welcoming places in that area that we will frequent. Oregano's Nandos and the new IVY. Also burgers n beers.  If u want to be treated like crap by the new manager. Go to BLD.

HwByLJUSQ1UlGR2TdPlSgA.text: I'm so torn on this review. I would say the food and beverages rate a 5 but the service is barley a 2. We have gone probably 5 times since they opened and every time we've had terrible service, even when we were one on 2-3 tables and they had 5-6 staff on the floor. It normally takes forever for drinks. Many times we've seen our drinks sitting,poured and waiting for a waiter and after 10 mins we've gone and got them ourselves. At that point the beers were warm or mixed drinks had melted ice.  Every time get our food after a long wait then the server never asks how it is or if we need anything. We just ask for boxes and the check before anyone comes to check on us.  We have tried to order take out before and their phone system was totally messed up. They have you press another button to order but apparently it directs you to the bar and they don't do take out after a certain time but that was explained on the phone prompt so we sat on hold for over 20mins. I finally called over and the hostess took our order.   If the owner should consider hiring new management and staff.

DBvnhREdFc6VSpB4ij6UOA.text: I can't say enough good things about the breakfast at BLD. The eggs benedict are super yummy, the carne asada is delicious and the green chili pork tostada is delightful.  However, after breakfast things take a turn for the worse. I've been for lunch a few times, but nothing has impressed me. Dinner is even worse. Nothing has been bad, but it's never been good. Often, meals have been rather bland.   Also, some of their prices seem a bit higher than they should be. $7 for a large dirty chai? Really?  I really want to like BLD and support businesses in my neighborhood. I hope dinner gets better, but I can recommend it for breakfast without reservations.

HHKYo6ntJIJ-I7PGEm2N7w.text: I have eaten here over 10x. I used to go a lot on my lunch break, but I have stopped. They had really good burgers. The environment is nice, but the last 2x I went they messed up my order and I believe they made a mistake and put sugar on my french fries.

pj1xgP122mtGEbfgbFMkIA.text: BLD is the one place in Chandler that I really want to like, but after three visits, I just give up. They have a great-looking menu, a hip-kinda vibe, and all the promise in the world. And that's where it ends.  A disinterested hostess will invariably seat you in the one table you'd least prefer. Near the kitchen entrance. Near an angry baby. Whatever.  Next, one of several equally disinterested servers will arrive to take your drink order and by the time you've worked up a good thirst, drinks will arrive. If you're lucky, it'll be the drinks you actually ordered. If you're really lucky, they'll be good.  The one saving grace on the breakfast menu is the Monte Cristo. A+, seriously. Everything else is average, despite how it reads on the overpromising menu. And don't worry about the prices: just pretend you're in Scottsdale or, say, Midtown Manhattan, for the entire meal. If you remember you're in Chandler, you'll just get angry.  Like the breakfast menu, the lunch menu equally overpromises, but that's okay, because you'll wait just as long to receive your food. If it's not over or undercooked, you might as well just dig in and not think about how much you overpaid for a sub-par meal.  BLD looks and act like they want to be a BFD (big friggin' deal) but they need to start caring about both their customers and their food first. A good menu doesn't make a good restaurant if you don't deliver the goods.

4DquAQMlJUPGImkv0EzraQ.text: They say they have smoothies and protein drinks but it's mostly coffee drinks. Such a bummer! On the bright side, they have killer happy hours with delicious tapas!

om902-p9Vf3Q9i5N4E1f6A.text: I read the reviews but decided to taste for myself. I had the happy hour pastrami hash and my wife had the chorizo tacos and I was pleased with them both. The hash was a shock to my tastebuds, a new taste that wiped away the Blues from my bad day at work.. We didn't have any drinks but I was still happy just the same. I plan on coming back for the chicken and waffles

yLiVH8E8Tt7HjdqkdjRA5A.text: There is a reason that this restaurant is empty at 6:30 p.m. Were helped by the slowest staff know to man, menu tossed in front of us. The order was to go, not made to go. The girl making the protein drinks touched her face more than a dozen times and was not wearing gloves did not wash her hands. We walked out. Very, very disappointed to say the least.

ZukhF5szVdzNITY0uHzOZw.text: This place is awesome! Hands down the best breakfast spot in Chandler!  They also have a great lunch and dinner menu.

9wsPohHCSJP71SWkO5Fi6Q.text: Mouth-watering goodness!!! Glad I stumbled upon this place while working :) I may just have to drive out here to have the "Goat" burger again...

iEWp-jHXreuxO6yi563rzA.text: The best coffee in town anywhere.  Huge portions and very creative with their food - some of the seasonal offerings are spectacular.  Nice back room for hosting parties too!

8X-r0jfgv7MtjVIdcvBdcg.text: It was the waiter's last day - which he was quite happy to tell us all about. Because of that - I will not write anything about the service. He definitely had a case of last-day-itis. A friend and I had just created paintings of our pooches at a nearby storefront - and we were ready for a late lunch. First thought was the restaurant next door to BLD - as we've both enjoyed their other location and I am friendly with the GM. It was BUSY in there, and we were told it would be about 45 minutes for a table. We were both quite hungry, and didn't want to wait that long to be able to first order. So - we went to BLD. It was close to empty. That should have been a sign. When one place has a 45 minute wait, and another restaurant that shares the parking lot only has customers at two tables - there's a reason. A reason we should have heeded. We opted to share a couple of dishes. One was the seared peppered tuna salad. (The abbreviation "R.R.P." shows up throughout the menu. I asked so you don't have to - it's Roasted Red Peppers.) The chef wasn't as familiar with the concept of "seared" as I hoped, the tuna was quite well done. A couple of slices had a hint of pink in the center...but just a hint - and definitely not what I know to be seared. We also shared the grilled cheese sandwich. The menu describes it as thick cut sourdough with Havarti, brie, tomato, and bacon. Sounds delicious, right? Too bad the execution was soggy and bland. The fries were okay. I guess that's something. There was also a happy hour menu. One of the appetizers we asked for was house made chips with hot sauce and blue cheese. (The restaurant we first went to, but was too busy, has something like this that we both love - that's one of the reasons we wanted to go there.) Not only was it completely lackluster - but I mention the appetizer after the entree, as that's when it showed up. I don't see any reason I need to give this place a second shot. I'm rarely in this part of town, and now I know that when I am, I will just go to the other place - and no matter how long the wait is, the food will be good.

l8i2Vp9DWiPgMiwJrcvUrg.text: Eee, not so much. I'm giving 2 Stars, because the waitress, Rayni was very nice. We drove 42 miles RT, to try this place out. We are not fans of the "Sysco" restaurants in our neighborhood, so I'm always telling my husband we have to drive out of our hood to try better places. BLD was pretty much a Sysco place, nothing priority about it. We went here because we saw it on Check Please Arizona, and the reviews and pictures here. We ordered the eggs Benedict with bacon. They literally put about a teaspoon of hollandaise sauce on each egg, unlike the photos I saw here. I ordered the biscuit and gravy, there hardly wasn't any gravy, the eggs literally covered up the gravy, I thought maybe they just forgot it. In the gravy was hardly but 2 or 3 little bitty chunks of what they called sausage. I singled out a piece and could swear it tasted like hamburger not sausage, my husband agreed. Nothing like the photos I saw here with gravy run amok. In all honesty this place rates right up there with IHOP or VI, closer to my house, less expensive and taste about the same. So the B part of BLD, I won't be back. Maybe I will try the L&D part, someday?

VVCkDINsPJSwqjAI-W2LBA.text: Great location for Happy Hour, Lunch and Breakfast. Never been here for Dinner but the other three all have dinner items on them. I would recommend this place for a date, or a family. Very versatile menu which can accomidate the pickiest of diners. Be sure to try the Tangerine beer if you like Blue Moon or Shock Top.   The patio is Pet Friendly, super plus!    Booths can accomidate parties of 6-8 depending on how big your peeps are. There's also a long hightop table that could probably seat 20.

9P6za3rxteRO7nAXyeAgRg.text: My son and I came in for the first time last week and we really enjoyed ourselves. Our waiter Kevin was very nice and the food was excellent. We will be back again with our entire family soon.

TXZpl7CteFfh6ZD3VE3-eQ.text: Got 20 bucks to spend on a burrito? Then this is the place for you! The food tasted great, but...I ordered a "build your own" burrito which is $9.75 and I added all the veggies and avocado which was another EIGHT DOLLARS (0.75 cents per veggie and $1.25 for 1/2 an avocado) on TOP of the $9.75. WTH is the original 9.75 for?? Unless that tortilla is made of gold, that's extremely unreasonable. So, 2 stars because while everything tasted good, I left with a bitter taste in my mouth. Sorry, BLD...I wish I could've left more stars..

wTA0uEvFv9qcQCZ8QVDOuw.text: Breakfast, lunch or dinner this place is awesome! The burgers are big and juicy! The biscuits and gravy are the go to breakfast thing in my book. The brunch drinks are bomb too. Check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bld burger with a side of onion rings! 1/2 pound of beef, bacon, pulled pork and 2 fried eggs! Crazy amount of food!

rDKWpDr1dZgM6687OhXeaA.text: First time here, I don't recommend the fish tacos.  Unless you like heavily fried fish.  Service was excellent, so I left happy! It was a slow lunch time after 1 on a Monday

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

8YJau-RgFfA-setsqN25yw.text: Great find!   Customer service was on point. We had a large party come through this place. Water was waiting for us when we arrived. The waitress was very knowledgable about the menu. She knew how everything tastes, how it was prepared, and could remind to the T what everyone was looking for. We had 18 people this night. Most restraints need several waitresses. We o let needed one. She kept a glasses full and was around a lot to help with whatever we needed.   Food.  Out of 18 people, not a single person had a bad item. I had the BLD burger. It was a little messier then expected, but really good. Cooked medium the way I like it with green chile pork, bacon, pepper jack cheese, and a pretzel bun. The cheesecake at the end was a huge hit as well. It had Carmel, pretzel, and health bar on top. So good. I heard many times from our group that they would all be back and it was a great place.   Go check it out!

aR2ecZS9LECyvpNYhiTaqQ.text: Back at one of our favorite breakfast places. It's packed to the rafters. Even though it's a 45 minute wait, the staff is courteous and the restaurant is running like a well organized business.  The manager or owner is very present. Helping clear tables and seat guests. We normally wouldn't wait this long for a table, but for breakfast here, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Packed on Sunday at 1030

Q28nmBE2NZ7ypmx_muq98Q.text: Cool patio and excellent beer selection but the food is really hit or miss. Have gone several times for brunch and dinner and have had a couple really great dishes but more misses.

x_o6JFCBq7JyNCwvIcRHGQ.text: My 1st visit to this restaurant was so-so at best. The place was fairly empty so service was fast and the server was friendly. I ordered the Biscuits & Gravy Specialty breakfast which came with 2 eggs, 2 slices bacon & potatoes ($12.95). The eggs were served on top of the biscuits & gravy, which would be ok, but that was the 1st clue that there wasn't enough gravy, since I could barely see it under the 2 eggs over easy. Before I had even finished the 1st biscuit the gravy was gone, so I asked for a little more gravy. The result was an additional 1/4 cup (2oz maybe) and an additional $2 on the bill, and there still wasn't enough gravy to compliment the remaining biscuit. If you like paying $19 before tip for a cup of coffee and a "specialty" breakfast in which the special isn't present and only barely appears for an extra charge, then this is your place.

R7b9d-4oK7-rRqbSsVcdXw.text: I would like to give the BLD dinner crew KUDOS for a great meal, as usual! The restaurant was busier than usual and our food took longer than it should have. Kevin, the manager, came to our table to apologize for being short one cook that night. Once the food came, it did NOT DISAPPOINT! Delicious!!! :-D Unfortunately for the staff, there was a larger party near us, and a few of them were not going to be happy with anything they ordered! :-( Sarah, our server, replaced one of the patron's meals but she still wasn't happy! Kevin went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make them happy, not charging them for their 1st meal, but also taking half off the second one they still didn't like. It was discouraging when patrons can be so inconsiderate of a staff's efforts, because the staff REALLY wanted to please! We left before we were able to see/hear how it ended, but what my family an I witnessed was very admirable on the staff's part. GREAT JOB, BLD STAFF on eve of Saturday, October 13th. We will continue to frequent your establishment! :-D

v3k5CvTYnXY8nOTO-9oAow.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would! The food is way over priced! Who wants to spend 15$ on eggs and toast? The food was gross, the menu is full of weird ingredients... nothing was good! I will NEVER EVER EVER eat here or recommend anyone to this place. They need to do a major overhaul of the menu - maybe more basic. Gross. Don't waste your time or money- go eat at Mickey d's, dennys, or IHOP ! Seriously

kZJforqUqgtg2I57Fs2D_w.text: Ok, they have a full BAR for breakfast... whooppieee unless i needed another hair from the dog that bit me,, lol..   Food was decent, Ham Swiss Croissant was about average,, Wifes Pancakes were pretty good..   Only 3 stars.. The waitress was visibly sick/ cough and voice / coughing into arm, etc... Table was super wobbly, and coffee kept spilling.. (sit at the bar would be a must do next time) .. Service was a little slow, and when we were done it took over 15 minutes to finally get our bill, then she waited on another table before cashing out... Wife n kids waited impatiently in the car.. not great start to the morning routine..

2tnWIyUVsIS7hP0ClbCD-A.text: Came in yesterday and ordered fried chicken to go. Got home and the chicken was burned, dry and tasted like shoe leather. Make sure to look at to go orders before you leave!

5t8MpPHg3j7KJY0iB1Tl9Q.text: Hi, I went back to your restaurant and was very happy that the coffee was nice and hot! Thank you for switching to the metal thermos that keeps the coffee hot! It was nice!

hXkq0Ow_2N3fAUuiyuufZQ.text: Came in during lunch asked for the dinner menu they made items on that menu no problem. Service was pretty good and the food was delicious! Ill be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese

mQSqIM6ki36kB3NW_Ama-Q.text: I was not impressed. My fried chicken was bland and flavorless, my wife's potatoes were bland, totally unseasoned, and had a weird aftertaste, probably related to the soggy onions in there. The scrambled eggs weren't great but I never expect good scrambled eggs from a restaurant because I like mine fluffy. The waffle I had... have you ever been to a cheap motel with a continental breakfast? Where they have that little waffle maker with the batter dispenser? I'm like 99% positive that they have that exact setup in the back, because that is what my waffle looked and tasted like.  Overall, 2/5, too expensive for not good quality. Also, the Spanish Latte wasn't great either. Also I didn't feel like the staff was all that friendly. Our server was okay.

lqMGfOcxKKuJrifmnq_tYQ.text: I've given this place several shots to redeem themselves. Failed each time. I will NEVER go here again. Food is awful and overpriced

6mSFQ7lTYC8GedlVtMZROg.text: This is my go to place for brunch on the weekends. It's really good for kids, my daughter begs to come here. The food is a bit heavy for lunch or dinner, in my opinion. The have great coffee and a full bar with an excellent menu. Both of those things are crucial for a good brunch spot. The food is really good for basic American food. I had the new BBQ today and that was pretty good. I normally get one of the benedicts. On that note, they come dangerously to close to 5 stars for one big reason. They know how to poach an egg. So many breakfast/brunch specialists, even some with "egg" literally in their name, cannot poach on egg. It really angers me and is a guarantee I will never come back. These guys have always come through on my poached egg.  The service is always fast and friendly and the really make it fun for the kids.

uO6JYWed8zKFO4dRO8s9Bw.text: I met a friend here for brunch during the Saturday morning rush. We were seated within a few minutes, which was a pleasant surprise since there were so many full tables. Service was great and we loved the cool atmosphere. We both ordered the eggs benedict which was perfection! And the mimosas are delish! Definitely will be back!

Gt9xQXBZ4t5kGKtpGu9uHw.text: Great food. The staff recommendations never disappoint . I have never had anything bad at BLD and the people who work there are awesome.

kiE-BlZ8piYWvWwrwTfyKw.text: Seriously...$0.50 for additional salad dressing? I must have missed that on the menu.  I'm guessing you don't charge extra for syrup or ketchup so why the petty charge for extra salad dressing?  Don't get me wrong, the (Power House) salad was delicious and full of flavor, but if I am paying $12.95 for a salad, I shouldn't be charged for additional salad dressing. Had I known prior to receiving the check that I was going to be charged for the extra dressing, I would have asked for a refund on the additional dressing that I did not use.   Don't nickel and dime your customers!

OZQvYYDnaizCO1MLbn44gA.text: I like this place food is great  But obnoxious people at next table was nearly unbearable. Where's management? I don't understand how oblivious people are to their surroundings. Please be considerate of others  I don't need to listen to your foul mouth

CGVJCSp2urwEC7lImUGMNQ.text: First time, will return for sure!  Sat at the bar as we do everywhere we go. Bill was so attentive and we just loved his vibe. Food was awesome but huge portions so we will split a plate next time!

iwiEIjy_ix5QpexcQLY6nQ.text: We wanted to try a different place for breakfast. BLD has a very large and varied menu. The server was pleasant, helpful and very thorough. The food was absolutely delicious. We can't wait to go back again...maybe for lunch this time

q_lhKXZLD2OjwEQark0f_Q.text: Had an excellent dinner. Service excellent. Ask for Kevin. Very personable waiter.Brisket delicious. Try the desserts. Yum

rXkNKVG_0MQM5xq08dzAAA.text: First time here. Great food, well, amazing food and better yet, fantastic service.  Husband and I both had the eggs Benedict. Not overly heavy or greasy. Biscuits and gravy was just perfect too. We will definitely be back.

tnviGncABOBNsh4QxieVdg.text: Every week we meet here with our business group. They have a great space. This is also our favorite spot for brunch and bloddy Mary's. Special shout out to our favorite server Jay. He's been taking care of us for years and has a crazy good memory. Outstanding service provided by Jay all the time.

yho7-DD4-jeHYCarbd34XQ.text: Great local spot that is dog friendly. Extensive morning friendly cocktail selection including buzzed coffees. Green chili pork Benedict is big enough for two. Breakfast quesadilla is giant! I have never been able to eat more than half. I like Sunday mornings at 8 or 9 because it is not busy and very relaxed.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary with bacon for the win

tQ2tRktLweNeCmW6pahJhg.text: Popped into BLD a month ago (yeah, I'm writing a late review, get over it). It was an early Saturday dinner, arrived 4:30ish, not very crowded.
