Our server, Franco, was funny & did a good job of servicing. The service did seem a tad slow considering it wasn't very crowded but we weren't in any rush so it was no big deal. Besides, if we had wanted fast food we woulda gone to Taco Bell or something. The food at BLD was hot, the menu was extensive - I mean huge; almost to the point of being overwhelming. I definitely want to go back & try their breakfast items (which are served all day, BTW).

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Peanut Butter &#34;Bomb&#34; Whipped peanut butter mousse covered in dark chocolate, with bruleed banana. DAMN GOOD!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight. Not bad but I truly would have preferred either a better champagne or more of the juice.

XXBqN9Nkx6S3UMSsY_gPtg.text: I was there this past Monday and the server that waited on us could not have been nicer,she was friendly,personable,informative I'm not from the area and she recommended some great things to do /places to go.  Sweet,funny,very entertaining I wish more servers gave customers the dining experience the way she did. Thanks again Kim,we'll be back next time we're in town. Thank you BLD

WdSwOyb4WDkv-3Cp16eoSQ.text: There is this place in Chandler called BLD I dropped in with a date because it was convenient you see  And wow were we surprised At just where we had arrived  A pleasant man named Micah made our meal great As we commented on the wonderful food we ate  With all the options out there It's nice to find a server like Micah that cares!  Great job. Great food. We are coming back! I highly recommend BLD. Thank you. Greg

PrC9LH4I2EjWWNFgHZJY3w.text: We have visited BLD a few times. Has always been delicious and had great service.  Today Kevin was our server. He was attentive and our drinks never went near dry. My kind of service.   We will be back again and again.

vl2I1tOE-hH_DS0tZCjijQ.text: 2nd visit. 1st was on a Tuesday and their tacos were great!  Server was very good, great menu with serious food choices for any course!  We just happened to have visited both at dinner hour.  Tap list impressive too!  Check out the blackboards!  Seasonal Taps and specials listed there. Staff never really drew any attention to them and I felt kind of stupid once I realized there were there.  Location is weird because after the TV's at the bar and the cool back wall, this side wall feels hidden somewhat; not focal. So I missed it entirely until last night.  Service was still good they were busy- maybe 12-15 tables/ bar seats.  She was running the bar (college baseball WS on) and serving tables.  She likely took more on because there was only 1 other server.   Food came out quickly.  Used the Free App checkin and didn't care for the green chili pork queso. Too thick and color was off putting. Both of us had burgers, goat cheese and plain w/fries.  Loved them 100%!!!   We will try the B or the L maybe next time too!

dTweehp-eLir4AOu3KHe9Q.text: Service for take out was five stars. Very friendly, personable, helpful and accommodating.  Atmosphere was good as well. However, I go to a restaurant for food and the breakfast I got to go was eh, not to mention very expensive. Cost me nearly $20!!! for one meal, coffee and juice.   I asked for egg whites with turkey sausage, an English muffin and hash browns. The turkey "sausage" was not sausage at all but rather a ground turkey patty with diced pepper mixed in. Not at all what I was expecting and it was not described on the menu. Had I known what it was going to be, I wouldn't have ordered the turkey "sausage."   The hash browns were mushy, not fully cooked, unevenly cooked and certainly not crispy.  The English muffin was fine. It was buttered which I didn't mind as I like it that way but some people might prefer it dry or with the option of jelly and/or butter.   The portion of the egg whites was plentiful but they were unseasoned and egg whites need something. Would have loved salsa to go with them.   The orange juice was great and the coffee was awesome. The coffee really impressed me with its unique flavor that stood on its own -- no sugar or cream needed.   Overall impression: The breakfast disappointed me but the drinks and service were fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. My receipt as proof that I was a real customer.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Blob of egg whites, mushy hash browns, what they call turkey sausage which is really a ground turkey burger with peppers.

hVgryRmD8c4clW7m9QShfg.text: My friends and I decided to try this place for the first time and we were not disappointed! They literally have every food you could possibly be craving plus a full coffee bar and smoothies and milk shakes! Our waitress, Abby, was very nice and gave us recommendations on what to get on their massive menu. They also have daily food and drink specials, like on the day we went it was 5 dollars off any burger with the purchase of a beverage which was a pretty good deal based off their menu prices.

F_d88kDLQp8yX_J0GwrvTA.text: The vibe is cool and the service is good. i only had an appetizer because I was stopping in for happy hour. I do love the happy hour offerings the drinks are all $2 off.  I checked out the brunch menu and there are not any vegan offerings unless u basically create your own meal. I would go back for the affordable drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

HODyqjOz6HyBttcZJZd4Lg.text: Went there on Saturday for a late breakfast.  Place was busy but service was excellent. (Thanks Linda!)  Loved the outdoor seating.  Initially skeptical because of the huge menu, I was surprised by the quality and sophistication of our food.   Little touches and smart updates to standard recipes plus a brilliant Bloody Mary made my table very happy.  Great job!

wHu7CjHn2MNtkr4XHuAQsQ.text: Awesome place. Super friendly service from Abby. She took great care of us. A lot of good food for a good price! Definitely recommends

Be0ZJyRwVfm5fy1F01m7xg.text: I ordered the breakfast sandwich croissant and I couldn't eat it. It was soggy and more eggs and cheese then it was a sandwich. I was unable to even pick it up so I just separated it and ate the egg scramble/omelet style cook thing....I wanted to send it back but I didn't want to be a brat. Until I realized it cost almost $13 bucks. Kinda wanted to cry. I'm not the richest person so I felt pretty bad.    Also they didn't separate the check for a 12 person table. So that was a disaster between the table.  There menu is so massive and the most basic things are the worst things to order. Where is Gordon Ramsey honestly.   But it was busy so I guess other people like that sorta thing. Won't come back by choice.

30EKLf5-9pg6X-pCHS82JQ.text: So many options your bound to find something you like whether it's for breakfast for lunch. I've got a few favorites but kept it simple today with a burger and fries and the chicken & waffles... I wasn't alone!   I do enjoy the large high table they have. Perfect for group gatherings so make sure u call ahead if you're having an informal meeting or event. The table holds about 16 people and they have a private dining area with curtains. I've been here for several group luncheons and business meetings and the nice thing is they have a full bar (and wine room) to accommodate people.  Plenty of good beers on tap and atmosphere makes me feel stress-free. I don't do coffee, but they have a barista and plenty of options along with many breakfast cocktails (ie bloody mary & mimosa's) to compliment the meal. You will occasionally catch a local celebrity in the house but rememeber, they are just like us... all about gettin' they meal on so let them be. Outdoor patio and bridge bar is nice so enjoy it before the summer hits!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t remember what I ordered but a cross with a Moscow Mule with mint... delicious!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles with Bacon &amp; eggs!!

criyQ2yhuvjD4FedlC3m5Q.text: Amazing food.  Wonderful service.  There is no better place in Chandler to have morning business meetings!!

TOC3pbjtmp2Go9BlmLcr7Q.text: Most of the time I really like this place but had a really bad experience today with their "rules" which has never been an issue before. We brought our coffee rush coffee with us and sat down like many other times just to be told we had to either leave or take our coffee and put it in the car. Mind you I still ordered an OJ with breakfast but they didn't care! Gonna have to say probably not coming back, I'll take my business downtown chandler.

MVAlMA-qyeWwHu2mI0ds-w.text: This place is awesome.  Food was amazing and on Sundays they have a smokin mimosa deal for $15 for a pretty quality bottle.  The ambiance is nice and has a cool modern feel.  Took a little bit to get our server but they were a bit busy.  Highly highly recommend.

v16unb4ZTApstx56hkOd3w.text: Food was amazing. Had a larger group and everyone loved their meals! Biggest downside was the service. Slow waits for our server to come back to our table for refills, take the order, clear and bring boxes.  We had to order for one of our people when they ran to the bathroom. As she was coming back the server was about to walk away and we wanted to confirm the side for her sandwich. The server turned around and rolled her eyes and asked if she had to repeat the side options. We couldn't believe it! Two of us had to ask for refills. When we asked for boxes for our food, she never cleared away empty plates or asked if we were ready for the check. I really want to go back because the food was so good. But man, our server really is making us second guess going back!

GEBwEgyJq39y8SAdUCtuEw.text: I love the breakfast here. I recommend their egg Benedict, their hollandaise sauce is very flavorful and creamy. Also, their sweet potatoe fries and cappuccinos are very good.

qwHzoqucqNAIi5RXZPMLQg.text: My husband and I had our first visit to BLD a couple of days ago and I'm so glad we stopped in!  The restaurant has a modern vibe to it and feels like a hip place you'd find in Phoenix. It's very clean inside and the overall atmosphere is pretty relaxed. We appreciated the giant flat-screen TVs (on mute, with closed captioning) that kept us entertained while we waited for our food.  I ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffles (boneless fried chicken, bacon waffles and scrambled eggs) and my husband ordered "The Pig" omelet (bacon, ham, cheddar, sausage) served w/ red potato home fries and a side of pineapple chunks.  The chicken was perfectly fried with light breading and in turn, was not greasy at all! The seasoning was just right, juicy and I love how it's boneless so I could dig in without having to worry about bones. I am smitten!  The waffles were also very good and when I read that they were "studded" with bacon I thought it would be small bits of bacon but I was wrong. So wrong. They were jam packed with bacon strips so for all you bacon lovers out there, take note!  I should probably ask my husband for a review of his omelet and potatoes but for now I can tell you that he cleaned his plate! I had a couple of his potatoes and they were nicely seasoned.  The service was OK. Not great. Our server seemed a little aloof and when he'd walk past our area he wouldn't even look over at us unless we flagged him down. There were 3 other tables of people (that we could see) who kept craning their necks looking around for him to get their checks. Hopefully it was a fluke and the service here isn't consistently inattentive. This is why I didn't give BLD 5 stars.  I should also mention that the kitchen churns out food at a steady pace so that is always a nice thing to see.   Overall, the portions are large and the food is yummy. BLD gets a thumbs up from me!

Jd2BwRAO_TO_1pcZhdkQDg.text: 2 words....Be patient.  The food is worth it.  We have been there several times.  We really enjoy the food and friendly service.  However, every time we've been there the food can be a little slow in making it to the table.  But when it does make it, its always fresh and good.

SJwT0n5mHe4bMRydkxaXIQ.text: To start I've only had breakfast, but our friends that love BLD say breakfast is the best.  We've tried it 3 times, both getting something different and didn't like any of the meals.  I do like that we can bring our dog here.  Somebody once told us it depends on the day and who's cooking if the food is any good.  From the reviews it sounds like it.  The service is really good, beer options are good, happy is good.

SE_GqEYmjieuy0lHkJS3lQ.text: I really like BLD. The service may be spotty at times, but I really enjoy the wide variety of breakfast and lunch options, and the servings are always really big. They get four stars because I like the interior, the patio, the food, and the bar. They do need to improve on the service though. My husband and I both ordered beers with our lunch but they didn't arrive until after the food. Bottom line, I'll continue to come and eat here  even if they are kinda slow.

6cATt45aVF5dKqPBD9SEYw.text: Great place for dinner and drinks! Fried chicken is excellent. I've tried the spare ribs, but disappointed with the dry meat and cold mash potatoes. Drinks are great, the waitress will even make you a specialty. Good place for happy HH and catch a game while sitting at the bar!

8gH3NcaE2xyxyB6N_W8KLw.text: We've been back several times for weekend breakfast and always happy with the interesting menu choices. FAVORITE is the green chili pork tostado!!!  Great portion size so you can share. Usually the hawaiin bread style French toast with bananas is another favorite, but this time it wasn't as moist and tender. Was dry as though bread didn't soak up enough of egg batter. BUT customer service was excellent and they switched it out for fluffiest cake like pancakes ever :)  Also, cappuccino and mocha lattes are coffee shop quality!

OX5QKV52_xsxvBO5l7tYQw.text: Twice now I have been let down by the staff.  Yesterday we came in around 220p got seated right away.  Then after 15 min of nobody coming by we got up and left.  The food is great but service lacks alot.

zCuFjcU1CdzhiLVV1ikg5A.text: Great atmosphere! Great food and Bloody Mary!! The captain crunch French toast is a favorite! Even has dog friendly patio.

Ya8Q2iCzUp3054aSlovgkA.text: We have been here many times, I just haven't checked in. Every time I try something new. Always live their lunch specials. When it's busy it takes a while to get a table but the food came out fast and delicious. The wait staff is very attentive.

At8vs4AO73QoML6i9UCRpQ.text: First time here. Enjoyed breakfast at noon. Good atmosphere, good food, clean and friendly. Server was honest and helpful. Potatoes a little dry but my main course (open faced breakfast sandwich) was delicious and hearty! Nice job. I'll be back.

uJFZJfPjroeHGusoAOOvSg.text: I went back. We were hoping to get their Restaurant Week menu but they only offer it at dinner. But we were all starving so we stayed and ordered. We sat at the huge shared table I mentioned in my original review that they used as a business table. The Cardinals game was about to come on and we wanted a view of the TVs that I  also mentioned in my previous review that showed a vile news program. They didn't turn the game on at the start but finished the KC/Wash game and we missed a Cards field goal. (Bitter)  The service was GREAT today. I should have gotten our server's name, she was timely, informative and super friendly. Long blonde hair and knew triathlons.   About the food - first negative - no kid's menu and the prices are so high.   My older boy got the chicken and waffles, this is no LoLo's but the kid really liked it. Small piece of what appeared boneless chicken, lots of waffles with BACON crumbled on top, and a big pile of scrambled eggs (totally unnecessary for the kid) $13  The younger boy couldn't find anything he wanted so we got him the BBQ sliders with the caramelized onions and aioli on the side with fries. $10 He wasn't impressed.  The husband got the short rib sandwich. Huge, spilling over with meat and caramelized onions, the bread looked rustic but soft with onion rings - he loved it. Enjoyed with Sessions lager. $11.75  I got the smoked turkey, thick bacon, thick tomato slices, sprouts and pesto aioli on a croissant. Huge sandwich I could only eat half and was very full. You really can't screw up this sandwich and it wasn't a risky order - I just needed something good after a long run morning. I also got the sweet potato fries, perfect with small but visible bits of salt. Enjoyed with a hoppy beer from Boulder Brewing $10.75  It was a much better experience then the first time. They serve you a ton of food we have three boxes in our fridge right now and the prices reflect that. The total was $67 for four lunch/breakfast meals, two sodas, three beers. Now that I typed it out, thought about the quality of food and beer, it is fine. It was a good meal except I missed the start of the game. Boo.

ZImZpmIJdM9BhyvHNly9gA.text: Great service. The food was very heavy. We felt like we just gained 20pounds. Not fantastic. We r full in a bad way. Unsatisfied. The food looked appetizing. Menu looked appealing but food did not taste good.

Y_lFLvdmmeA2ZbNT7cpUlg.text: I have had BLD 3x and tried the breakfast chicken fried steak, the simple breakfast, and the goat burger.  Breakfast Chicken Fried Steak: Portion amazing, breakfast tots seasoned and cooked w a light oil. The steak was one of the best I've had: panko breading and seasoned and an eye appealing garnish. I do believe there was a side of fruit too.  Simple Breakfast: Portion again good but not as heavy, obviously. Two eggs over easy, bacon, potatoes, and toast. All was excellent and timely. My friend ordered the fried chicken and waffles. The portion was small but the quality looked and as I've been informed was excellent.  The Goat Burger: A well designed burger, the textures and eye appeal were as satisfying as the flavor. Thick all natural beef patty topped w goat cheese, arugula, roasted tomatoes and BACON JAM! Yeah I said bacon jam.....   Hands down this is a place you gotta try. The food is prepared w organic produce and local when available. The quality of the product is what stands out here. Did I mention the have a solid happy hour too?

5_kh-0FhuYRWV2Q8XP5DJw.text: Caroline & I had breakfast at BLD in Chandler yesterday (NE corner of Dobson and Germann) and were quite pleased. As those of you know us know, we don't eat out much because Caroline's cooking is so much better. But we keep trying to find places to love. BLD may be one of those places.   We were greeted at the door by the hostess with beautiful eyes and a fabulous smile. A small touch, but it immediately made us feel welcome. So many stores get this first, simple step so very wrong. BLD got it right.  The atmosphere is good - kind of a warm, modern Chipotle-ish interior - not schlock-country or faux-dining room like so many breakfast joints. But of course the main reason for being there was the food.  The menu is simple and not overwhelming. A large enough list of choices without being too many. I liked that. (Often, restaurants with huge selections are not great at anything. Better to be narrow and deep than broad but shallow.)  The service was courteous but not intrusive. We took some time making our selection and the waitress gave us that time without giving us attitude. Thank you. Caroline selected the Spanish omelette and I chose the vegetarian.   Both omelettes were served with potatoes that were actually very, very good. So often, breakfast potatoes are either too salty, too raw, too bland, too soft, or just too much. These were just right. Again, thank you.  Both omelettes were distinctive and tasty. My vegetarian omelette was bursting with good vegetable flavors - portobella mushrooms, bell peppers, tomatoes, onions - and was well seasoned. I enjoyed eating every bite of it, except for the bite I shared with Caroline. Her's was much more a meat-flavored dish, and was savory without being too much.  My coffee was terrific. I don't know why so many places get coffee wrong when it is so easy to get it right. BLD got the coffee right. They also offer coffee-bar drinks. Caroline had the cafe' breve and it was very nice. Of course, if you start with good espresso, it makes everything else fall in line.  Brent, the GM, dropped by our table and chatted a while with us. He told us that both he and the three owners all live within a couple of miles of the restaurant. What a pleasure to be able to support local businesses and to be rewarded with good food, good service and a good experience.  Good job, BLD. Check it out.

JhsPJ0wZdjFvmR7vZZh5hw.text: I ordered the soft tacos for dinner and was so disappointed.  The meat was full of fat so I spent the whole dinner pulling fat out of almost bite I took. If you're going to charge $12-14 for tacos then use quality meat. Also,   not everyone can handle spicy sauces so I  had mine put on the side and I'm so glad I did. It was so spicy I couldn't eat it which made my tacos boring. I'm sticking with the Power House salad next time I eat at bld.

YdDnW_Sch73LcxI623ZzLA.text: I love the atmosphere of this place! Especially because it's a dog friendly patio. The food was pretty good. Service was ok, was the only reason I put it down to 4 stars. It definitely seemed understaffed with only 1 person handling the whole patio. The poor thing was running around and forgot us a couple times. Other than that, I did like it here.

SFjVNuJ0rFQMw4SPYu6O8A.text: Shasta at BLD is the Obi Wan Kenobi of servers.  She knew put drinks and had them in front of us before we at down!

ZQalTTjWXJFtm-58lgUsMQ.text: I have to update my review because the service was great, not five stars yet but on their way. The menu is eclectic and I really enjoyed the steak tacos. The bartender was friendly and attentive, their nitro coffee is great too. So glad I gave them another shot because I wasn't disappointed.

L6W-cMGXnfMWkvWUTvYl9A.text: Every time I go in, the service is amazing, the food is amazing and the drinks are flowing. The portions are big and you get quality food for an affordable price. Spencer is the go to bartender and server! He cares about you as a customer and the quality of food and service! I would definitely recommend this place! They have an amazing brunch also!

xc-M0SMtFpg0ZOLt-QlUAg.text: It's a shame that the staff and management is as bad as it is here since the food is delicious. I have only been for breakfast but everything we have had has been great! As for the staff everyone that we have come in contact with has been very slow and lacked customer service. Could be a great spot if it had better staff!

2ytUoeA8hxcjYFZPZE46kw.text: Great place. I love breakfast here. Today I brought my dog for the first time (to any restaurant). They were great. They brought her treats, carrots, and water. It was a wonderful experience for me and I think she enjoyed it too! Thank you BLD!

yvcRgg6qYtNTGZ8mcZMsUA.text: I rarely leave a bad review, but the poor service, huge disparity between food quality, and price at this establishment left me no choice. During our one and only visit my wife requseted a taste of the dressing for the Cobb as it was a little unusual. Our waitress insisted that she had no way to provide a free sample and that there would be a charge. A charge for a taste of salad dressing!?! Preposterous!     Maybe it was the bad taste in our mouths from the dressing "incident", but needless to say, when the food arrived it was all just sub par. It seemed that there were good intentions in terms of dish creativity, but the ingredients themselves were just so cheap. It was ever so obvious that profit was the sole driving force for the ownership.    Heed the reviews! Avoid this place. BLD is just BAD.

Eq9cOT6BA9qbUUEMSaXDXQ.text: A group of us went thinking you could get breakfast lunch and dinner all day and night.  You can't we heard of the pot roast burrito it was just as great as everyone said.  A few weeks later we went back we could no longer get the burrito at the time we went. The service was slow and the food was cold. We complained waitress just said sorry then continued on her way she didn't offer to heat it up or replace it . This place went downhill so fast

p_PNSBxDczpTVQzUfJLUgw.text: Boring and bland food.   We ordered a pig lovers omelette (which was good) and a country fried steak, and biscuits and gravy, and byo omelette. All four dishes came with unseasoned potatoes. Mine had cheese which helped a lot. The gravy was more like gruel. Flavorless.  All in all it was just a boring uninspired meal.  They get a bonus star for our server who was friendly and kind. Also I ordered a White Russian "buzzed" coffee drink that was delicious.  It's unlikely we will return except for coffee drinks in the future.

ac4s0JTv_s2ZBhk6t3rV3w.text: I came here for dinner one evening and found their burger to be one of tastiest I've tried in greater Phoenix.   It was a Friday night and I started out with their Blue Cheese Iceberg Wedge (photo).  As you can see it was smothered in bacon, blue cheese and dressing. I wouldn't even guess at the caloric intake for this cardiac arrest special, but it was well worth it.   As for my equal delicious pre-ER meal, I ordered their Blue Burger for $14.00. My burger was cooked properly, to medium/medium rare with a warm pink inside (see photo), then let to cool to keep all the juices inside. You just don't expect such care at your local family burger place.   Dinner ran me $25, but it was worth every penny.    Enjoy!

CRcnxfhEp6-GDjzv9L7mHg.text: After writing an amazing review last time we used the catering again.  Boy that was a mistake.  Second time was so so disappointing. Brisket  was so bland and fatty.  The beans came out of a can. The potato salad was obviously old no one even ate it.  Here I had bragged to my guests how good it was. Major  major poor quality. The ribs were cold and meatless.  Not going to have this again.

mvfEzvAvkUBTZbW4WkVPjQ.text: After seeing the reviews a group of us decided to give it a try anyway And I don't think any of us will return.   First we requested to sit outside and were told it would be 30 minutes to be outside. We finally got called and than sat us inside. When we requested about outside again, the hostess just kind of shrugged her shoulders and then that was that.  We continued to wait around 15 minutes for water. Our drink order took another 15 minutes.   Food, some ordered lunch which seemed like the better option and three of us breakfast. The pancakes one had were good, the biscuits and gravy were so bad my friend didn't even take a second bite. I had the chicken fried steak and it also was not good. It lacked flavor. And the gravy tasted like Campbells cream of mushroom soup!   After not touching her food at all, the server looked at the plate and didn't bother to ask if it was okay or anything but asked if she wanted a box or toss it.   Service was not good, hostesses have unfriendly demeanors, and the food stunk. Why come here when there's numerous other options?

WRq1eI9BvFisjlFKlvpgog.text: I've only had breakfast here - I'm a fan! I know people that eat here nearly every weekend and are never disappointed. On my visit here, we both ordered a breakfast hash. I got the meatloaf and he got hash of the dog. Both were phenomenal. I'm always a little weary of meatloaf, but for breakfast, in combination with the potatoes and everything else on that plate, it was a wise decision. Our server agreed that it was one of his favorites. My boyfriend's hash of the dog - a short rib version of hash - also completely tasty! Large portions. Dog friendly patio. Meal service of all types (Breakfast, Lunch, & Dinner) served all day, so there's something that everyone in your party will love on the menu. Try it - you won't regret it.

WaPgKOgtnHeumoS2VwHUKw.text: This is my favorite brunch place. I love the farmers hash! The location is great. Just off of the freeway. Inside tends to be busy especially on weekends. So don't expect a quick stop. Also can tend to be loud or messy when busy. But they do clean the tables in a reasonable amount of time.  The service is fair - I have had bad experiences where our server doesn't stop by. But I have had normal experiences as well. It seems to be hit or miss. I took one star off for the inconsistent service.  Food is always the correct temperature, delicious and fresh. I would suggest this place to a friend.

omyH7UXSucgkIjVkYd2nfA.text: This place is so good!! Came here for dinner and had beef tacos. Service was friendly and fast. Food amazing. Can't wait to come back!

21FVYPbDiushhdntghDYZg.text: Finally, I've found a breakfast place in Chandler that I really enjoy.   The restaurant is well decorated. The seats were comfy and spacious. I ordered a latte instead of regular coffee. It was a bit bitter even after adding sugar. Nevertheless, I was glad that I tried something different. For entree, I ordered a Hawaiian french toast. It was fluffy, soft, covered with fine powder and slices of bananas. The syrup that they served it with was still warm. I really enjoyed it a lot. I took a bite of another order - biscuits and gravy. It was very delicious and took another 5 bites after that :)   Our server was great. She gave us refill for ice tea without asking and was super attentive. Even though she didn't come by much towards the end of our meal, it was only because she was super busy. Overall, I think it was outstanding. I'll definitely come back here again to try their breakfast special or dinner.

cpQI-pWVrS1u-Awn6-MiEw.text: First timer here.  They have a full coffee menu which was great! The regular menu is plentiful as well. Hosts and staff were great. They have awesome decor. Prices seem to be a tad high for what it was in my opinion - I'm a cheap guy though. I had breakfast there, but everything else looked great as dishes passed by.  Food was about 3/5 Staff 5/5 Price 3/5 Coffee 4/5 Location 5/5

qhwPISc-wnkwkL1s3Qwpzw.text: Clean restaurant with a good atmosphere. Only recommendation not gonna rip on the place or anything, but the "Texas Style Brisket" is not texas style. Not smoked, sliced paper thin, and if it was properly seasoned Texas style I couldn't tell cause I had to put a lot of salt and pepper on it. Really though you can't expect a place like that to smoke their meat, and it was still rather tender which is always good, not to mention the barbecue sauce was ideal to what a good barbecue sauce should be. Not too sweet and a touch of smoke with some spice. Just please change the name of your "Texas style" brisket cause that's gonna offend some Texans as they tend to be proud people. Great spot though!

OZe46r9nSLfnEBhYFdr6CA.text: We love this place and we always sit outside and take our 100 lb dog.  They are so friendly to him and bring him treats with our permission of course.  I feel like we run the servers because we sit outside and that can't be easy but they always have a smile on their face and never cop any kind of attitude.  The food is amazing with huge portions and their lattes are delicious. Staff is wonderful food is great highly recommend

6m8gRb5QXxQ3sLchMYk4SA.text: Today was my first time visiting here and it will be the last. I was so excited to try this place after a friends recommendation, unfortunately we had a horrible experience. My gut told me to exit as soon as the drinks were delivered.  Before I start my rant let me tell you there was our table of two and another table of two in the entire restaurant, that's it. Our waitress was Diann, her attitude and customer service was despicable. She was one of those waitresses that just chucks something on your table and walks off real quick, before you can bother her with something else. I think we genuinely inconvenienced her by asking for a tea and coffee refill, and yes we had to ask it was not offered.  I honestly cannot give anything better than an ok review on the food due to the customer service leaving such a bad taste in my mouth.

4vwoSurWWbVqGa-rZY2KqA.text: My friend & I were out on Sunday night about 6:05pm. We got hungry. All the restaurants were full but BLD. So we stopped. Almost no one there. We thought this is great. Hostess asked us to wait, & 15 minutes later she seats us & gives us water & disappears. So friend goes to bar & orders drinks. Bartender takes her order & tells her to sit down someone will bring it to us. Bartender storms off complaining loudly that we walked up to bar & ordered. Here comes hostess & its 6:30. Bartender is bitching as she brings us our drinks & our waitress disappears. Waitress comes back & takes our order (6:45pm). 7:05 pm, Food is excellent but wine is bitter & tastes old. We eat & pay for our meal & leave.   Food is excellent  ....but service is nonexistent & bartender is bitchy awful!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

WHeKlTIvR5tnE20bKQ3Fzg.text: BLD has been a go-to staple of chandler for years - the food has always been good and very tasty.  When BLD first opened, I would give them 5 stars, but over the years they must have changed management or owners, because the service has dropped a lot. There used to be more vibrant, more experienced servers working here, it had a way different vibe. Now it's mostly older, less experienced servers who tend to slow things down, and frankly they're not as friendly. I had a server recently named Jay who was just painfully slow, forgetful, and really bad at his job to be honest. I enjoyed my breakfast entree, but I didn't enjoy waiting 40 minutes to get eggs on my table with missing drinks and sides. He also never apologized once for screwing up several times. I miss the old servers and service back when they opened up, it was more bubbly and more welcoming.  That aside, the food is still very good and their breakfasts are satisfying. The eggs and omelettes are filling, portions are hearty, and it's a good place to fill up. Be wary of coming on Sundays after 9am, it's jam packed and you'll end up sitting on a bar stool if you're lucky. The early bird gets the worm.

AoHBNgxJ4jJ3111lWySKCA.text: Food ok, not great   My family just had breakfast here and we will probably not be back ,  we ordered chicken and waffles and the chicken had no flavor , my boyfriend didn't want to say anything but I told our waitress , our server Kim was concerned and wanted him to try a different entree and she recommended the chicken fried steak so he agreed and when he cut into it it wasn't cooked through so he told her to take it back and that he'd just deal with the bland chicken , we could tell that made her mad when he said that so she just took it and walked away from it , so we finished and got the bill .. a manager never came to talk to us , she took the chicken and waffles off the bill but added the chicken fried steak and when she returned with the credit card she put the card with receipts on the table and without even looking at us she turned away and said "thank you guys" as she was walking away .... we just feel disappointed , we have been to restaurants before where there were mistakes made, things not cooked right and we understand things happen but it gets fixed and we leave satisfied that we were at least acknowledged ...  very disappointed

EMTQM11Ujux9_p3sYzz8aw.text: I come to this place more than any other restaurant. The food is wonderful and the drinks are spot on. The menu list is extensive, yet freshly made. As often as I come here, I'm still no closer to having explored the entire menu. -- That being said, any dish with their short rib is sure to impress.  Huge thank you to Abby and Linda for making this a great dining experience with excellent service.

f9OeNZ2mDkz7YZpvaZ34TA.text: Tried this place today and there was nothing I didn't like. parking was easy There was no wait at 11o'clock on a Sunday so we were off to a good start. Server (Kim) was attentive but didn't make us feel rushed... there menu and drink menu is massive. My meatloaf hash skillet was perfect. Definitely want to go back and try something other interesting menu items.

uXO8XKAeKezDXhiwSIXNdg.text: Breakfast Lunch and Dinner , this is an okay spot for whatever you have a taste for. Broad menu with lots of options. I ordered a veggie scramble and a waffle. The scramble was good, the waffle was ok. I like my waffles to be more fluffy and light. My wife ordered a burger which she did not enjoy. The burger patty seemed like it was pressed together (not sure if that was the case or not). My son ordered the steel cut oatmeal and a chicken omelet which he thought was good.  The staff was very friendly and helped us navigate through the menu. The condition of the restaurant was excellent, very clean and plenty of seating.   Great customer service

_cJh2x2w8zCZmJuzzbHfnA.text: Good, not great.   The hubby and I checked out BLD Chandler with some friends of ours yesterday for lunch. It has a lively, rambunctious vibe to it. Our friends had two kids under 4 and their talking/cries/giggles were matched by people drinking and fellowshipping all around us.   The menu is extensive, so chances are I could've just ordered the wrong thing. I'm definitely willing to check them out again. I loved how the waiters would come around and engage the kids! So cute. But our waitress would disappear for long periods of time, it was hard to snag her throughout the lunch.   I ordered the "Shaved Prime Rib Sandwich with a side of BLD Mac N Cheese" and the hubby ordered the "Pig Omelette". The sandwich was overwhelming, so much meat and cheese. I forgot to ask for no mushrooms so that definitely took away from my lunch. The Mac n Cheese was excellent! I found my sandwich okay ... just not superb and the meet had tons of fat! Hubby loved his omelette and he ate every bite of it.   Overall, as I said pretty good not great.

4Kobzjx2A_fcP0pBn-Tekw.text: This is one of those neighborhood places that is near home that I grab a bite at every once in awhile. BLD is located in the Shops at Pecos Ranch which is home to many of Chandler's good eats. BLD (Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner) serves made-from-scratch, farm-fresh food. They have a "virtually everything" concept that includes a drive-thru window and a pretty large menu. From the drive-thru you can order barista-made coffee beverages, protein shakes, juices, smoothies and some foods. The interior is upscale casual contemporary and features an indoor/outdoor bar. They also have a very large community table that seats quite a few people. Dinner includes a wide variety of choices that includes comfort foods like fried chicken and waffles, meatloaf, burgers and large salads. Lunch includes sandwiches, burgers, salads and tacos. Breakfast includes Eggs Benedict, hashes, waffles and breakfast burritos. BLD has a pretty good happy hour with discounted prices on drinks and appetizers.

h8HQk7-UvSxwNjdoGaSjOg.text: After hearing great things about Bld I knew I had to check it out! Abby was our server and was fantastic. She always had a smile even when my son spilled my sangria all over the table!!  The burgers were awesome but I hear I need to go back on a Friday to check out the fish and chips!! Can't wait!!

gjs5Hh5kW6n-v-FCrffB1A.text: The menu choices at this place are mind boggling.  I enjoyed the chicken fried steak with a side of biscuit.  For dessert I ordered the Captain Crunch Latte, it was sweet and simple.  I didn't taste the cereal at all.  It was just fun to order something different.   We'll back for more food.   Fish and chips are on the menu board for Friday,  so we'll be back!

qeuH0c8FGVLatBW2xoyf4g.text: I have come here for brunch 3-4 times. I get the pork belly tostada every time and every time it's the best thing I've ever eaten for brunch. I order it without the pico on top. Do yourself and get it next time you're here.  My husband gets the chicken and waffles and the portion is huge, chicken is great, and the waffles are average. He's gotten the eggs Benedict once, but prefers the chicken and waffles over them.   The service has always been courteous and fast- I've never had a problem here and I recommend BLD to everyone!  Update: went back yesterday 11/11 and it was awesome as usual :) my husband got the BLD burger and it was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

oSL51Dzo0JYNm9nZVu3fcQ.text: Parking: free parking lot out front  Food: They have a massive menu, and the food like-wise is served in massive portions. Both the fun cocktails and food were delicious, but it was almost too much food to eat! I wish I split my meal with someone else! The items are more on the pricey side (~$15-16) for such a casual spot, but you definitely get enough food!  Service: Service was pretty regular and quick. Nothing bad to say!  Ambiance: This is someplace that is casual, but still a sit-down and be served experience. It wasn't busy at all when we came in after the dinner rush, and it was pretty quiet and calm.

v1IiQ_5agnUKpXbismLuRQ.text: First time eating at this restaurant and both my husband and I loved it! I had the huevos rancheros, my husband had the dutch baby. Big portions, good flavor, good vibe! Our Server Abby was very nice and attentive. Definitely coming back.

VW6m261rNVu2ED-ndvh29g.text: Our waitress Kim was the best!  It was our first time there and she made wonderful suggestions for us (we have food restrictions). She also got us a sample of the Dutch baby which was very delicious. We plan on coming back frequently.

70xdjpxd5_fvy78qRM-42w.text: The family and I just happened upon this great neighborhood restaurant.  Great selection on the menu.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Linda was the best server we've had in quite some time.  Food came out well prepped and delicious.  It's not too often the whole family enjoys the same restaurant.

ZdO0PVsZ29UCoGfi9RDPJg.text: BLD, what happened to you?   We used to live in the area and ate there weekly, and loved it. We returned last night after about a year away. We found that the menus had changed for the worse. Now there are indecipherable and revolting photos on the menu, which made me want to gag. The menu font is so screwed up it is nearly unreadable, and the menu is so disorganized that appetizers and desserts are listed on the same page.   I ordered the cajun tacos, and they came with huge chunks of jalapenos that should have been finely diced in the pico.  His salad was fine, nothing extraordinary. We love to support local establishments, but it's doubtful we'll be back.

svqxuszj5xItzCkumRudpA.text: We were here for breakfast, all excited after seeing the menu online. What a letdown.!! The bad..., Hollandaise tastes like vinegar, breakfast potatoes had no onions and were just luke warm. The waitress brought a new side of sauce, but it wasn't any better and she didn't offer anything else. How about just making a good Hollandaise?! The "Dog Hash" tasted ok, but the bowl had an inch of meat juice in the bottom, kind of like a stew and not a hash?? The good..., the biscuit was great. All considered and for what we paid, we would not go back and don't recommend it at all.

1JEAgYrF8EMbpQFUE3rjdQ.text: My husband and I usually go go another restaurant in the same development, but we received a gift card for BLD and decided to check it out. We've been here a couple of times over the past couple months. We first came in to try dinner and then returned for breakfast later.    Husband was not super impressed with his dinner, and I was pretty happy with mine.   (In fact, I thought his was pretty good, he was just expecting something different) The next time, for breakfast we came with his sister as well and we were all pretty happy about our experience.

0LQt6NGsWMS29T0eHEBOmg.text: We went to BLD last night for dinner and enjoyed the food as well our server, Abby. The service was great! We will try their breakfast sometime soon!

Enu0MtGdy0q6fRhIArRb1Q.text: First time here and it was excellent! Had the monte cristo which was amazing and the service was seriously great! Micah waited us and was so attentive, made recommendations that turned True, and just super friendly. Will definitely be back soon!

ZhDz68Lr77rE3kBMaYc6kw.text: The food is amazing and staff (ice-breaker Stephanie) so friendly! Green chili pork tostados with eggs!   We're coming back soon.

snr9R6R-dkqWT3QQ_VigNg.text: You can't spell "bland" without B-L-D.  Sure, that's a little harsh, but I couldn't pass up a good line.  BLD (Breakfast-Lunch-Dinner) is a nice-looking restaurant.  It's standalone building in front of a new strip mall, that seems to be anchored by the always-packed Oregano's.  It's bright and contemporary, with lots of natural light.  There's a bar on one side of the restaurant, and there's outdoor seating for when the weather isn't so painfully warm.    My wife and I stopped in around 11am, perfect timing to taste 2 of the 3 meals advertised by the restaurant name.  After a lot of menu reading, I went  for coffee and the vegetarian scramble, and my wife chose the chicken sandwich with apples and brie.  (Important note:  My wife's lactose intolerance caused her to omit the brie.)  She also opted for the pineapple cole slaw over the other fries and other sides.  There were several smoothies and espresso drinks available on the menu, but we passed on the fancy beverages.  The coffee ($2.50) was heavily roasted and very strong.  Refills were quick and included in the (steep) price.  My scramble ($10) was all in one piece... technically I thought it was a fritata, but I'm hardly an expert on such matters.  I liked the mixture of vegetables in the scramble, especially the leeks.  The veggies were thinly sliced so you get egg with every vegetable bite, and the swiss cheese on top was a nice choice.  The roasted potatoes were some uninspired spuds, without much seasoning or distinction.  I'm not going to dwell on my wife's chicken sandwich ($11).  Let's just say she asked for plain, and she got it.  The pineapple slaw was very disappointing, though.  There was barely a hint of pineapple flavor in this Falsely advertised cabbage.  I think BLD suffers from trying to be too much.  It's a coffee shop, juice bar, restaurant, and bar that serves all 3 meals, with gourmet hints in their everyman menu.  Got it?  For real gourmet food, try Cork (which has the same owner as BLD.)  For comfort food, you can do better for cheaper.

fIXCGHsUNxywArZSVPVZKg.text: Average food. Trendy and clean interior but the food was like your average American breakfast and brunch spot. Nothing that wow'd me. I ordered the chicken and waffles. I was expecting a nice hearty sized fried piece of chicken or two, but got one sub par sized piece, if that. I wasn't the only one, as I heard another gentleman grumble about the chicken portion/size. Pretty disappointed by the size of serving. The fried chicken itself seemed dull and boring in flavor. No batter if any, almost as if they used a skinless breast meat with no batter. The waffle was good. A little above average. I tasted my other patrons food, the country fried chicken and pancakes. Again, no wow factor, average. I kind of expected more from the restaurant considering the nice interior and lay out. Maybe it was a hit or miss kind of thing. Service was great though. But all in all in terms of food, average.

BQaPvwRHrwydZBNvOvbsmw.text: Went there for the first time this morning. Loved it!!! My new favorite brunch spot. Will definitely be going back soon!

Brr4leFKjN7dqYCJ5ryg4Q.text: I've been to BLD for breakfast twice. The prices are fair for the amount of food you get. The breakfast menu has a good variety of options and the place is clean. The wait, however, is questionable. Both times I went on a Sunday and waited 10-20 mins at most for a table. The service could be better. Those who wait on you tend to take your order after you've looked around for them; busy or not, service is critical. The community table gets the worst service in my opinion (will never sit there again).This place is convenient and provides a break after Sunday church service. One day I'll try lunch and dinner, they have a decent menu.

WU6Wpu3EHC34ve9Fkc54jg.text: The breakfast is the best ive ever had. The chicken fried steak is the most wonderful thing ive ever eaten in the history of breakfasts.  I do not know what kind of magic breakfast voodoo they conjur up in their kitchen, but every time we sit down for a meal their we leave with very very happy bellies!

vBtpCDvMx6352gMy6NCQJA.text: I really like BLD! It has fun food options on the menu and a small but good drink menu. Sometimes the wait staff is a little lack luster but most of the time they are on it. Everything I have tried on the menu has be very tasty!

etHCIYM_6fIoXvf2RUI9Jw.text: Atmosphere = ***  Unfortunately, my first impression of the place was the smell of cleaner.  The chemical smell in the air lingered for the duration of our stay.    The layout is nice, spacious without being cavernous and tastefully decorated, if somewhat lacking personality.  Just clean, standard modern decor.  I went at 8 am this morning (Sunday) and there were only half a dozen guests.  I am guessing that, once filled with people, the vibe is a bit more exciting.  As many have mentioned, BLD is located in the soul-sucking, cultural-void suburb that is Chandler.  The lack of tasty treats in the area definitely contributes to the buzz around this place, since the only other decent restaurants of the non-chain variety are in 'Downtown' Chandler.    The drive-thru option is solid gold, (you have to call ahead for meals, of course.)  Very smart idea by whoever orchestrated the build-out.  Service = ****  Very good.  We were greeted immediately by the hostess.  Our server checked in with us often enough to feel welcome and taken care of, but not so often that we felt smothered.  When we had a complaint on our food, he handled it smoothly and without any trace of attitude, but did not overcompensate with repeated apologies either.  Well done.  Food = **  Our breakfast was disappointing.  Conceptually, the menu has a lot of promising ideas, but the recipes/execution were lacking.  There was a good variety of choices without being too many, (a giant menu is almost always a bad sign.)  My vanilla latte had WAY too much vanilla, could barely taste or smell the coffee at all.  I left half of it behind.  The boyfriend and I are benedict addicts, so that's what we went for.  He had the short rib, and I had the crab cake.    I felt two ways about the citrus hollandaise on my crab benedict.  The texture was superb, thick but somehow light and very creamy.  The flavor, unfortunately, was far too sweet.  Combined with the natural sweetness of the crab meat, it made for a more confectionary experience than savory one.  The crab was good (no imitation crap), but sadly underseasoned and crying for more of a sear on the outside to lend some texture and color.  The eggs were a bit overdone - when I cut into them I got a trickle of yolk instead of the flood of it that all benedict-lovers crave.    The short rib benedict featured meat far too dry for the cut.  The dryness left the meat with a charred aftertaste that wasn't incredibly pleasant.  The red wine hollandaise was decent, but lacked the acid that I assumed a red wine hollandaise would have.  The eggs were a bit better on this go-around.  The potatoes served with both meals were barely room temperature.  We told our server and received a fresh portion, which were hotter, but still had the same rubbery texture as the last.  That being said, they were beautifully seasoned.  There was plenty of good flavor going on, but texture was really lacking.  There was no crunch or bite, only chew chew chew chew.  Our server automatically brought ketchup in portion cups, which seemed a bit wasteful.  A plain old bottle would have sufficed.  With some recipe tweaking and practice on the line, both of these dishes have potential.  I will definitely give this place another try, but it won't be anytime soon.   With the lack of options in the area, I am guessing they will be successful.

LI-VDhWgK2XalXofgfNvLA.text: Service is once again slow ... My server never checked on me after she dropped off my food except to take my empty dishes. Then it took her about 10 minutes to bring me my check, another 5 minutes to pick up my check and finally another 5+ minutes to bring me my change. Food here is good but the service doesn't make it worthwhile to come back. Which is too bad, the restaurant is a good concept in a great neighborhood. But with shoddy service, I don't see them surviving.

TAmcjGU0v01g9kBntm_ElA.text: I was very disappointed on my last visit at BLD I first heard of them on one of my favorite food blogs I've been going there for 2 years with my husband and every time I went to service the food was excellent never had a problem. Today my mom was on that side of town with me and she wanted to try a new place so I recommend bld. Then it turns out our Hostess was our waitress she had a horrible attitude. My mom had asked her if they have nachos and she said no we have fried kettle chips with sour cream and green onions on it. We placed our order next thing I noticed there's a sign on the table offering a happy hour variety list on the list clearly said nachos bacon green onion and cheddar sour cream when I pointed that out to my mom  was kind of mad that the waitress wasn't attentive to point that out.  So my mom ended up ordering a pastrami sandwich which came with sauerkraut in Thousand Island my mom had ask the server if they could hold off on the sauerkraut.  when our food arrived are french fries were cold the my mom's sandwich which was a pastrami sandwich was one slice of pastrami chopped up and put into a sandwich just imagine one slice. When my mom had mentioned something to the waitress about the meat the waitress said would you like to reorder something else instead of saying hey if you want you can pay a little extra and I can get you some more meat. Didn't receive our refills till we were done with our meals. Just super disappointed this was my favorite place for a while for homestyle comfort food. I also felt just a cold vibe from the staff after I paid I had walked up to an employee and I have asked them if management had changed and it seems like after I asked that question was asked they became defensive Tony if I had mentioned these complaints to my server and I said yes my mother did she really didn't have an answer for me industrious I won't be going back

42LEae5AHhSShIxA0hOA0g.text: I live right down the street from BLD and go there often.  Great CRAFT BEER Selection and service at the bar cant be beat.  Did I mention their green chilli pork? OMG!

4eUgKwgj-i5pwJKZ5ijr7w.text: Rocky Road Bread Pudding.  Need I say more??  No really. That should be the end of my review.  Because that's all you need to know.  That they have Rocky Road Bread Pudding.  And it's DELICIOUS.  I've also had their sandwiches (WHOA food - no kidding, a sandwich can feed 2 people easily - they're huge) along with their homemade chips (yum!), and also I have had a pasta chicken dish that was tasty as well (not fireworks status but tasty nonetheless).  Their coffee is spectacular (read: strong) as is their red sangria (don't worry, didn't try them at the same time).  Overall I love this place.  Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because their homemade chips aren't consistent - sometimes REALLY good, sometimes just "meh".  When in the area you must stop in.  Don't forget to try their bread pudding!!

OjVH2OUrgbJea5BJkwHz-g.text: The wife and I stopped in on Saturday afternoon for a mid-afternoon lunch and cocktail.  The server, Joe, took forever to get to out table.  when he did, he hitched up his leg and "scratched the inside of his thigh."  while talking to us.  My wife ordered a wine that took 25 minutes to arrive (after we flagged down our server).  Lunch took 45 minutes to show up. We were actually standing up to leave when the server came around the corner with our food.  My wife ordered a veggie sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The sandwich had turkey so it had to be remade.  This time, there was no lettuce or the spicy mustard ordered.  When we asked our server, he returned with raspberry dressing. This was pointed out and he finally returned with the correct mustard.  By this time, the croissant was a greasy, sloppy mess.  I ordered the french dip which was OK, but the beef was cold and dry which leads me to believe it was made first then sat and sat and sat...  the potatoes in the potato salad had good consistency, but instead of a creamy mix, it was little potatoes swimming in a cream based sauce.  Not sure if this was correct, but ...  The comment card in our bill folder was even pre-filled.  I flipped it over and wrote my thought for them there too.  I hope this place gets its act together.  Also, the staff should stop worrying about how they look and worry about the guests.

nHbXVsmaebZdxnjva950LA.text: Went here for a late breakfast on a Saturday - I'd been meaning to try BLD for a while.  Their espresso drinks are excellent.  Whoever was making them knew what they were doing.  I also had the green chile pork tostada for breakfast.  The green chile was flavorful with a little heat, and my over-easy eggs were actually over-easy!  The portion size is huge - I would have gladly split it with someone else.

UCqKNScetKu4tdrL8yjWYg.text: Always a good experience. Easy to get in and out. Steak salad is excellent. Friendly staff. Only ever been there for the L in BLD.

1rI9skcbp5DojyYJsp2LAw.text: I was really surprised when I read all the bad reviews on here! My boyfriend and I go to BLD all the time. I challenge those that had bad experiences to come back and try some more food. I have had nearly everything on the lunch/dinner menu and can say almost everything was pretty darn good.   The ribs were a bit dry, and the weird ciabatta bread they tried to put the burger on once was not tasty at all... but other than that the food is GREAT.  Good happy hour too!  Just give it a try!

--7S0hJCLespJmdd674IGg.text: I came here for lunch with a friend and really enjoyed it. She had the basic BLD eggs Benedict and I had a burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was so large I had to cut it in half and even then could hardly get my mouth around it. It was delicious though and service was pleasant. It's definitely the type of place that was much needed for this area!

PX12y4OHqaPmWbYmc7fGuw.text: The food is great, portions are huge.  Our server left much to be desired (no eye contact), but that did not take away from the quality of the food.  And the bathrooms are unique.

QNcB14tpMZNaA88wjlOSKA.text: Came here today with the dogs on the patio.  Servers were very friendly and accommodating with 2 big dogs.  Food was very good and overall a positive experience. Will come here again

udCeNJH24RjWZD6p975flA.text: I would be happy to give BLD more stars, except for the fact that it took 40 minutes (!!) to get our food.   Service: We went on a Sunday around noon, and were seated right away.  There were numerous managers lingering about and way too many waiters/staff.  It was absolute chaos.  For one, they have only one tiny entrance to the kitchen, so there was a constant traffic jam of employees standing around waiting for food to be ready.  Many employees seemed to be running around back and forth for no apparent reason. They were very disorganized...I hope they get things figured out soon.    Food: The food was actually pretty good....hence 2 stars and not 1.  The guys had burgers which they very much enjoyed.  I had the green chili pork tostada.  It needed more pork, more green chili sauce, and less beans. Definitely too much refried beans. Flavor was very good though.  Coffee was great, but with one big problem:  it would be nice to have a carafe at the table.  I was left waiting too long for a refill several times over the course of our meal.  They really don't need the full carafe of creamer at the table...a simple porcelain creamer container would have done just fine.  Perhaps they can replace the cream filled carafe with a coffee filled one!   Overall, I think BLD has a lot of potential, but they have many kinks to work out with the service before I'd be back.

xXzD86cj_x8LKv1M4n_MUQ.text: Ate the eggs bennedict which was alright. A little too salty and a little too much hollandaise sauce for my taste. The potatoes sauteed with onions on the other hand did a fine job satisfying my taste buds!  also ordered an iced americano which wasn't too bold or light.  Staff are really friendly. Always talking with the biggest smile and willing to open doors for you when you exit.   the place is neat and modernized. Sort of in between a diner and ikea  happy hour from 3-7 pm. Have to check that out some day...probably not any time soon though

JYG0dl7V34DqmFmd-odEgg.text: I was so excited to come here, and my experience today left a lot to be desired.  The service was awful.  It took me nearly 30 mins to get a water.  My husband even left his seat to remind them, and still had to remind them again 10 mins later.  The room we were in had only 1 other table of 4 occupied.  The food (which was the reason we came) was completely lacking flavor.  The chicken for my chicken and waffles looked exactly the same as my son's overcooked, rock hard chicken strip.  So $60 later, I would have been happier at Ihop.

47v5QMmgPh5DyPYeHLQ42w.text: This place has potential. I wasn't really over the moon with what I ordered, but it was ok enough to plan on giving it a second chance sometime in the future.

T08TvGEcsGm-hceb9gJOFQ.text: We have been here once before a few months back and ordered the monte cristo and biscuit and gravy, all was good. This time around ordered chicken fried steak and steak and eggs, not very good. Chicken fried steak was bland & over cooked, gravy tasted of raw flour and the "steak" claimed was shaved rib eye but I received what resembled carne asada. Requested it cooked med rare, received rubbery, gristly, well done. Coffee was good, though first cup was full of grounds. On the positive our server was very nice and the beans and potatoes were tasty. For nearly $40, breakfast for two, not worth it and won't return, Sorry.

WF_o3OI2Ul9ME-VjT7F6Yw.text: Honestly, I LOVE the food here, but the service is absolutely horrible. Everytime time I go I wish for acceptable service and it unfortunately never happens.   I decided to bring my parents here for dinner to show them exceptional food, but we were treated poorly. It took at least 15 minutes for my beer that was already poured in the glass when I received it. Not only did the beer take a while, the appetizer did as well. When we repeatedly questioned about our appetizer, our server became frustrated with us. Because of his frustration he had the manager bring the app. The manager asked how we were and with unhappy faces we did not answer, and the manager proceeded not to ask about our poor attitudes but simply walked away. Throughout the meal the server never stopped to talk to us to enlighten our moods, except asked us how we were in passing. Never stopping once, not even to drop the bill!   I myself work in the restaurant business and understand the difficulties when dealing with unhappy guests, but by no means was this correct way!!!

-mZasRQ2LnaL1LmTlsFG0A.text: Good management always recognizes their employee's strength, and Bill's strength is running an awesome bar with great and friendly service! Keep Bill behind the bar!

D3pNwou4kuTCvOU4TPGwIQ.text: My boyfriend and I just visited BLD two days in a row because of the phenomenal service! Jason is the most personable, helpful, and attentive bartender I have experience in Chandler!!! Being in the service industry ourselves it is a pleasure to relax with someone so amazing! On top of the best service ever, the food and drinks were the icing on the cake! Delicious food and Mimosa specials made our afternoon. We left extremely satisfied and cannot wait to go back!  To Jason and the rest of the BLD team, keep up the great work!!!

6_OKbMPX6bfgMduZLFfqIw.text: Solid place to eat. We always get good service and their food is unique. They have their own spin on everything which is pretty cool. It's definitely not a cookie cutter spot. Priced appropriately with a good vibe. You can come for drinks, to watch the game or for BLD. Would recommend.

arK1HKiC7m-0Dl8eLigeyA.text: Upgrading to a four.  The waitstaff has really improved and have had several very good experiences (Sarah, Jason and many others).  The food is also better than on my first visits.  The smoked turkey croissant is delicious.

TuSazXIxZD8uq5Q9Ws1mEQ.text: Great service and food! We have twin babies and a toddler so we are not the easiest to accommodate and they always go above and beyond for us.

lhoXDoQCTmF0YHhHsfa3Kw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Wait was expected since it's labor day but 2 hours to get our food? Spoke to a wannabe manager that said the kitchen was backed up, no resolution, time frame, nothing. Waited another 20 minutes, also server was terrible, never got creamer, coffe refills, only showed up to give us our check

vmRogCJRtZ_v6Xu2DMBGQw.text: Excellent place! Came here for breakfast as a first timer and got "The Wise Man Omelet", which I  recommend if your looking for a tasty filling breakfast. Also their coffee is great perfect drinking temperature and great taste. Also out waitress took $10.00 off the total of our bill because our service took a little longer than expected, which was very kind of her! This place is great and I would come back again!

Nlk1dv5Zf8ElZ_wAMRD2Ug.text: This place has a great decor, pretty decent prices, OK food and it's pretty convenient. If you don't set your expectations too high, this is a great place to grab a quick bite or meet with friends, family or for business.   If you're in a rush or just need to kill some time, their bar is pretty good and they have a drive through for take out, which is pretty convenient.  I was craving fried eggs with bacon, and I got just what I was craving. A good portion of crisp bacon, 2 fried eggs and sour dough bread. I had to order extra bread, though because it came with just 2 half slices.   The grapefruit juice was pretty good (if you like grapefruit, of course) and the latte was good as well. The potatoes on the side could improve a little bit.  All in all, don't expect a lot and you won't be disappointed.    I go to this place plenty of times so instead of writing and up-date i decided to edit this one. They DON'T have ice cream or any desert :(   BTW, their patio is dog friendly :) I don't have a dog, but I thought that was cool

pgsL98wvtZwxBPu2aXVAdA.text: I have to say, I've been here about 4-5 times and I honestly haven't been to impressed with the service... I felt like I had to keep tracking down the servers and also I felt like we where always putting them out....???  The food was pretty good... Kinda pricey but not to bad.. I was very disappointed about the orange juice. I was charged $4 for a "fresh squeezed" orange juice and when I got it, it tasted just like from a carton. I asked the waitress, when she finally came around and she said, it is fresh squeezed, we just order it in and it comes in a jug...??? SO that too me is not fresh squeezed and not worth $4 a glass. The french toast isn't bad. They have pretty good happy hour pricing! I just felt like it was nothing special compared to anyone else. Kinda disappointing  cause I was really excited when they went in...

fYlhJ7uFyMBVaMMeb3yFdg.text: We love BLD for the people that build the business

ep1R7yJGej35cDQZEEcAIw.text: This is my go-to place on Sunday morning after service. I enjoy the food, the friendly service and the atmosphere. There is a wait time on the weekends but that's the norm everywhere on Saturday and Sunday. I also like the fact that they are pet friendly.  I have met a friend here with her dog for breakfast and we had a great time on their patio.  I normally order one of their benedict's but on my recent visit I tried the "hash the dog" minus the PBR tall boy (they took a couple of dollars off for me declining the beer). It was meaty and delicious. I will definitely order this again. What more can I say? I am a fan of BLD.

rcX-tYs7Y9XTUPf6ovH9TQ.text: I cannot believe I have forgotten to review BLD! I am definitely a regular here. I'll start with Breakfast... My boyfriend and I eat here at least once a week for breakfast. He always orders the Green Chili Tostada and the few bites I've had were delicious!! I have ordered many things...the open faced sandwich is delightful, the waffle has bacon in the middle, the short rib eggs bene and the breakfast burrito. I normally go back to the waffle because it is so good! I don't normally eats sweets but the bacon with syrup is prefect and for $5 (if you order the waffle as a side) is a great deal! Lunch is another time of day you can find me at BLD. I love taking clients there and the food is always spot on. You must get the Prosciutto & Fried Goat Cheese salad. SOOOO GOOD! I can't really order anything else... Happy Hour is one of the best around. Great prices with unique food options (no chicken wings and potato skins here). Get the Ahi (See pic). Trust me! Had dinner here the other night and our server suggested the Braised Short Rib Pasta. It was unbelievable in a prefect Pesto sauce (see pic). The patio is beautiful and allows dogs. They actually have a dog dinner availble for your pooch.  GO HERE ANYTIME. You won't regret it and say "hi", I'll probably be there.
