T2B8Vqh-IY8VBLs3muNOCA.text: Well we returned again today only to experience the exact same thing. We sat outside at the bar during breakfast as the wait was 20 mins, the hostesses suggested the outside bar area. It took approx 20 mins to get iced coffee. The people across from us sat down after us and was enjoying their blood marys long before our coffee arrived. My husbands order was incorrect. The girl next to us also received the incorrect order. My scrambles eggs were not very good. My breakfast potatoes were undercooked. Also, i asked for strawberry jam and didnt realize until i put it on my biscuit that they have me raspberry. $30 later, I'm still hungry and headed home. I really wanted to like this place bc it's within walking distance and has a nice atmosphere but I have to keep it at 2 stars.

fB0slBa5VCM5AoSFKbGGoQ.text: Met a friend for breakfast, neither of us had been here before but had heard about it so thought we'd give it a try.  Food - so, so,  Pricy for breakfast  Staff - friendly but unattentive  Not sure if I'll return, maybe for lunch but not breakfast.

tLxHlfSt2YmdG76oRQuFZQ.text: Came for dinner. Waited 45 mins for the waitress (Tessa) to take our order while she was chatting with 2 bar customers.  Bad management decision to have a waitress run between the bar and tables so not totally her fault but bad for a customer experience regardless. We decided to leave instead of ordering.  Place was mostly empty on a Saturday night so that should have been a clue.

96y6PpzoB-VQ4zet9ZtH5g.text: This place is awesome! We used to go to the Good Egg for bkfast but that place went downhill. This is our new bkfast place. Food is always excellent & service is very good. We've been there w/ a toddler & infant & they get us our food very quickly! Highly recommend the pancakes (they're huge!) & the biscuits & gravy. My hubby likes the bkfast burrito.

U8kRtmy3kjBJw2YQpwBxOg.text: We were a party of five looking for a light meal.  Several of us initially selected the happy hour special of soup and grilled cheese, but the tomato bacon soup apparently is very spicy, which didn't appeal to members of my party. When we looked closer at the menu, it appeared that a lot of the dishes involved a lot of peppers...and a lot of goat cheese.   Anyway, I took advantage of the happy hour beer specials, but unfortunately I really hated the second beer (something by Deschutes that I think might have been skunked). Our server disappeared for the first of several times; another server ended up getting me a different drink.  Two members of my group ordered quesadillas, one chicken and one steak; when the runners brought one to the table, they said, "here's a chicken quesadilla...or steak, I don't really know," and plopped it down. My squash spaghetti arrived several minutes after everyone else's dishes. My dish was underwhelming: the goat cheese (of course!) was congealed in clumps (as one might have expected), the sauce was very oily, and the dish had no discernible seasoning.   After we had finished, our plates lingered for far too long. Once we received the check, we actually never saw our initial server again, having to flag down another server to get our credit card processed.  I'm not really sure what this place is going for. At the price point for dinner, the food and service need to be much better than it is.

nhf_T59a1BqedLLKMkHv6g.text: First let me clarify that the food/menu is great and I looked forward to lunch there today, however we walked out before ordering after our waitress brought our waters then disappeared and it being a work day lunch hr we needed to get going. My wife reminded me before going that they have slow service. It's apparent that management and owners are inept at developing or implementing a training program for their staff. While waiting for our waitress to reappear, the older female manager walked by with a dark piece of toast on a plate, and another waitress commented saying "that's pretty dark" referring to the toast, and the mgr still walked it out to a table.   A waiter who must have had the assigned area where our new table (we came inside due to weather) walked by, was told by another waitress that we moved inside and shrugged. He never came back or our original waitress. After 15 mins of not bring acknowledged or our order taken we walked out.  I thought mgmt was the quality control at most successful restaurants. This place could be much more successful if they paid closer attention to the little things.    We walked across the parking lot to the new Cold Beers and Burger joint, to try them out for the first time. Great food and service. Try that place.

Qjj7g2pFEMVecpYeEmNlNg.text: Five Stars to No Stars in My Opinion..... BLD recently celebrated their 4th anniversary, and I have been one of the many regulars who have supported this business from the very beginning..It is with heavy heart that I learn so many radical changes are underway here..In my business experience, management/ownership in their infinite wisdom oftentimes feel the need to #&*# up a good thing..Although the quality of their food has noticeably diminished in the last several months (ie, replacing margarine for butter, Smuckers for homemade jams, canned biscuits for scratch), the service provded has been stellar and above par..No doubt I speak for several in that BLD has provided a great venue to socialize with old & new friends alike, and sadly enough, this camaradarie is about to end at BLD for us regular patrons..Perhaps those of you not familiar with this establishment may find my words to be sour grapes..Perhaps the owner Jack & his new manager will view my diatribe as rant..In response, the significant dollars I've spent dining & drinking at BLD over these four years has officially ended..On a positive note, I wish to express my appreciation & love to those barkeeps, wait staff & soon-to-be former GM for your commitment to excellence..Your passion to serve quality food & drink with great humor & fun has contributed significantly to the success of this business!!!! How unfortunate that current management/ownership does not recognize nor applaud your commendable efforts..Demotion appears to be the method of ousting those who "bring in the buck"..To that end and on a positive note, friendships that have been made here at BLD over these years are near & dear and will contine on..Peace out..

0sHeM4-pU3MU4sd5xSn6DQ.text: We have been to BLD several times since our first experience, which was pleasurable.  Each one has gotten just slightly less enjoyable, and yesterday was probably the last hurrah.  My wife and I decided to have a late lunch, around 1:30 and found the restaurant almost empty.  We ordered water and Arnold Palmer, first AP was ok, refill was just tea.  Wife ordered the Roasted Chicken & Brie - On Sourdough, w/ Melted Brie, Crisp Apples, Spinach & Strawberry Dijon Mustard 11.95 and I got the "Goat" Burger - 1/2 lb. All-Natural Beef Patty, Fried Goat Cheese, Roasted Tomatoes, Greens & Bacon Jam 12.95, the Roasted Chicken was ok, nothing to write home about.  the "Goat" Burger was an absolute mess.  It was supposed to be medium, it had a crust like a burnt rock, it was covered with cold bacon jam, stacked with the roasted tomato's that were soggy and then topped with a ball of the fried goat cheese.  This was all encased in a dry pretzel burger roll.  I ate the tomato's, and hacked my way thru the burger patty, my side was a salad, 3 tablespoons of greens, a 3 croutons.  I should have taken a picture but by the time i found the patty it was too late.  My recent previous time there was with my Son during the holidays, and our experience was somewhat the same, this time the Tuna was well done and i hail from Hawaii and know of my "Seared Tuna", my Son had the fish tacos and they were a little greasy.  He commented that with all the other restaurants around there that had waiting times it was a little strange that we got seated immediately.

paoKMbCd5CnK0N5vojJY_g.text: Had the chicken biscuit sandwich, the chicken was fried nicely but there was a lack of gravy and overall the sandwich was very dry. My mom had the benedict, pretty average and the fruit she asked for on the side was old. The banana was super overripe. Also ordered a side of potatoes and they were rubbery. I heard this place used to be good, guess I came a little too late. Super dissapointing experience.

k53WGtEtFOkFF4tugut6Cw.text: One of the best BLT sandwiches I have ever had! The prices are reasonable and the service great.

x6Pdkwp3tQ8mdfMioh8DXA.text: I went into BLD with my friend, who is also a chef, yesterday. We both ordered off the happy hour menu - he had the Chirizo Nachos and  I had the Pork Queso.  Now, my friend is a tough food critic. In all honesty he is way more picky than me - after all I grew up with siblings who would lick or spit on your food to try to claim it and you would either have to tough it out and eat it or starve. In short, my palette is much less sensitive than his and his cooking experience has him even higher standard than myself.  With that said, even upon my first bite I noticed that my chips were stale (or under-cooked or overcooked, not sure if there is a taste difference). Being the lenient one, I charged through the pile of chips for the Queso. Some of the chips were not bad. Aside from that, I thought the Pork Queso dip was pretty tasty. I am normally not one to enjoy tomatoes but I really enjoyed them in this dip. I really wish the "simple" part of my meal - the chips - would have been better. I think for the price I would have been better off driving downtown and checking out NachoBot, which is a bare-bone nacho shop... but hardcore delicious and I'm stuffed.  My friend had the Chorizo Nachos and really had to bear down to eat them. Not that he was gagging on it, but he wasn't super thrilled by it either. He didn't address it there (see comment below about asking for food) but did address them later in an email. On one hand, I wish my friend addressed it there so that I could have reviewed their response. On the other hand, sometimes it is better to not file a complaint in person - I hate having the management come over and give you free stuff - and maybe my friend didn't want free stuff either.  I cannot comment directly for him - all I can say is that he has told the restaurant before of issues with his food (again, see comment below about the server asking about food).  Our service was OK but my friend was really bothered by the employees during their idle time. I had my back to the employees but he said that they were all sitting/standing by the kitchen and essentially messing around. Now, I'm not one to be all hardcore about what people do at work when they have idle time, but they could at least do it out of sight of customers. My friend said that they kept looking over and laughing in our direction - coincidence or were they laughing at us, I cannot comment. All I can comment on is that it could have been more professional.  The restaurant itself was pretty cool looking - almost a little too upscale for Chandler, LOL.  With all of this said, this is the general basis for my review. My friend wrote an email to BLD to tell them that he did not enjoy his meal. BLD responded, in a way, unprofessionally. They seemed kind of personally offended. With that said, I do agree with them in part that the issue should have been addressed there instead of post in an email. However, call me shy or maybe just preoccupied but I don't ever remember the server asking "how is your food?" either. While this is nit-picky, most restaurants today ask this which I believe prompts you to comment directly on the food instead of just the service (i.e. "how are you doing."). I think if they had asked that then my friend, who was much more dissatisfied with his meal, then he would have addressed this there in-restaurant. Who knows, and maybe this is splitting hairs here. The personal service was pretty decent aside from this even though the "idle-service" being kind of weird with the employees sitting around texting and possibly laughing at you. Decor was awesome. Food was half-good (my pork dip, not the chips), but the prices outside of happy-hour seemed a little high to me. Last but not least while my friends email could have been addressed differently by him (in person, not email) they could have seemed a little less personally offended.  Bottom line is this - I doubt that I will visit again and it is not necessarily a place I'd recommend to others. The main reason that I would not suggest BLD is mainly due to the price - my food wasn't too bad aside from half the chips tasting stale. I can get far more food at other places for less money and I don't have to buy on the HH menu to keep costs down. Looking at other reviews on here it seems that other reviewers also felt the prices were high as well.

mQix5eWzWdwSwAW248Ly_g.text: What happened?   My wife have been frequent breakfast and dinner patrons of BLD - and always loved it - but something has changed. Took a client there for a casual dinner this evening - and was pretty disappointed.   I haven't been in for a couple months because of travel schedule - and in the meantime the menu apparently changed. I love a place that experiments and changes up the menu. However, BLD seems to have removed 4-5 favorites - and when I asked the waiter if it was possible to be flexible enough to whip up one of the "previous favorites" - the response was more less a shoulder shrug.   Again, love the attempted creativity - but the waiter admitted that many people have asked for the same discontinued dishes...might be worth rethinking the menu. Let's not forget - we're in Chandler - not San Francisco or New York.   Likely out of the rotation for us. Disappointing.

ETGXtF6pQggqLJo2kzw-qA.text: Gave this place one more try because I really want to like it but all 3 times we have been unimpressed with the food.  Here we sit on a Friday night and the place is empty while all the other restaurants are packed. Overcooked burgers, floppy fatty bacon on the blt, so so food choices... sadly we will not be back.  3 strikes and you're out.

X6tL4rvR1x2-dLpm2b_6MA.text: Awesome breakfast!  The Green chilli pork tostatad was excellent!  Service was great - very attentive.

qDFQKsKG4Kot-uLuuGfDBA.text: We have been going to BLD for years and  absolutely love the entire staff. Almost 95% of the time the food is outstanding but there are few times, like every restaurant, that you have an issue with the food not being prepared the way you like. It's not fair of this Liz person to overhear a private conversation about food not being prepared correctly one time, and then badmouth the poor bartender for having to deal with it. BLD is a great place to hangout and get to know the team, who always make you feel welcomed.

j2eiPxvqL_fcgprPWGDCcQ.text: We're at bld at least 3 times a week. It's our regular spot for a good meal and atmosphere. We were discussing an issue with an order with the bartender which happens on a busy holiday weekend when apparently Liz G felt the need to eaves drop and comment. We are regulars here and probably had 1000 meals over the past 7 years. They're not all going to be perfect but to feel the need to write a negative review about a conversation you weren't even involved in is just ridiculous. She said she wasn't coming back which is probably a good thing. We have so much fun at this place that we don't need people like that ruining a good time.

QSlUhrEzkZtXcAD1gTEgaw.text: We went in for breakfast a couple weeks ago and at first glance the menu was a few dollars more expensive per item than other places offering the same items--but I'll say now that the food was worth the extra dough.  We had the chicken and waffles and breakfast sandwich, both were delicious, better than expected.  I can't call either of these dishes particularly healthy but they were definitely tasty.  Staff and service were friendly and attentive.  We'll be back.

c4O2AqhvzzBOjrsqLOzGpA.text: Updating not because of the food, which is awesome as ever, but because of the parking situation, which is waaaaay out of hand.  Not BLD's fault, but, fellow diners beware!  Don't even think about it on a weekend evening.  :(

25GxnBSNf7x3Luq3nLLSpA.text: I really wanted to like this place but nothing really grabbed me.  The beer selection was pretty good and I like that they support local brewers.  We only sampled the App food like the nachos which were average, the queso dip which did not have enough cheese, and the quesadilla which was good but not great.  The biggest jam was the service.  The bartender did not have many guests and our table of four were drinking at a pretty good clip.  Somehow we always found ourselves hunting him down for another beer.  He was nearby but always seemed like he has never worked a service job in his life.  Not good!  The decor is a strange mix of contemporary industrial with clean lines and almost IKEA like furniture.   Large stained concrete slabs were the bartop in our area.  The bathrooms are just toilets and you share a wash area with men and women which is different but not really that cool.    Again this place is so close but I think they need a few more elements to click before I would return.

8xWoBg17rfpqzkmrz1SdyQ.text: I visited for the first time today and I will definitely be returning. I had the BLT on the focaccia bread and it was the best thing I've ever eaten, seriously it was amazing. We also had the chorizo fries as an appetizer and the waffle/ice cream desert which was also very good. I would definitely recommend.

c-gUGVnohQSh8MDqldAA_g.text: If you fear flavor...this is the fare for you! The nice thing is you don't even have to request no flavor....they omit it automatically.   I had some high hopes reading the menu as there are were some very creative and outlandish combinations of ingredients in their entrees.   Even the ranch dressing was flavorless and had I had some hidden valley nearby, I would have substituted it out.

Y3IpgfNeTmISNQr1mMZ78Q.text: Enjoyed a quiet evening here with a close friend. Food was fresh and a cold tasty beverage was great!  Staff was great as well!

KnNBrp2dlE3nQF6SRBJecw.text: This was my second time dining at BLD and I will not be back. Our food arrived before our drinks and the server was completely unapologetic. Hostess was texting on her phone the entire time and did not acknowledge me when I went up to ask for silverware (after our food had been delivered). I finally found someone who could give me a napkin and fork, by which time my food was nearly cold. Our water glasses were also empty the entire time. The checks were dropped before I was even done chewing my food. I felt rushed and annoyed. My friends and I are all full time servers, so we "get it". But this experience was unacceptable. Disappointed, to say the least.

4KOmBuU6L1LnRrdXj-kWng.text: Great drinks, great food, great ppl!!! One employee had ripped jeans so that didn't look professional but other than that, they r efficient and very helpful and. I've! Love this place!!

7mhREVwydFu-esLO5yHy3A.text: We went there a few weeks ago for lunch and I felt the food was fantastic and the portions are generous for the price! Great friendly service! Loved the Dirty Chai Latte... yummy! And their onion rings were perfectly prepared!

ioR7Bn9aW5Fsv17rW6c68Q.text: LOVE BLD's!! My family and I come here every Sunday and have yet to have a bad experience. Service is great, food is amazing & the atmosphere is perfect. Only wish they would open more around the valley :) Highly recommend.

glMvQijvSFRw42fOkLd6kg.text: We went for breakfast and had been wanting to try it out. We ordered mimosas and breakfast the food was ok the eggs were over done the chicken fried steak was a little soggy. The best part was the waitress who was a little "off" after she spilled half the champagne and water she informed us she was drunk. We talked to the manager who informed us she was "hungover" he removed the alcohol and the eggs Benedict from our bill. We are planning on trying it again with the hopes that we get "sober" service next time!

ii-9luQUnZeoJb7W-hOPQg.text: I've been here a few more times and I always love the food.  Everything I've had from the breakfast menu has been fantastic!  Drinks are good, too, and its a great place for happy hour.  The deal on wine on Sundays is still my favorite thing about this place.  They have Sunday ticket so they always have two games on but they keep the sound off (closed caption) so it doesn't get too sports bar-y.

wtczWmX6vCSc9svru2k-9g.text: This is my favorite brunch spot! Sit at the bar and ask for bill! He will make you the best Bloody Mary in town and is extremely knowledgable about the menu! Everything on the menu is amazing! Especially the Benedicts! This is my weekend happy place!

1DkrJUgEcTUk_FIC-OW41Q.text: Yelp Eats 2011  We took advantage of the Yelp Eats 2011 50% off prefixe menu  Bruchetta with apples and brie $3 Scallops with cheddar polenta and asparagus $10 Cheeseburger $13 (full price and not part of the special) Crab cake $5 A couple of glasses of wine and lemonade for the little one.  I give the food two stars and extra one for the trendy decor.  Would we go back?  Not for so-so food and service.

UXpllndCf3eePQn9vSJjWA.text: Great food but the service is horrible. First time- we had brunch and service was great. But the second and third (both dinner) horrible service. Had to ask multiple times for items. Husband refuses to go again.

LmMPesqOaFaRsFby7XzPiQ.text: Waffles infused with bacon bits!!! OMG! They are the best, I will say they are a bit pricey at 8.00 for 1 waffle, but a girls got to have her bacon! They also make their own Margaritas and they are on tap! Whoaaa, they are fantastic!!!  Heading this week for Yelp eats! New update then!

SJDf-_dCaxW7vVWBQg1VDA.text: Atmosphere is nice.  Prices are a little high for lunch.  The food is tasty though.  It's nice to have things on the menu that are different.  Dog friendly patio.

MhjUp9ZoXAPEPa2fgILjag.text: This is my second visit and it pretty much put a nail in the coffin. The first time we came in for a late breakfast and the food was mediocre but we chalked it up to being on the tail end of breakfast service. However, the second chance did not prove redeeming. I ordered the Cali benedict and the poached eggs were beyond runny and the dish was bland. The potatoes are greasy and hard. Hubby's omelet was greasy and runny, as well. Have not had lunch or dinner but would be reluctant to come back based on both poor breakfasts. There's other amazing places for breakfast in the area.

GPm9bDSKLsVsM3FIDqOX3Q.text: I was told to message the business as they wanted to give me a gift certificate to make up for the bad experience I had when I went for the first time.  I did...twice.  Nothing.  I would have liked to go back to give them a second chance, but no response is not giving me a warm and fuzzy feeling.

GS_3K5T6NByrouacaCjTpw.text: If you are looking for a fresh and slightly different lunch spot this is the one. I've only been there once, but I was happily surprised at how delicious my food was.  I had the powerhouse salad (or something like that). It was very fresh. The portions are generous.

uVsbeP6Npw_1q4UyuDiNvA.text: Not too impressed with the green chile tostado that I got ... it was kind of a tart, weird taste (not traditional green chile like you would expect).  The one good thing about it was a ton of pork shoulder that was really good.  The combination of the green chile "tartness" and the egg and pork was just off a little .. hard to describe.  I won't be getting that again.  I wish I would have just gone with a traditional breakfast or lunch sandwich .. they looked great (other members in our group got them) Who knows, next time I will give them a try and maybe change my rating, but what I got was kind of icky .... so stay away from it.    Awesome service though, very attentive and reasonable prices.  It is a "trendy" place, but still seems grounded if that makes sense.  I will go back, but will stick with traditional breakfast.

Z2hjbUbAjo046Z_WJeKpJw.text: Short Rib Breakfast Burrito....need i say more?  Go there.  Order it.  Eat it.  Great interior, nice servers and excellent food.

gtJdkisKljLPWsmDvrghbw.text: Nice place. Average food. Slightly expensive for what you get but clean and modern with dog friendly patio. Go for the mimosas! Fun bar tenders.

SFhPALIthpw8K0GGKzdSEQ.text: The food here was awesome!! I just went for the second time and was not disappointed to have gone back. I had the breakfast burrito with the short ribs inside. I swap the regular eggs for egg whites and also add a mimosa :-).

w21y9I1JNl0nYVTbHw2a2g.text: Pretty good food but the service was slow. It was easy  to make meals gluten free. I would go back again and cross my fingers the service is faster.

hwpm0wOgCp0Q75A3vUs0WA.text: Today I'm totally impressed with BLD. We went to lunch as a team, as a celebratory event for one on our team who's been with us for a year. Five of us ordered, and two of us had the server come out to ask us to pick different entrees, because they had run out of both of the items that we had ordered. They genuinely felt bad that we had to order some different things, so they gave us TWO complimentary desserts, which were phenomenal!  They tried to up their service, because of the inconvenience. I was impressed at how much they worked to be attentive and orderly. Wow!  For my entree, I wanted to try the Mediterranean Tuna salad, but I was one of those that had to order something else, so I chose the Grilled Portabello Salad, and it was very tasty.   Try the Dirty Chai, one on our team ordered this and raved about how delicious it was.

ntIhICChZ4yyKCCXTOlpug.text: Food was good, beer selection was below average. But the reason I give it four stars is because they have a dog friendly patio and the service was good as well. I will definitely come back.

7XLcLIv3UJwLoFe1iscdnQ.text: Great food and very attentive service.  The mushroom ravioli was to die for and the Talapia was very tasty.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

ADxNtfHHMVcu7FERZ5f5wQ.text: We tried this place because of the Yelp reviews. We went in at 1130, so a early lunch.we were seated right away and the servers were friendly. I ordered the chicken and waffles and my husband ordered the chicken fried steak. My husband got his and I got a waffle. When I asked where the chicken was the server said she thought I only ordered a waffle then I had to wait for the rest of my lunch. My husband didn't like the chicken fried steak because the gravy had too much of a flour taste. He also ordered a peach/mango smoothie which tasted like pineapple. We asked the server if he got the wrong drink and she told us that all the smoothies are made with pineapple juice. So if you love pineapple I recommend the smoothies. The atmosphere was nice, but probably won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Rest of chicken and waffle order
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Waffle
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

ut0M-h3hLCKPtli1G9vymQ.text: Went there, a/c was broke, wait staff was absent,  at best. Waiter's recommendations were far from what they promised. I hope they were just having a bad day.

SJbl03tTtU5sN-J3F-NQmg.text: Went back for breakfast and it was a hit. Very delicious! We had the chicken and waffles and egg white omelet. The Bloody Mary was a hit as well and overall a great place for brunch. Return factor is high.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. BLD

vfC6VeF1nxSgso4AeDZvqQ.text: We absolutely love BLD. The food is great and Stephanie is excellent! She is always very friendly and efficient and always makes our experience pleasant. It's the people that work at the restaurant that make it. She is the BEST!

IPx815E7HW6XP_7xAfVo3w.text: Always like this place.  Always something different, they had candied bacon that was perfection before anyone ever knew what it was... except those who had to make themselves.   Can be a bit pricey and service not always great but always good. Menu is huge and a dog friendly patio with happy dogs on the weekends!  Fun bar area and setup.

Sor86eFk18dQT0CZ3VMbsg.text: Penny was a fantastic bartender/server. The food was on point and the bloody Mary's strong. Great brunch!

YUHzQQb_JUYbG2dmRhrMhQ.text: I love this place!! Delicious food and GREAT service! When you go try this place ask to sit in Shasta's section. She is AMAZING and will take great care of you!!

tkSbqADLQsHsilqfxjDPvg.text: Great breakfast spot! Awesome location, low wait. Had good customer service, food was fresh & hot. Good vibe! Eggs were cooked very well! Awesome coffee & potatoes!

JTmsRBfno6uXjZ6Yt9Uz5w.text: BLD is one of my favorite places! everyone is super friendly and the food is amazing. When you go ask for Micah! You will get the best service :)

K0Oz_2Qg2zqYq8MrIiW67Q.text: Most of my superhero powers are generated through the consumption of eggs benedict. I had heard that BLD may have a stash of this precious lifesource so I had my assistant Igor drive my hungover ass to BLD to investigate. The rumors turned out to be True. I ordered the the short rib egged benedict and it did not disappoint. Now my x-ray vision is stronger than ever.

55J1BWzwiw6TsbD4kbfBPQ.text: Great service by Diane. Breakfast was wonderful. We go there for breakfast most days. Waffles great

2EsHXVVibY1HyOoHIJp2SA.text: A cute little restaurant with a great selection of interesting beverages!! Fast service and the food tastes amazing every time. The coffee is amazing as well!

riXu3_H64vPxRqobH4RqBg.text: I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken and waffles, would recommend! I came here searching for a cheap place to eat and I totally would come back again for more.

j8dpPzbK6r2DbJHFT6yVzw.text: Great Spicy Bloody Mary! I added bacon to it for a reasonable charge. The Cali Benedict was good, though the poached eggs were overcooked. My spouse ordered poached eggs medium and they came out well done. The avocado with my Cali Benedict was about 1/4 of an avocado. They don't have GF toast/bread and it's extra to substitute hash browns or potatoes. It's good food and our server was friendly.

4cWFfg5WwH21wKZ1x7hppg.text: I have had breakfast at this location several times. I feel it's better to go. I order the BYO With ham and pepper jack cheese with potatoes. Very tasty. Not crazy about the eat in service and setting. But good breakfast.

WbO_jzJN8wBVBefkAIERXQ.text: Worst service I have received at a restaurant in a long time.  Server never refilled our drinks. We had to ask the hostess to find her come to our table just  to get a check.  She never checked on us to see if we needed anything.  Very disappointed.   Food was not very good.  I had the Eggs Benedict.   This looks like a nice place when you walk in.  Cool decor, but that won't get me to ever come back.  Overall terrible service and mediocre food.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

sEgNF6UYyW0GHlff2odTcg.text: Came here today with the gf for date night for the first time and it wasn't particularly busy other than a corporate party next to us at the high chairs. Our server was Lexi, it wasn't particularly busy so it really should not have been that much of a wait time to getting someone to pick our order but the it wasn't that big of a deal. I will say that the reason that we are marking three stars is the drinks were awesome with the Chandler Mimosa and the signature burger was actually really nicely put together. But the jalapeno burger was definitely something that you should stay far away from. There was nothing jalapeno about it. When you put it next to the BLT Burger it looks like a Jack-in-the-Box dollar menu burger with a little bit of cream sauce on it. It was a little depressing and we end up sending it back and I split my burger with her. In other news I think that the drinks could do with a little bit more presentation to really amplify and showcase how great they are because that's a huge missed selling point. As a marketing and brand development expert I think that's something they should focus on.  Build up your highlights and completely toss off of the menu things like the jalapeno burger. The wings were really good but a little overpriced. Overall this place has a lot of good potential if it changes a few things they can definitely push out the competition. And thank you again Lexi for your kind words!

9pwI8Ve5yYltkGO5HLNSSQ.text: Here they have a full bar and we all got a Bloody Mary. Service was good, although it was busy this he did our party of six within 10 minutes and every time I've been there I've never had to wait very long to sit. My husband got a fried chicken on a waffle and I just got a waffle with some walnuts and bananas which was delicious, everything came out hot and fresh and we didn't have to wait for very long for anything. We will definitely be back

NukoFcIbKa0PT_CmjtZN2w.text: While there's a bunch of awesome spots for breakfast and lunch around now, this keeps popping into my head as the cool delicious Choice pretty often! Mmmm!!

tnW_YI7Rnw8li1CrROnGLg.text: Service was great.  Nice and friendly servers but food came out slow and over cooked. Only received 3 Stars because of there happly hour menu for drinks.   Short rib Benedict:  short rib was dry, hollandaise was basic   Biscuit & Gravy: best dish of the 3 we had but that's not saying much. Since it's hard to mess up.  Chicken fried steak: over cooked and chewy, over easy egg was more over hard and one of the yolks were broken and cooked through.  They did have a bit of a selection for craft beers and I did like that and the full bar they carried.

NiGdaWXLhyF_9pl0AA9R_w.text: JULYs are HOT HOT HOT.  just like the people here lol.  Interesting hip mod ambience.  easy to relax and unwind for a drink.  their burgers are super delicious!

v8_c-N_EeFMOCOGKr_jekQ.text: We ate here with friends and everyone enjoyed their food. I especially enjoyed the braised short ribs over cheesy polenta. I still dream about that dish and hope to return soon to enjoy it again!

qDG4eIR35bkqFwZ709T2qQ.text: Stopped in for dinner one night and didn't like the atmosphere but came back for a breakfast and was happily surprised.  Food tasted great and liked the TV on the wall.

nM-n2LFuJY_MNcwkEES1ZQ.text: I have been here 6 times now for breakfast and lunch with both my family and girlfriends. I want to love this place.    It's just off.    Sometimes the food was bad...cold green chile pork in a breakfast dish, another time the same pork was in an appetizer that was luke warm.  The flavor was excellent, but clearly BLD is not holding the food at proper temps which is concerning, especially with pork.  I also had an over medium eggs served that had the whites still running clear.  So undercooked and unsafe, I couldn't believe the the kitchen and the server sent it out!  Other times, the service was just OK.  Managers were around, but never stopped by when there was a problem with undercooked or cold food.  Cook times are long. And, I do NOT like the community washroom.  I really don't want to be washing my hands while being stared at by the guy walking out of his room still zipping and adjusting his pants...   If my girlfriends want to meet there for lunch, I'd reluctantly go again.  Would it be one of my top choices for breakfast with family?  No.

DrALbcGex4ZvSjmpjnOH9w.text: How have I not yelped about BLD. Huge fan!!! Tonight I had the BLD meatloaf. Truly amazing. Came with green beans, cheddar mashed potatoes. Delish!!! Ps if you are a caffeine junky like me must try Pumpkin Spice Chai Latte! Service was great food was great. Love it here

ojzOshJKJLVLR4RqmisjFw.text: We took our second trip to this establishment today and it was just as good as our first experience if not better.  Our first time at BLD we endulged in Monte Cristo's. Oh my goodness...so big and so, so tasty.  On our tip today I had planned to have the same thing but changed my mind at the last minute and ordered the Open faced meatloaf sandwich.  Thought I had died and gone to heaven.  This place is now on our 'MUST RETURN' (again & again) list.  Nice atmosphere and great wait staff.

4Gy1ndZBArqWBLCGR0ivgQ.text: I'd like to report that we came back to try BLD again the other day and the service was MUCH better! The food was really great too. I also had a wild berry smoothie, which might be the best smoothie I've ever had.

1GJCSKYVUduDPab_GU6G9g.text: i have been here for, well, B, L & D.   i like this place. their menu is rather diverse with a bunch of things that look really good. sometimes you go these newer restaurants and they have a very limited menu, or the selection on the menu is just to weird.   the breakfast was good and i am def open to trying more items. had the pork tostada, which was a bit overwhelming but really good if you are into a more "mexican-y bfast."  for lunch, i had a sammich. good amount of meat. nothing totally outstanding but still a solid offering.  for my dinner trip, i went during happy hour and had a burger with sweet potato fries. both were awesome. the med-rare burger could have used another 45 seconds on the grill; it was still a bit too red inside. the sweet pot fries were excellent, some of the best of this "new" trend.   their happy hour is really good, too. $3 beers and a good selection of cheap apps.  i think they may have gotten a new chef somewhat recently so i hear the food has been on the upswing.

0mZYm8r-uHc0lQW6Up5PfQ.text: Breakfast was excellent. Had the carne asada, tortillas, with eggs, potatoes and roasted salsa. Also recommend the sour dough toast as a side pared with the fresh raspberry jam. Portions were generous, and it was obvious only fresh ingredients were used. It's clear the chef here knows what he's doing.

xPcyW9lzDZA2ieW4o5culg.text: Yum! Checked this place out after reading the reviews. Had hummus and chz balls for apps, both were great. Enjoy the hummus with pita bread and not chips like in most other places. They have lots of side choices, including several different types of fries. We all had burgers, I love goat chz so really likes the burger. Cooked to perfection at med rare. Took the daily special dessert, rocky road bread pudding to-go and can't wait to try it out. The service was great, always refilling drinks and making great suggestions foods. She had good knowledge of the menu and items served.

DVfimANE97GtcoV9CTG5Sw.text: Food was incredible, had the eggs benny with chorizo potatoes. Only gave them 4 stars because the food took a while to come out. But it was well worth the wait!

TERwF3PwjnN9Jyh2z9J9mw.text: Lunch was great and the place is super comfortable and has a great vibe. The ownership and management team are real pro's. We had a tasty turkey and Brie sandwich and an entre salad. The desserts are amazing, especially the bread pudding and the cheesecake that was smartly presented. Took a peek at the wine list and found nice glass and bottle selections. Can't wait to return for lunch.

aWbEkNXV85DdVhMhYdXjug.text: Service and food were good.  Nothing to drive out of your way for though.  I will say that after reading the reviews and service issues we were skeptical.  Our service was good, didn't wait long to be greeted, drinks and food all came quickly.  Not sure if we would  cone back there isn't anything unique.....

eb7bASv30KNI3pvMGUNWkQ.text: I would really like to give this place a higher rating but I really struggle to do so. I have yet to experience dinner but I have had breakfast, lunch, and happy hour. The food sounds super exciting on paper, but can't say it matches it's exciting descriptions when it's actually in front of you. I think overall the service here really lacks! I will not give up here, but I think my rating would jump really high with an improvement in service.

W6o8BBfQDV8YzaEvo0lkOQ.text: Tried out the "D" [dinner] recently for the first time here. Well when you first walk in, it has a trendy but very casual atmosphere. We went here for dinner around 8pm and it was pretty empty. We sat at the bar, which was also pretty empty, and waited a lot time to get menus or even acknowledged for drinks. The bartender was not very conversational and pretty much gave the minimum amount of attention she needed to get her job done.  After we finally got the menu I was really surprised to see the expensive entree pricing given the atmosphere etc. But they have one thing going and that is pretty good food. I had a pesto chicken linguini which was pretty good. My bf got a med-rare sirlion which came out perfect and was delicious. :) I might give this place another try during their happy hour, has potential!

8UfinxBZ4fS-Qxei6Xkn1g.text: Come see Chris at BLD's...He was an awesome waiter!  Service and atmosphere here were great!  Not about the food...I had the chicken and waffles...AWESOME!!!!  I usually have leftovers...not today!  I will definitely be back.  Oh, and for the breakfast lovers out there they serve breakfast every day till 2pm

4PZknMd-1Napaw1HpO9mjw.text: excellent bartender! nice place. the food is a hit or miss, some is good some is not, most of the specials, stay away from. get the menu food, it's much bettter, but still be choosy. the bagel sandwich is a must have breakfast sandwich! and the chicken parm sandwich special is a must stay away from not good sandwitch at all! but go try this place, it's cool. and go to the bar, you'll usually get excellent service especially if it's Bill!

TnAzo-EKZKSse2tcR6QQcQ.text: I've got some serious TLC for BLD. Short rib eggs benedict... is there really more that I need to write?

mGE4PmPiAW497i2z52wQwQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking to switch things up for breakfast this past Sunday. We'd passed by BLD a few times before and thought we'd give it a try. The atmosphere is hip enough, and it seemed pretty decently busy. My boyfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy while I ordered the traditional breakfast of scrambled eggs, wheat toast, bacon, and I ordered a pancake instead of the breakfast potatoes. First time around, my eggs were cold. Very cold. I informed my waitress who had them remade for me. Honestly, I would rather eat eggs from Denny's than eggs from BLD. They were watery and flavorless no matter how much salt and pepper I added. The toast came buttered but with no jam or jelly brought to the table. Bacon was fine as it's pretty hard to mess up bacon. The pancake was large, but really just sort of "meh". Nothing too terribly exciting. As for the biscuits and gravy, the entire dish reeked of onion. The onion flavor was so strong that it completely overpowered any other flavors that could have been present. Finding his dish inedible, we left having eaten between us a piece of toast, half a pancake, and bacon. Perhaps the food for lunch and dinner is better, but I don't think neither my boyfriend of myself care to find out. Overall, the atmosphere is nice, but the food was awful. We won't be returning.

cQiLwNCXePwMafyKUt3ExQ.text: This was our first visit and we really enjoyed it. The restaurant was busy, but not over-crowded. The portions were HUGE; food fantastic and service was great. We'll be returning to try other dishes on the menu.

Nv55SdVqqXakJoM_b4_shw.text: My family and I came in a small group to eat dinner for my grandmother's birthday. It was super bowl Sunday and most places were closing early however this restaurant was still open for an hour or so. I'm giving BLD a 1 star due to the quality- rather lack there of service and poor food quality. After waiting for 15 minutes for the server to come back to the table to take our drink orders, she then told us we were given the wrong menus. The server was nice enough, although we could tell that she just wanted to be off her shift already and in no hurry to serve us. My grandmother's order came out wrong. Not to mention we all had some sort of food-related sickness just hours later. My aunt called this morning to let them know of the poor service we had had, their response was, "we will let the kitchen know." Which leads me to believe they not only do not care about the food they are cooking/serving but also customer service doesn't matter to them either.  We will never eat here again. Do not suggest this place what so ever. They don't even season their potatoes!

3onkzGmzHkd7KcQKlFbfRw.text: I almost always get the Chicken and Waffles because they're exceptional. Chicken is always fried perfectly so it's moist inside, waffles are fluffy and absorb just the right amount of syrup.   After my first taste of the deliciously moist chicken, I thought to myself -- what was missing? A condiment! Ketchup and ranch would mask the flavors, I needed something more subtle, and maybe a little sweet. Honey Mustard of course! I worked myself up, proud of myself for knowing just what I wanted.   Well, they don't have honey mustard. 4 stars.

BHxx8YhHd9UZPgjPv5B-6Q.text: I really want to like this place.  I have several friends that told me about it.  They have a good vibe, and an interesting menu, but unfortunately after 2 bad visits in 1 week I won't be returning.  I went with the family last weekend and had a great waiter, but the food was just so so.  The drink wasn't good, and the burger was well done instead of medium.  They gave me a free drink, and the manager came over on the burger.  I told her it was just feedback on the burger and I didn't want to make a big deal about it even though it was burnt.  I went back last night with the family.  My daughters Mac and Cheese came out in less than 5 minutes.  It was salty, and tasted bad.  If a 7 year old who eats Mac and Cheese at least 4 times a week doesn't like it, then it has to be bad.  Then we waited 20 minutes for drinks that only came after we reminded the waiter, and the whole time we were out of water.  Our appetizer, tempura zucchini,  was more like beer battered and the zucchini was too thick and under cooked.  The Southwest Aioli looked like it had a crust on the top, and liquid floating, plus it was hot.  Not good for a mayonaise based product.  Ordered a chicken dinner to split.  It was burnt on the outside and pink on the inside.  It sat in a bowl of mush which tasted horribly.  We didn't eat hardly any of it, and told the waiter who didn't acknowledge the problem, but did go show the manager which happened to be the same woman that we spoke with the last time we were in.  Instead of her coming over and talking to us, they just took the meal off.  I appreciate that they have not charged us for some of our items that were screwed up, but there seems to be little concern for the customer.  They need to fire the chef, fire the expediter, inspect their wait staff for consistency in quality of service, and inspect what their customer experience is all about.   We eat out every day and are always looking for good places.  This place has potential, but it's being managed poorly.

Gz8MBzDM0WmYjfOLu4TlZw.text: Stopped in twice in 1 day. From out of town in chandler on business. For lunch, the ahi tuna salad was great, BLD ice coffee too. Came in later for HH, and liked the HH beverage specials, and apps. Recommend BLD. Service was a bit slow for lunch but could be due to many customers.

oAyZ7EtPDhkEBqBteOnETQ.text: Great food here, not your run of the mill place. We continue to frequent BLD at least every couple of weeks, although today the hostess had a bad attitude and I could tell she didn't want to be there. She was not welcoming at all. No matter food and wait staff made up for it.

0LZDb5Xxw24H6hCppuo7DQ.text: Ok I'm going to leave my rating at 3 stars because this place is a hit or miss. We were here the other night for happy hour and had such a great experience we came back on Fri for dinner. Not happy. My margarita was not good and my husband ordered the special - corned beef. It was over cooked, rubbery, and did not have any corned beef flavor. Highly disappointed. I ordered the pita pizza which was great again (thank goodness).  I've had equally good and bad experiences here now. Not sure what to think. They aren't consistent.

Ep5KQcl5m8XUDWF-HSdQeQ.text: The service was good and everyone we met was friendly. The wait time was less than quoted which is always nice.  My husband was annoyed that the basic burger was a "cheeseburger" which is not basic in his book. He failed to notice the cheese and scraped it off. They offered to remake it but he said no since it was his error.  He had onion rings as the side and said they were good. His biggest complaint is the bun is so big compared to the burger. We found out they do have a smaller bun for kids burgers, which he will request next time.  I had the chicken biscuit. The biscuit was huge and moist, quite good. The Chicken was also large but didn't have much flavors me. It has sausage gravy over it. I'm sure any would like this, for me it was overwhelming. The breakfast potatoes with it were basic. I think I ate 1-2 of them?  Because of great service and good quality, I would try here again but the meal I ordered was just ok. I did have lots of leftovers which stretched for 2 more meals.

283FLx2rS2svW1qzhCiwXw.text: The place is really cute and very clean. Our servers name was matt. And he was awesome. Great suggestions. We ordered the veggie omelet and the Monte Cristo. My omelette came out with cheese wich I asked to be taken out but Matt checked back very quick and brought out a new one. Our food was excellent. I would definetly recommend this place.

yMl8STqZq7ZeVt-c3Doc_w.text: BLD = Bo Loves ...... ummm Bo Loves Dis-Place :)  I really do love this place. I first heard of it thru Yelp, but never had the chance to visit since it's far from the land of Scottsdale where I dwell.  Finally made it and boy was I thrilled!  I sat at the bar where Aaron was a great host and kept my drinks full.  I ordered "The Goat Burger" -- Yummy!  Oh serve me a sweet bite: goat cheese, bacon, roma tomatoes, and arugula.  Oh how it pleased my palates. The burger was sweet and the scent of the arugula traveled thru my nostrils with delight.  This was one good burger and I must recommend it!  The place is like a lounge and with an awesome wine rack in the back.  I totally dig the designs and the communal table in the middle.  I recommend sitting at the end of the bar where the table curves around where you can chat with your friends and of course, Aaron, which showed and offered up some of his favorite wines -- Thanks man! - Enjoy!

eeRVYx2kqz-HuA1HmVCetg.text: Update: decided to give BLD a chance for dinner,  it was really really good,  I had the roasted beet salad and my boyfriend had the "goat"burger.  The food blew us away, and our server Caroline was wonderful,  we had our drinks asap and our food was hot and delicious.  We will come back sooner than every few months!

xvp23BKYjJAkCwGjs9ywTg.text: Great eggs Benedict! Food came out super fast and the portions were huge ....service was friendly....definitely want to try lunch and dinner next !

Bxvh-4_g0sms7OR1AmefWA.text: Love the daily specials, morning happy hour and staff.  I eat breakfast here pretty regularly and have yet to have a bad experience.  Breakfast has always been consistent and delicious.  Lots of options including healthy ones and a dog friendly patio too!

22qNbgzV1xH1583R8bIANQ.text: We had a gift card- went in around noon on a Sunday. If you don't want to wait, I would suggest coming a little later. We ended up waiting about 20 minutes, not too bad. We were seated a large booth that could easily fit 5 (there were 2 of us) but was nice and roomy. Decor is modern and some of the design aspects were interesting yet weird (ie: only seeing part of the kitchen, large communal table). We started off with drinks- the honey bee was nice with honey vodka, cranberry juice and ginger ale. Beer selections range from local breweries (San Tan and 4 Peaks) to domestics.   Our waitress was very attentive and service was very good here. I ordered the Cali Benedict, which came with 2 poached eggs, bacon, avocado, tomato and hollandaise. My fiance ordered the BLD burger with sweet potato fries. The BLD burger was GIANT and came with 2 beef patties, green chile pork, onion straws and a poached egg. The Benedict was good, eggs poached perfectly, the homemade potatoes were OK. The best part of the burger was the green chile pork...mmm!! Onion straws and beef patties were over cooked. One thing I did notice is some tables seated after us did get their food before us- which is something mentioned in other reviews. It wasn't a big deal for us as we were enjoying our Sunday brunch meal.  All in all, we liked this place and would return.

OTZXxSkYtJ97_LFq_As5pg.text: Had a great breakfast meeting.. I can't say enough about the facility ..service was good, food was good snd the restaurant was very clean and the atmosphere was very conducive to our meeting.. I highly recommend BLD

6AAMaiXKZZfeaI_Qr-jXmg.text: I initially knocked BLD for having a $13 lunch, but I was blown away by my meal. A salmon filet cooked to order over a generous serving of hummus beside a salad of quinoa, spinach, feta and tomato.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Salmon on quinoa salad with hummus

my_wgq8Fx0q_j8-9ef6jwQ.text: Was looking for something different to eat when I stumbled on to this place. I decided to go check it out. The location isn't idea for the place to stand out, as its in between several other restaurants in the area. Upon arrival, I immediately noticed that non of the staff were smiling. As someone who use to manage a restaurant, I find that if the smiling staff sets the tone and vibe for the customer. My waitress/ server also seemed out of it and not entirely focused on being there. The dinning room was fairly empty for a dinner service. The one thing that most surprised me about BLD was the menu. The restaurant offered BBQ options. I ordered a beef brisket sandwich, with short ribs. The beef brisket was pretty good, although it needed more fat to be sliced in to give it a juicy flavor. The ribs were dry. The locally made BBQ sauces however made up for the dry ribs. Overall a good place to dine, just would like to see more lighting and more smiling and aware people. Would recommend this place for a late lunch or early dinner.

_uMTYdkCpqW0vAFMeL1RbQ.text: I'd have given this place 4 stars however it lacks consistency. The first time here service and food was awesome. There were a lot of creativity on the menu. The second time here, food came out cold but service was great. Our 3rd time, food was just not up to par and service suffered.

5BzPry2yWjMBR1DnhnYhbA.text: Great name, great concept! Food was presented very well and tasted amazing.  I had the smoked turkey croissant sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The one big chunk of avocado was odd in that it didn't fit well into the sandwich but the taste of the sauce and turkey was very well crafted.  I've been to places where sweet potato fries are not done right and they do them right here.  Their menu is huge and look forward to coming back for breakfast, lunch and dinner very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Smoked Turkey Croissant Sandwich with sweet potato fries! yum!

CBvllsvg613eDffuDH8sLg.text: My wife and I went to BLD in Chandler. The food was not good. No flavor. No love. Could have done much better. Although the service was good.

jTP46WRD8bPUZHdTdz7qUg.text: Food and service is incredible!   I go every Tuesday and Thursday after work. Staff always remembers my drink and food order. Very, very hospitable and friendly. They know me by name which always adds that extra courtesy that we all appreciate when we go somewhere on a regular basis.   Jay is typically my server. Friendly and accommodating as always. Bill the bartender is very charismatic, and makes some great suggestions on food when I am looking to change it up on the menu.   Been hundreds of times and the very rare times when they make a mistake, they always make it right.   I am a lifer!

Zg9D9-YehNLeZzFfT9c0bA.text: I am a big fan of this place!! My only complaint is that I occasionally get charged for the wrong drink and the to-go coffee bar isn't really geared for a quick in and out service but the bartenders are always good for some banter while you wait. Omg did I mention morning happy hour?!

rzfgt-OW9G4r3uzs9jdagA.text: When we had arrived the wait time was only about 15 to 20 minutes but that was expected because we had heard good things about this place. When we were seated we put in our order and assumed that we'd get our food within 30 minutes or so. They must have been short staffed because it took a full hour before we got our food. We weren't the only people in the restaurant that were annoyed with the long wait time. At one point nobody in the back room  had food on there table and they also were very agitated. Our food wasn't that good, we ordered the biscuits and gravy and the biscuit was stale.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

VWTaKq1_CAvbrzGjb3Vouw.text: Three and a half stars: not bad, not great, and overpriced.  Disclaimer: I've only been here for dinner, and I eat fish but no other meat.    My husband and I started with the roasted beet salad, which had generous quantities of beets, yummy fresh goat cheese, arugula and candied pecans.  It was simple and the olive and oil and sea salt dressing was perfect.  The portion was also quite nice for $7.  There were only two fish dishes and one vegetarian dish on the long menu.  Frankly, I don't think it's worth coming here for dinner at all if you don't eat meat.  Breakfast and lunch might be better, but I haven't checked.  I ordered the Salmon, server over a parmesean risotto.  The fish was juicy and the risotto was flavorful, but the quality of the ingredients of both items was maybe a step above Chilli's - nice, but not my idea of an $18 meal.    My husband ordered the Tilapia, which surprised us by arriving on top of a large salad (we expected vegetables on the side from the menu description).  The fish was just ok - not bad but far from fancy, and definitely not a $16 item by my estimation.  Overall, the place is nice-looking but not quite as fancy as it seems to want to be, which seems to describe the food as well as the decor.  The service was really friendly.  I'll be honest: we were given a gift certificate for this place, and we enjoyed our meal, but we definitely wouldn't come back here on our own dime, even if it was really close to home and convenient.    PS I didn't care for the Malbec and I'm pretty easy to please, so see if you can taste it before you order.
