Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Salmon with parmesean risotto - nice, but not super fancy, $18.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tilapia on a salad - nice salad, nice fish, not nice enough for $16.

hFCT2G8uUomShEH2b6MJPg.text: Really, really tasty. I've been here for breakfast and happy hour and both are delicious with lots of options - it's on my list to try for dinner one of these days. I definitely recommend it if you're in the area.

HU2DQlpXzu9JPeuR722s5A.text: We found this place on Internet because it has a dog friendly patio and we happened to have our dog with us outside during lunch time. Very nice place and friendly waitress. The waitress served the water and dog cookie to our dog before serving us water which I think it's warm to the fur customer. My daughter had Fish Taco which is tasty, I ordered a Hatch Chili Hash which is yummy too except it's a bit large portion to me. Will come back again to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lovely
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hatch Chili Hash

69sIIWakJETlNVYgZLzbUA.text: We sat at the bar and had a hash and an omelette. The hash was basically 3 or 4 chopped potatoes with queso. The omelette has absolutely no seasoning, NONE. Drinks were good, we had Bloody Marys and Irish coffees. Service was awful.

KRorIqHiDHrzzYK8gxRrQg.text: I've been here 2 times in the last 2 weeks, and this place is pretty good.  The service I received was excellent!  When I went for lunch, the atmosphere was very relaxed, and the bartender was very attentive.  Same goes for breakfast, even though it was much busier during the breakfast visit (I overheard a server saying they're busiest during the breakfast times).  For breakfast, I went with a tried and True, biscuits and gravy, which comes with 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon, and potatoes.  My server asked me if I wanted some chorizo on my potatoes, which was unexpected, but later I saw that their lunch special was tacos with chorizo.  I probably should have steered clear of the chorizo, as it was a bit much, but I didn't look at the special board before I came in.  For those who like extras though, it was nice that he offered and didn't charge for it.  The biscuits were slightly disappointing, I'm sad to report.  They had a good flavor, but they were a little overbaked to the point where they were almost hard.  Also, the parts that didn't have gravy on them actually tasted of slightly burned biscuit.  :(  This saddened me, but didn't take away from the meal too much.  When I went for lunch the previous week, I got the grilled chicken sandwich, which comes with bacon on it and avocado.  The sandwich tasted awesome!  This time, the only downside was a matter of mechanics.  The bacon/avocado would not stay between the bun (which was a bacon focaccia, I believe... yum!) when I'd bite into it.  Not that big of a deal.  I mean, the sandwich fillings were hefty!  Anyhow, good food here.  Excellent service.  Try it out if you're in the neighborhood!

Bi_2JSiuCTHGUQDJSmPH2A.text: Awesome place! Fast service and everyone is so nice! The atmosphere is nice, plenty of T.V.'s to watch your favorite shows. Now, let's get down to the most important part: the food!  The food is spectacular! Since they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, there's a TON of variety, even for a picky eater like me. My favorite so far is the Memphis BBQ pulled pork. It comes with two sides and some great-tasting cornbread. They also have a variety of BBQ sauces for your specific tastes. If you have the time and are craving some quality food and service, check it out!

tfb9LLzyyI1W-zihKtfQPw.text: This was our first visit to BLD. We got there at 9 am on a Saturday and were able to be seated immediately. This place is apparently very dog friendly as there was a family of 6, with each person having their own Great Dane sitting next to them. The meal was good and big enough for my wife and I to share - we ordered an omelette with potatoes. The price is similar to other restaurants. We would definitely go back again.

pgT0ZB4Xzpt1qVwTaDziUw.text: Was good  Brought a client here and he loved his burger. It was huge.   My chicken sandwich was good. It looked like it was going to burst with flavor, but it was kind of bland.   Service was great

z6xb1pcEGZctECtwzkK3sg.text: I'm not sure why this place is not rated much higher because the food is top notch. You will not be disappointed with any of the burgers.  They are generous with the toppings on the burgers and fries (ask for ranch dressing for dipping- so good!) and everything was fresh and colorful.  Also they have a dog friendly patio!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Blue burger but substituted white cheddar instead. Generous with the bacon YUM!!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Goat burger
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fish tacos -added avocado for $1- from appetizer menu

JAsbsTXJLWcndpr9HkgpnQ.text: We always have gotten good service and good food here. We have only come for dinner but we been about 10 times. All ten times were better than average to excellent. Highly recommend if you need a reliable place to go without a long wait with nice food and good price.

_C5Lmi9nCBoKgB0-5cOR3A.text: Food is great and service is outstanding! The BBQ is great. Appetizers are outstanding. They have a great happy hour and great selection of beers.

P50JqHf82NeMM0w9yS_QEA.text: We love coming here for dinner, and we are excited to try breakfast on our next visit. The short rib pasta is excellent, the service has always been great. Their happy hour draft pitchers are a complete steal.... Can't go wrong with cheap craft beer.

RYI1nGZRN-EhWl4yUz-rHQ.text: Went to BLDs when it opened for happy hour and have gone back several times since then. The food is always decent- breakfast is the best in my opinion.  The place is clean and the staff is ok but the bartender that is typically there for brunch is awesome.   I for the love of me can't remember his name- brain fart ...but he gives great recommendations on what to order,  knows the menu and ingredients and makes awesome cocktails.

yTpg4q0mq7aMlVuSaekPwQ.text: We were once a week regulars and because of the service have been increasingly disappointed with BLD. After last week, we've decided we will not be returning. Time to give our business to someplace with servers who actually show up with smiles happy to help and make your visit enjoyable and actually SERVE you. In the current state this restaurant will not last which is unfortunate because they do have pretty good food.

xihF1WunhvasCdvg5mJ03Q.text: Only a three star because of service . Came in waited not as long as they said , but sat at the table for a while  before a unhappy waitress came to us , I only say unhappy because she acted like she didn't want to be here . No smile no personality .  Order our food , we do love the food that's what keeps us coming back not the servers so after ordering meal came asked for mustard and ketchup , waited about 5 mins for them to come to our table .. A server brought it to us with again no smile drop and left as fast as she could   We really do love the Huge portion of foods so if you like good food big meals come here but don't look for friendly conversation , hasn't always been this way have been coming here for two years .   I should say The only bad part of the food is potatoes they sever with breakfast , they come on every breakfast , but don't eat them , hard , and dry , think they make them early in the morning before open .  But we aren't coming for the potatoes  They do greet you when you come in and leave

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Vegetarian omelette
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Vegetarian breakfast
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Simple breakfast

4c5mPvK_W041NVCifPOyoA.text: My wife and I recently moved to the ocotillo/chandler area and are exited to best local restaurants in the area. We found BLD on yelp and decided to give it a try for breakfast .  At first glance we notice they have a unique and giant sign outside displaying the food. We walked in service was fast. Server was very good. The dining area was clean and modern.  Restrooms were original and clean.    I ordered the Short Rib Eggs Benedict and my wife ordered chicken and waffles.  Everything was going great until we tried the food. The meat was flavorless, the English muffin was soggy, and the hollandaise sauce tastes out of a jar. who ever cooked the food must hate preparing such a boring recipe.   Overall, this restaurant lacked originality and soulIf you like to look at a "pretty" venue, this place is for you. If you love great tasting food, try somewhere else.  .

bEn5tnsCMC3XibMsVatL7w.text: Love this place!!  Everything is good!  Traditional and unique recipes.   An seat large groups easily.

h1hrhIaNbuK171WiZCLdnw.text: Amazing environment and the food was so great! The burger was cooked so well and with the perfect sauce! I love this place!

4yP9ZUSbcEw-OBjmZ5Vm3w.text: Great breakfast spot. Food is always on point and never disappointing. Portions sizes are huge, worthy of splitting.  Bill and Penny at the bar are phenomenal and very attentive to their patrons. Nice outdoor patio that allows dogs too. Would recommend this place to everyone for a super delicious breakfast

MhZBaM84rF4UPrqQ_Eeuqw.text: I cannot say enough about BLD. Food is generous and well prepared. The staff is friendly and attentive. Prices are reasonable. Drinks and coffees are well crafted. I enter hungry and eager and leave satisfied and content every time.  This restaurant is family friendly which is typically not my preferred space, but the rest of the experience overrides the pitter-patter and chatter.

wt8t8poBZIoIef1XN2m5gg.text: We started our day here with breakfast. But first, I ordered the Hazelnut Sunrise. It's a shot of expresso, milk, Frangelico, and BLD Irish Cream.  Not too shabby!!  My wife had the Dirty Chai-but in this version, the expresso melts the Chai powder. She loved it.  The decor is hard to describe but to me it's a local favorite so that makes it divey. It has a comfortable atmosphere.  Our server was great explaining the menu options including the drinks mentioned above and provided excellent service.   On to the meal. I naturally ordered the "Wise Man omelette" - a 3 egg omelette with red wine braised short rib, cheese and veggies with country potatoes.  The potatoes were deep fried and super delicious. The omelette was good but I prefer bacon over shredded beef- though no fault to BLD.  My wife ordered the chicken fried steak meal with potatoes, eggs and gravy. She wasn't too happy with the chicken fried steak because it was pounded down to about  1/4" and difficult to cut through.  But she loved the deep fried country potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. 3/4 of a Hazelnut Sunrise.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak with country potatoes, eggs and gravy
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wise man omelette with country potatoes.

4gShubLLY-XOfn0NthUPDg.text: I ordered a spicy burger to go, was told 10 minutes. Came 15 minutes later and my burger was not ready, no big deal. After waiting just 5 or 6 minutes, got my meal. Got it back to work and found it was wrong and that I was given a "basic burger" per the menu, missing the spicy sauce, crispy onions, and avocado, all which make the burger.  Also cut into it was was well done although ordered medium rare. I called to give a heads up and was told, "but the chef made it himself." Well the chef either doesn't know how to cook a medium rare burger and follow a recipe or I was given a well done patty with a slapped together wrong burger. Huge waste of $15.   ... Have also eaten in here 3 times and service is slow which is why I attempted pickup. Wouldn't recommend. Not consistent and disappointing.

iKyYerccjUW12lu6_CuWEA.text: Very sad to say that this venue has gone from being one of my favorite spots for breakfast, lunch and dinner to NEVER AGAIN.   A few months ago I ordered bbq on the insistence of the waiter.  They state  that everything is smoked in-house. . Not sure about that.  Baby rack ribs came smothered in bbq sauce. Tender, but definitely reheated.  The corn bread was so crumbly it just broke into tiny pieces when I bit into it--like it had been frozen and reheated.  I don't even remember the rest of the meal because it was disgusting.  My husband had the seared ahi salad which was and has been consistently good there.  Fast forward to tonight, we wanted to order some take out dessert.  They were out of the tres leches cake so we ordered the dessert chimichangas and the chocolate cake.  I know I've tasted that chocolate cake somewhere else before.  Like Fry's bakery or somewhere.  Definitely not baked on site.  Cold, defrosted and AGAIN smothered in cherry sauce.  Yuck.  They stuck the container of ice cream right in the middle where it was sticking to frosting and cherry sauce.  Nice.   The chimis were equally as bad. Big thick tortilla half baked stuffed with runny cream cheese.  And only 4 small pieces.  Again, the ice cream was stuck in the middle of the container right on top of the caramel sauce.  Seriously, this place used to be so good.  Now it's just dying a slow death.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

I-tmQVxX6eFlhclAaZnp_g.text: Amazing food & service. Abby was our server, and she was so upbeat and helpful. The heathbar latte was awesome. Definitely will be back!! Thank you Abby for the awesome service!

_Tqv7385umXlGkJIxdrEFA.text: We celebrated one of our friends tonight and Shasta was such an amazing waitress. She was very attentive to detail and remembered each order with ease. I highly recommend BLD, especially if Shasta is your waitress.

XCtfmdGfSFV3Grq3zMFKoQ.text: Shasta was an awesome server!! She went above and beyond for our group! She interacted with the group and gave excellent suggestions.

z2twDzTn8YFohwmXJthIiQ.text: I ordered the Jalapeno Burger.  Ehhh. It was like a blank sheet of printer paper. Just.... Plain.  The patty wasn't even seasoned with saltb or pepper. It was just... Flavorless. It did have an obvious cheep,  once frozen,  cream cheese filled fried Jalapeno stuck on top with a tooth pick.  Place looks cool... But if you can't make a burger with more flavor than eating a photograph of a hamburger...... I will give them another try.. Just not burgers.

Z7mi1QSkYwB7S_DxlBhLMw.text: Phenomenal food, nice spot, but never, I repeat, never order to go. I think it's been a total of six times out of maybe the eight I've ordered to go and the order has been wrong - like entirely wrong. Either missing a side, not cooked right (specifically eggs), or the wrong menu item completely. I've brought this up to management's attention to try to have the issue corrected, but unfortunately the same guy still works there, and still continues to make BLD look incompetent.  Figured it was time to write this review given that I literally just hung up on the (same) guy who for five minutes couldn't walk over to a quiet place to take my order but just kept reading it to me wrong over, and over, and over again.   So. Definitely a favorite spot for DINE IN ONLY.

ZDjePm1Khx0Yf-OBg5jkeQ.text: First of all, I love the fact that they have a dog friendly patio!! So we got to bring our little furbaby with us for brunch!   I ordered the margarita and the smoked turkey crossiant. This was huge and really good. I really liked the pesto aioli that it came with. My margarita was ok. Nothing special.   They also have happy hour every day which is great. 7-11 Monday to Friday and 3-7 everyday. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Smoked turkey crossiant

i70zuY2BFU3FZLiKO0ZfKQ.text: I've been here for breakfast a few times now. The breakfast is pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend it normally. This is generally a good meeting spot for me and some friends. The french toast is really good, and the staff is friendly.

UcxFRmOgItvTQ2R8I8Q1Kw.text: I've been about 4 times. Once when they were just opening, and it was great.  The last few times have been worse than the last. The Bloody Mary (spicy) and the better than average diner food will reel me in again, but for the prices, I expect better and organizationed service staff. One took the drink order, 25 mins later, our drinks run by another server who took our order, food run another, asked for another drink, never came. Original server brought the check.   Every time. Everyone is super nice, it's just too much going on.

YxDFk5o-fp9P-Gl3YbBBLA.text: This is an excellent restaurant serving quality delicious food. I posted on a Friday evening I was upset they ran out of all you can eat fish fry early in the evening a few weeks in a row. Only a day or two later I received a message apologizing for being out of fish and if I returned the following Friday they promised to have fish. They did and it was excellent. I recommend anything on the menu; the Sunday night prime rib is excellent.

LXnTXQZ8lOC4uzi1wlaxcQ.text: Server was very nice and welcoming. My girl ordered a vegetarian omelet and specified onion allergy yet there was onion (not a lot). She liked it as she was looking for a healthy meal. I ordered the chorizo fries and they were pretty good, too cheesy for me but awesome for cheese lovers. I've had the Hawaiian French Toast here and it's really good. Also, my girl ordered coffee. Coffee cup had an old stain. Not cleaned well.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

vcUs3vVOYwNp0nH_xu5PGA.text: Have not been disappointed each time we've been here. Prime rib eggs Benedict was on special one day, absolutely incredible. We have had the tacos (not our favorite but still good). Country fried steak is to die for. Large portions but worth it. Bloody Mary's are the best we've had in the Valley (&& we are from Wisconsin). Other drinks have been refreshing as well. One server was once very rude & dismissive, other that that- amazing place!

H4z1ooT8eolhaav3wOgH-g.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants!  The food is delicious and the vast variety of choices & portions you cannot beat. Also, The service we have had especially today was very good! Our server, Gracie the last few times has been wonderful! Gracie was friendly, gracious and helpful with her suggestions and service.  So much that We have started to request her as our server!  Keep up the great work BLD!

IhWOK0oYKuj2QgodQ1czZA.text: Trying this spot again only for breakfast this time.  The coffee and service was just okay but the BLT eggs Benedict were done nicely! The pouched egg was perfect on top of the nicely crisped English muffin.  The fruit was disappointing.  For an tasty $$ entree with no other sides, canned pineapple doesn't cut it!

TqYM99uWmkFXW9S0fB0AtA.text: My friends and I had dinner on Saturday night & had a wonderful time. We especially loved the BLD steak salad and the roasted cauliflower. The best part of our experience was our server, Abbi. She was so gracious and accommodating, we felt very well taken care of. We look forward to returning again soon!

SLT0h9HMyFtTv2_uigjt6g.text: My husband & I went to BLD for lunch today. I can't say that our experience was awful but it certainly wasn't great. It began by awkwardly standing at the front and not being greeted for 5 minutes. After being seated our drink orders were taken but it took quite a while before the server came to take our order. We both ordered a BLT with a side salad. The side salad had a few tiny pieces of tomato with 2-3 croutons and a ton of wilted lettuce. It was the worst side salad I have ever been served! The same wilted lettuce took over our BLT's!!! There was more wilted lettuce on our sandwich than there was in our side salad! I have had better BLT's at fast food restaurants. Our whole experience left us feeling underwhelmed and with the amount of quality restaurants in the area, I don't see us ever returning.

hZJwcXZhdy0St9mI0cxTGQ.text: This is our favorite restaurant for breakfast and Shasta is the best server we have ever encountered in any restaurant.  We were not even sitting in her section and she brought over our drinks and took our order. She makes our whole experience that much better- if you can request her section do so!! (All the employees are super nice there!!)  Thank you everyone at BLD for being so awesome !!!!!!

uYy07D0vzoNi0QYpVlDE_g.text: Went on a Friday night (5/18) and the waiter suggested to get All-you-can-eat Fish-n-Chips. After 1 refill, the waiter told us that they are running out and not sure if they have anymore.  After 1 refill, we left.  Waiter was slow and inattentive...and when a big table of 15 (or so) people left, service was no better.  Fried fish is good, but service is awful.  Too many good restaurants in Chandler....I won't be back anytime soon.

ls1xWGz_PGFgajqdI4mT4A.text: This is going to be our new favorite place! I love the quiet family atmosphere...The music wasn't blaring so we could actually talk and enjoy each other's company. We all loved our food... My husband had the brisket sandwich, I had the grilled chicken breast with a baked potato and asparagus (grilled perfectly) and my daughter had the kids Mac and cheese. We also wanted to try some different things there so we also had pancakes on the side and bacon on the side just to try....so hard to decide what to have with their very extensive menu! Best pancakes in town! The service from Micah was exceptional...our drinks never emptied, our food was hot and he was super friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. We will be back soon!

gQL-G3q_TDm0LfsBt2ClEw.text: This place is AMAZING!!!! Food is so good. Our waiter Kevin was great! We will be back

-vgYPqnu2LLJ2MGmBtG-8g.text: Awesome food and staff. Bartended Penny makes fablous drinks and is always friendly. I like breakfast here but definitely want to come back to try dinner.

YwLNIxv6ornM1vY8qOBD-Q.text: Aside from the fact that the food is delicious, Abby is the best server me and my brunch buddies have ever had!!! She is professional but very personable and gives off an amazing energy that makes the experience of BLD by far one of the best in the valley! Last time my best friend and i were there she got both of our orders correct and ensured that we were having an amazing experience. Shes a food lover herself so understands the art of perfecting the BLD experience and im so happy this place has such an amazing person on their staff! Yay for delicious food at BLD and stellar service from Abby!

2IOTWIoe-dx6e1CDXBE3Tg.text: Came in late on a Friday night with 10 people (3 kids) and Micah was amazing. The food was decent but the service was incredible-- I'm vegan and he was great about looking into the ingredients/answering my questions. Would go back for the service alone.

HI1LaQ75sx6u4QSyUTiA9A.text: Micah was our server Excellent attentive Brisket excellent sides plentiful & delicious  Highly recommend

uCoC5y3JfGxx36bEQ_WsVA.text: This was our group's first visit on a Saturday night and we were sat right away. Our server, Micah, walked up with a smile on his face. He was super helpful and very attentive. The food was amazing all around. I got a Bloody Mary (and I like mine spicy) one of the best bloody's I've had. It was also sangria Saturday and what a great deal for a Saturday! I got also got the goat burger and it was delicious!! Our whole table was blown away by the whole experience and we will definitely be back. Thanks again Micah!

rSnlvsafQxcbwmrPHa3j0w.text: Four stars for the menu options.  Being a weekday, with much needed to be a accomplished, I passed on a few of their tempting beverage options.  *insert pouty face*   Three stars for hot coffee -would've been five if they provided fresh cream instead if those Shamrock half & half *no chill* individual creamers filled with preservative so they can remain on shelf for at least a month.  Five stars for our server.  She was patient, efficient, timely and quick with a recommendation when i cpuldnt decide between two options. And the food, variety, taste, value, certainly deserving of five stars.  From the basic to better than basic, options served were even better than described. Like this place.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Green Chile Tostadas
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

04b4SQaoSCWl13gv0OO65w.text: I absolutely love this establishment!!!! Fresh, delicious, and consistent food would be enough for me to be a happy customer but they also have a lovely staff. Their dog-friendly patio is a humungous bonus and every person working here is sweet and kind to my fur babies!!!!

Z4qw2q-TqOnHi8SiVkiZGw.text: BLD's is usually an excellent choice for breakfast. Once I had a mediocre eggs Benedict, but typically, everything is delicious for breakfast. Lunch is hit or miss at times, but doesn't really inspire me to return.

qQP_ElYSw42sLMj5JTP5UA.text: Great food, atmosphere and super friendly staff! Quite a large variety of food on their menu. They can accommodate large parties without too long of a wait. The patio is dog friendly which is a huge plus!

CZL2S0SszXUgavK_z60XJg.text: It was overpriced for the service we received ! I would like to give them the benefit of the doubt maybe it was a bad day for our server but we probably won't be returning . We spent so long in the restaurant because we waited about 20 mins for something drinks , food , check , even our waiter  spent more time waiting then actually eating . By the time we got our food we were over it and just wanted to leave . Not to mention we got our drinks way after we got our food server never put them in or even followed up with us saw him once . Overall the experience was terrible not worth the price

8O7-A_bC-o8ZCZo2dqIqCw.text: The BLD is the #1spot in Chandler for a great dining atmosphere, delicious food and class AAA+ service!  I invited approximately 20 family members for breakfast today (all first timers) including five little ones. They raved about how awesome everything was. I must give a HUGE thank you to Stephanie who was so warm and attentive to making sure my large party seating area was adequate, was set up and ready before they arrived. Her genuine caring attitude cause many of my family members to think we were personal friends. And although we are not she made me feel like we had known each other forever.  Our server, Grace, mirrored the same quality, extremely personable and friendly, very attentive and a calmness that was felt by many of us. Makes a big difference with a large number of people. Along with the huge variety of dishes to choose from and the delicious food, our experience at BLD would not have been as successful without these two young ladies helping us feel comfortable and satisfied. Thank you BLD for employing people who care about people enough to ensure their experience creates a repeat customer! My hubby and I are not new to BLD which is why I chose this restaurant and we look forward to returning again soon!  Brenda in Chandler!

CKAynsxF-_0DAQXnCu087Q.text: Wow! Great brunch with friends and our Server Spencer was amazing and went out of his way to ensure that all of our needs and special dietary requirements were met. He truly listens to his clients and serves with a dazzling smile and True charm. Go Spencer!

vfpFRY0dbTIm9c-UnRBKKQ.text: Spencer was a phenomenal waiter. When I walked in and sat he asked what I would like to drink. I said Coffee.. via IV... he didn't fail to keep my cup filled. One of the parties at the table could not get the eggs just the way she wanted. He tried and tried and tried. He felt bad that it just didn't happen. I have to say, he went over and beyond and other wait staff should take a class from him on how to be a great waiter. Kudo's to him. I give him 5 stars!!!! The food was good but they did not have what I really wanted (thus the 4 star rating). I was in the mood for a bagel with lox and cream cheese but did not see that on the menu.

DdRCPhI4K6EQ3D18ayyguQ.text: Whenever I go BLD, I find myself happy. Their food and service are always super. especially thanks to Micah,  who served us mostly and recommends good dishes to try. they are turned out their  "a must" dishes .

n5GqodUOQlSSXu-rdogeQQ.text: Love it here! Great menu and amazing service!  Kevin is always super friendly. Lots of amazing drinks available

RS7PNI9xeKuYlTP_rUpFgA.text: This place is Amazing!! Didn't have to wait long. Kid-friendly, the service was impeccable and the food simply delicious!!! Definitely a gem in the desert.

xUNj1TseLQChEHRHqFMAvg.text: You have to come and try the new barbecue we had the ribs and the pork and the sausage and it was amazing we had a grilled feta cheese appetizer that was to die for recommending this place it's wonderful

1-9igV6wy1ZJiYuD-6cdgg.text: I have to say this place is awesome.  Dog friendly covered patio, huge indoor outdoor bar, great staff, and awesome food.  Oh in did I mention breakfast all day.

tfzOqBOp-QEq5e-JntPnpQ.text: The service has gotten so bad at this place that I've stopped going. A few of the bartenders are just rude and unwelcoming. Sorry, I'd rather give my $$$ to pleasant people.

o8BcNvlHWRiWqQDpbnpfZA.text: We love this place!  Christina is the best bartender!  Sometimes some sad faces come to the bar who don't like fun, but most of the time this is a wonderful place to have brunch with friends.  If you are hung over or just down for some good food this is a wonderful place.

urE6T2PLuF8P0Qx0ycpI1g.text: BLD has stepped their game up over the years. The new layout is awesome and the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie Burger and sweet potato fries. Ask for their aiolis.

p_6pJ5Z9lU4fgNyPPnKXUg.text: Giving this place four stars, because I have celiac and their food didn't make me sick. Several gluten-free choices on the breakfast, lunch and dinner menus. I am picky and my food came out exactly how I ordered it.

-kF5x48wgA0YmcB5_IzxIQ.text: I really want to like this place, and I do like it, but I cant say that I love it.  They do have a reputation with their service staff, but lately, it seems to have really improved.  Their happy hour fare is worthy of four stars, especially with a white or red sangria for only $3... and they're not skimpy portions.  I like the drive through.  They have tasty protein shakes (around $6), and you can even get a yogurt & granola to go.  Haven't tried the coffee.  Six of us met for breakfast today, and even though the place was jumping, we were seated within 10 minutes.  During our wait time, we were invited to the bar area where we ordered bloody marys and mimosas.  Feeling a bit untamed, I went with the short rib benedict, which is served with a red wine hollandaise.  It was OK, and I'm a fan of both short ribs and red wine.  The sauce was actually pink, which didn't give me the impression of red wine.  It was an acquired taste, not bad, but I'll choose a different menu option on my next visit.  BLD offers breakfast potatoes, not hash browns, and that makes daddy sad, because I'm a hash brown guy.  But they can fry them good and crunchy if you want.  The serving size of their green chili pork tostada is impressive, although I'm not sure I'd call it green chili... more of a simmered pork with some chili.  When I think of green chili, I think of El Zocalo in downtown Chandler.  BLD has many more offerings on their menu, so I've got more opportunities to fall in love.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Minus the foam, this is how much soy latte was actually in my cup.  I like foam, but that&#39;s about half the cup...
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Todays fruit medley consists of twelve pieces of watermelon and a grape :)

8kwCM0pZjDqJc4kTkht0Vw.text: The menu looked good but I wouldn't know how it tasted because a waitress never came by. We waited a while and when we saw a group walk in and get waters right away we left.

vgRdAtXbnGDE8F7kTszqDg.text: This review is based primarily on service.   Have been to this location before and have had wonderful food and service. Unfortunately, today we received some of the worst service. We came in around 12:30 this afternoon the restaurant was not very busy with just a handful of tables. We decided to sit outside on the patio, there was one other table with two women sitting and a couple at the bar. Once seated we waited a few minutes and a server appeared we gave him our drink order, he also took the drink order of the two ladies outside so I figured oh he may of just got double sat. ( I was a server for years so I understand the wait time with double seating) A women waitress appeared and brought the drinks out for the women and apparently was there server. Our server appeared several minutes later with our drinks and we were beyond ready to order by this time. My husband and I both ordered breakfast which came out absolutely delicious. I ordered the chicken and waffles, he ordered a breakfast burrito. Both came out exactly how we asked, the food was very tasty and was the best part of our lunch. Our server never came back out to check on us, we were never asked how the food was, I was never given a refill and my husband was literally getting up to find the server to give him a credit card to pay the bill and the server randomly appears. He asked us if we needed a to go box, we did not just wanted the check. The sever came back very quickly with the check and that was it.  BLD has extremely good food at reasonable prices so it is so unfortunate that I am giving it such a low rating. My husband and I travel a lot to this area and always enjoy BLD especially their breakfast, but if the service is this awful on a slow Thursday afternoon I'm not sure if we would return. Hopefully they can get it right, as we really do enjoy the food.

B0P9NoN7v-DKfU5XmEH6ng.text: Truly was not impressed ordered soup and grilled cheese sandwich The special for a nice place like this I would not expect processed cheese as it was it was a nice atmosphere and clean. Our waitress was clearly not in a good mood. I asked for extra cucumbers for my hummus  I didn't want to  eat any pita I got A total of four slices of cucumber . That's extra ? What do you get only two ?  When we asked our waitress it was like we are bothering her .she said that was extra !!!( rudely )we just said never mind..

yX3XQZ4hrOr7NLdg93QOAA.text: This place was fair for dinner. The service was good and I will definitely try it for breakfast/brunch.   I had a steak salad, my other companions ordered ribs and chicken and waffles.  I don't think dinner is their specialty so I will go back.

aU-IgUmaWwBobRlie8AWPQ.text: Super rude hostess. Didn't greet us or even look us in the eyes, just asked us how many. Rolled eyes plenty of times. Middle aged woman with short hair. Super uncomfortable.

YkBXIzOGMtrDz5MziWtdjw.text: Arrived at 4 pm on a Monday. Could count 6 patrons total in the entire restaurant. Waited 30 minutes to be greeted at our table. Never received the drinks we ordered. 1 server in the entire restaurant. When our food arrived, it was burnt to a crisp. What a mess.

VK4B-JKzb-34_52rzk6q4w.text: I go here at least once a week never had a complaint the food is tops and so are the portions, staff will make sure dining experience is great by checking regularly, and the variety of food is great! I would highly recommend this restaurant if possible I would gave it 10 Stars!!

gPebXw0_tCT2USLOEKuDuw.text: My mom loves this place. It seems very hipster-y inside.  The food was wonderful [individual omelets for all of us and shared breakfast potatoes], but our waitress would not let my brother order lunch 15-20min before lunch service started. With her spacy-ness [barely paying our table attention, let alone getting us water refills] you'd think she was going to let him order since it took forever to order, but nope!  What really bites the bullet is my aunt called us to order her a salad, 10 minutes before lunch service, AND THE WAITRESS TOOK THE ORDER. Really, girl?! It was like a 1-2 punch to my brother's gut.

3NT3ZjFc00X5tHy4Bv6ZpQ.text: Sorry to report bad review, avoid this place for dinner.  I should have guessed it was going to be bad since the place was deserted.  Anyway the food was dryed out, looked like it had been under heat lamp for an hour.  Their new pulled pork had no flavor, basically a roast not bbq.

op7Gahely2mwj8NJciaEDg.text: We were visiting from out of town and wanted a great place to eat with healthy options for brunch. This place did not disappoint. The place was very busy and we had a bit of a wait.. but the food was fantastic! Big portions and lot of selections. The only issue we had was the service. The 2 gals at the front were more concerned with their phone and flirting than helping us. We saw our waitress maybe 3xs and had to ask multiple times for things.  Good food.. not so good service.

4SfYNEo92vc8Dst-d8DwzQ.text: Decent BBQ, but the service is absolutely horrendous every single time.

2DYFmzX2yaBF7beCLvyi0A.text: Came here on a whim and it was awesome! Service was great, mimosa was huge and food was flavorful. We will definitely be back!

U8ptzsWslF1KUz1Cn3lEAw.text: Our new favorite breakfast spot.    Food is fresh and made from scratch. But what I like best is: 1) I can get healthy lower fat meats (not bacon or sausage) with my eggs. 2) They have more than the traditional fare.  If you want traditional items, they are there, but there is also things like braised short ribs, meatloaf, green chili pork.   We have never been disappointed (3 visits so far).  We have had: Breakfast Meatloaf BLD burritto with House Braised Short Rib Green Chile Pork Tostada Hatch Chili Omlette And I forgot what we got our first visit.  Service is good. It is now our "go to" place for breakfast, well worth driving a little further.

wVy7TWIrlCA6M-Y4jVD6lA.text: Wish I had a review for the food. I never got a chance to order. When I first walked in, the trailer looking woman with the dark roots and white hair just stared at me and never said hi or can i hrlp you or anything.  There was one nice guy who said the guy with the black hair at the bar would help me.  I didn't know money had a color. Thanks for the assistance..i will add this to my blog so all of my followers can see this. You never know who your customers are.

KA4NLM_19z2Z1adhNbWHCg.text: I used to love this place. Quality food and great service, but the last few times I've went, my food was not of good quality in my opinion. The steak and eggs use to be bomb, but the last time I ordered it, the steak had a funny taste and  a lot of fat chopped up in it. So, I thought it was a fluke, so I went again and ordered the California Benedict. It wasn't any better. The plate was the worse breakfast I've probably ever had. I did tell the server and she did take care of my check. The service was great, but I just can't go back again. What happened to this place?

wzUtBCfhZY8nxeFgCCvPkA.text: We were really excited to try this place. Sat for a few before we got greeted, no big deal. Ordered a soda and a Bloody Mary. Main reason for going was for the bloody. Watched it sit at the bar for a good while. Noticed the husband getting antsy about and about to throw down money for the soda and walk out. I walked up to the bar, asked the server if that was our drink and he said yes. I grabbed said beverage and walked to the table. We were promptly asked to leave for grabbing my drink that was sitting while he addressed other tables. We are now at Cold beer and Cheeseburgers

bPCN-iMNX2lccRPyMO032g.text: Pretty good for my first visit! Came in for dinner and expected it to be packed as it took a long time to find parking. It was almost empty. Apparently everyone was in nearby restaurants watching game 7 of the finals. This place has TVs and the game on! I ordered the Apple infused Pork Chop. It was a little tough but delicious! The potato balls are amazing! The seasoned onion rings for appetizer we fantastic! The risotto that my father ordered he said was under cooked. They offered another item in exchange. Will definitely give them a try again!

l15R-S2DJiIGOO0TyBHQpA.text: Great place! Love the happy hour menu too. The braised short rib is great for breakfast or dinner

_eT0M2_M2-C2GUdyF2r6Pw.text: Came here for breakfast Saturday morning on a whim and I was not pleased. Orders were placed and I received the wrong hash. When the waitress came over I told her, but she didn't really respond she just kind of walked away to check what she entered into the system. She comes back and says she rang it in correctly and wasn't sure why I had received the wrong item. She was nice overall even though that interaction was a little weird. The food came out relatively fast after she put in the right order. When I did receive my food, it was fine at first but I saw the eggs were so scrambled it seemed as though there were no eggs at all or maybe they weren't cooked all the way because the entire dish was just wet. Usually eggs are noticeable in any hash, this one was just covered in cheese and the potatoes were also greasy.  I also ordered the Spanish latte which was just ok (it's not really fair to compare real cuban coffee to an American cafe I guess). My dining experience here lead to an entire day of an upset stomach and feeling lethargic. I wouldn't come back to try anything else unfortunately.

_x7dh_8HyQWGDgLJ0b4IJw.text: BLD - I'm back for more of the same. I've raised you one star but that's all you're gonna get from me. Yes, your food is pretty good during the breakfast hour. It's hard to mess up oatmeal for sure. But you did mess up an omelette, an order of potatoes, and surprisingly an eggs benedict at our table for four. Your wait staff was smiling for sure, but jeez - so absurdly out of it this morning. I was shorted $1.27 in change on my bill, and her lack of interest in our table was surprisingly bold. You're crowded and I just don't get it. Two stars for the food, but it'd be a 1 for service. Sorry.

eWFcVgoVACka6BF9P77Upw.text: This place is ok if you are a regular  We have been there twice for breakfast and once for dinner.   The first time for breakfast we had to wait some time for the server. I was a little irritated, but managed to let it go. The food was fair... Average  The second time for dinner, again a little wait for the server, but we were waiting for friends. Food was not bad. The braised shortrib was good  The third time, today, we were sat AGAIN waiting for our server. What was worse this time was there were three table sat after us and they all got service right away.   The third table were regulars. Greeting everyone they walked by. The final straw was the server came to their table before they sat and had their drinks already for them.   I called the manager as we were leaving to let her know what happened. She made no attempt to recover us.   By the way, I was in the restaurant business for 25 years and was a manager. This is clearly a locals establishment. Outsiders have to endure.

q9vD119kkxT2mXGnftDu3A.text: I love taking my dog out for Yappy Hour and with this great weather it's the perfect time to try outdoor patios. The server was a ditz and kept forgetting everything but she was very nice. You got your stuff after reminding her a few times. They have dog bowls out on the patio along with dog biscuits. I tried the pastrami hash. Except for the cheese sauce on top it was tasty and I normally love cheese but I did not test good with the hash. My sangria was light and refreshing but it was not sangria. I probably would not go back unless it was on the patio. But probably would not eat there again.

-6mbRfYC4-8MXg6lh9tnAg.text: Used to love BLD but since the change of ownership it has gone steadily down hill. Wait staff doesn't quite grasp the concept of customer service- no personality, no checking on drink refills, no smiles. Bartender/manager on weekends is completely useless. And the cooks can't make a simple fried egg.  Seriously, how difficult is it to fry an egg?  So...bad food, bad service and bad management ... save yourself a headache and just go to Oreganos, Nandos, The Ivy, or Cold Beer and Cheeseburger-they're in the same shopping center. Personally I'd  be surprised if BLD is still open a year from now.

Ue-Yq_1q0lcZRubjLuGcqw.text: Just finished my Powerhouse salad with roasted chicken, Quinoa etc.  There was nothing Powerhouse about it but dry roasted chicken, a 1/2teaspoon of Quinoa...and a stomach ache. The pancakes were not light and fluffy but hard to cut and chewy. Will never go back.

gUAxe3GcglHiyBy8ltg8Og.text: My husband and I came here for breakfast in a Wednesday morning and we were about 1 of 3 parties there. We were seated right away and the service was fast and friendly. We had the white chocolate frozen chai tea lattes to start and they were amazing. Then on to some biscuits and gravy and chicken and waffles. Everything was good but the chicken was a little dry. It did not stop me from finishing my entire plate though. Everything was delicious but it was pricey. We left paying $53.00. Pretty expensive stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Amazing white chocolate frozen chai tea latte!!!
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy... Good dense biscuit could have used more gravy.
Photo of BLD Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles... Waffles were great chicken was a little dry.

sNozdJL82XClXpHZyd-crg.text: This is a fantastic place. The flavor is real. The combinations they work into their sandwiches and breakfasts are a delight to the palette. The atmosphere is modern and clean, and the people are pretty nice. Two words of advice:  1. Don't get the buffalo chicken wrap. It's average - maybe even below average. Everything else here is above average or awesome. If you really are in the mood for a buffalo chicken wrap, go elsewhere.  2. They usually aren't fast. If you're on your lunch break, and want to make it back in an hour, you might want to look elsewhere.  Not saying they can't do that, but when they get busy, they get slow.

eEgiGHD29YIovAMxK2b56A.text: First time here and had a really positive first impression. Staff was great, the food was awesome and reasonably priced. Good, strong coffee was hot and fresh. Testing the peach cobbler later.

qnjaX0sSQOlLj5dm3OssOg.text: I love BLD... LOVE it. I can't get enough of their breakfast foods - especially the Monte Cristo. Who wouldn't love yummy pieces of ham, slathered with raspberry preserved and sandwiched between two thick pieces of french toast. Yum! With potatoes on the side, too. Double yum.   I've been several times, for breakfast, lunch & dinner. Breakfast is served until 2pm or so, but after 3pm (ish) the menu changes to dinner only (which is my only complaint... I wish I could have breakfast any time of the day). Their lunch sandwiches have all been delicious and their happy hour menu is pretty darn good too.   There is a full bar for all of your booze needs & a wonderfully comfortable outdoor patio. One big highlight for me is that BLD has a dog-friendly patio. I can bring my pooch with me after a trip to the dog park (Paseo Vista dog park isn't too far from BLD). They always offer me a water bowl when she's with me & even sometimes have massive dog bones.   The staff have all been fantastic - friendly and knowledgeable. I look forward to going back each time!

YXZV98lhD5OU-lmZzzw3ZQ.text: I took my mom visiting from the east coast there the other night.  We were very pleased. The food is much better then your average canned franchise place. It's a little higher priced then the typical franchise but I believe they are serving you real food so it's worth it. The dessert menu looked amazing , will try next time. They also have gluten free options. My mom is picky and always orders salmon if its on a menu. They changed out the rice for mash potatoes. She said it was very good. I had the burger and fries. It was outstanding. The service was top notch. Very fun waitress.

eNjkloeSp030buFAMYkSdg.text: So sad. Went back for lunch and ordered the chicken and waffles and it was so mediocre...and sin of sins...the waffle is no longer bacon studded.  I've had other items on the menu and they were good but that dish was a star for me. I'm sadly disillusioned

ysY97I14Y5TzsGWb7bog8A.text: My family and I have been here for breakfast and lunch several times and love it!  Their outdoor patio is covered, dog friendly and you can sit at the bar outside as well.  Their food is American Contemporary in my opinion.  They have a great selection of breakfast and lunch items.  My person favorite are their breakfast potatoes.  They are crispy and not too oily.  If you are a Mexican food lover I highly recommend "The Other Burrito" for breakfast.  Super flavorful and it has a good kick!    The interior of the restaurant is simply modern, which I love.  It's always clean and even if the restaurant is busy you will get sat within 15-20 minutes usually.  Get a bloody mary while you wait!  :)

0MadOw0RFz-NwVZdt-sK3g.text: COCKROACHES!!!!  Ick Ick ick!!!  Do not know why I liked this place so much before. Check out the health ratings on this place. They have this complete cycle of bad reviews over and over and over. Won't ever go back!!!  BLD...well  It is best for breakfast!!!! Lunch is ok. I'd skip the dinner.   Fresh squeezed juice takes so long it is like they picked the oranges right from the trees. Should I still eat here?  Mmmm dogs, dog pee and flies...that sums up the patio. Wonder if they ever hose the place down. Oh the flies. But should I still eat here?  Eating inside...well all those flies come in too. But should I still eat here.   Food is very over priced....but it is so delicious. Should I still eat here?  Did I mention the cockroaches and the state health ratings? ICK, ICK, ICK!!!

2XU9cACfyVE4vuBTxwoZYw.text: We've eaten there twice and love it both times.  On a Sunday morning I had the eggs Benedict and it was the best I'd ever had.  I could not believe how good it was.  Then we had dinner there on a Friday and it was even better than breakfast.   I'm truly enjoying this oasis in the Chandler desert!  "Yummy!"

-WBHOfMOT508fDBKzV92VQ.text: Went in for brunch.  I give this restaurant a 5 star rating because of the food.    They have only been open for 2 weeks and are still working out some serving bugs as it took some time for our food to arrive.  But the server and staff were very cheerful and helpful.  Now for the food.  WOW!!  I ordered the hot pastrami with garlic fries and Kilt Lifter draft.  My son ordered the tuna sandwich with garlic fries.  I don't know where they got these recipes but for a $9 sandwich the pastrami was easily the best I've ever eaten.  The flavor just didn't quit and it was delightful from first tast to last.  The fries, just had this extra kick to them that made them a standout from ordinary fries.  The tuna sandwich is made from scratch.  No cans here.  They fry the fish and crumble the meat into a tuna spread.  Again, the flavor didn't quit and made for the most unique of meals.  Think of BLD as a restaurant with upscale food with a price tag that is more than fair.

nhW4h2cUNVnd4TuMLL0vjQ.text: Good breakfast. Dog friendly patio is awesome. We enjoyed the food after jogging with our golden in the morning.

m0ivgvN9gYTXKUE1e5TDCA.text: Yummy Yummy Breakfast. Ate here on Sunday. It was very busy but that's pretty average most places on a Sunday. Had the French toast and it was amazing. Our server was Ashley and she was great. Will have to come back and try dinner.

geyCI8UFZXeP8uivSTdkuw.text: Came for dinner. Enjoyed our meal on the patio since we brought the dogs. Very dog friendly restaurant and brought our dogs treats. Great meal - had the veggie pasta dish and husband had the ahi hummus appetizer. Mmmm. For dessert we had peanut butter mousse parfait minus the corn nuts. Not quite daring, I know. Still delish!

1cAto5NOk6bXS7oAM1bZVg.text: Let me start with the positive - the service was EXCEPTIONAL.  Very friendly and attentive.  The margarita on Happy Hour was very good and the prices were excellent.  Now, for the negative: the food and the atmosphere.  The atmosphere is horrid.  As other reviews have mentioned there are kids running around during Happy Hour (really?!) and it is very sterile and lacking in ambiance.  The food was mediocre at best.  Definitely won't be making a return trip which is too bad as the service was wonderful and I love Cork,

ywB2sYkDu_DQr1qylWbnkA.text: The BLD Iced Coffee is to die for! The sweetener they put in the coffee is just enough to give it something special. It is quite addicting. I was getting it daily on my way to work but since they changed their drive-thru hours to open an hour later (was 6am, now 7am), I can no longer brighten my morning with their coffee. Starbucks will have to do.

kJERn50pFAZE4j1ZeaMhzQ.text: So needless to say, my visit to BLD today was a bit underwhelming. I've heard a few friends talk about the food being hit or miss at times, and I've experienced it a time or two myself. I went in at around 1:30pm on a Wednesday. It was after the lunch rush and things were quiet. I think there were 2 ladies at the bar, and maybe 4 other two-tops seated in the restaurant. Our server was taking care of us and two other tables (both two-tops). It took her between 5-10 minutes to come over and greet us and take a drink order. I noticed the same situation going on for one of her other tables. When she came and took our food order she was nice and recommended the onion rings for a sandwich side because they are her favorite. Naturally, we took her advice.   Here's where I began noticing a trend in the service. It took a little over 15 minutes for our food to arrive. Now, I'm normally not a critique of time it takes for food to arrive, since I'm in the industry, however this was kind of sad. We ordered a burger (medium-rare) and I had the green chili pork sandwich. My sandwich I guarantee was cooked and just had to be assembled. The burger was mid-rare and should have taken 5-7 minutes to cook. I've seen them busier and cook food faster, there just seemed to be no sense of urgency. I noticed that the FOH manager also comp'd a two-top's French Onion Soup because he knew it took, "a lot longer than it should have." Not sure if they brought that to his attention or if he had noticed. Nothing happened with ours, and the server didn't really acknowledge an almost 20 minute was for two sandwiches. Like I said, I'm not one of those to get upset or critique because I am a part of the industry.   As for the food, I've been there a handful of times and some times it has been very good, other times it was alright, and this time was just alright. Again, the food was lacking seasoning. It was just bland. Even a pinch of salt would have made a world of difference, and I had mentioned it to them before.  Going there for breakfast, I had heard their eggs Benedict menu was great. I'm a fan of hollandaise sauce so I thought I'd check it out. I ordered the BLD Benedict, which is your classic eggs benny, with ham, egg and hollandaise on an English muffin. It was incredibly salty. I thought it might just be the ham, but as I kept eating it got even worse, and it was the hollandaise that was so terribly salty. We mentioned it to our server. She offered to get us something else, but we declined and just wanted to bring it to her attention. A few minutes later the manager came over and offered to get us something else, and told us that they had tasted the sauce and it was indeed way too salty. When our bill came, we noticed that they had comp'd our two eggs Benedict orders. We hadn't asked for that and I thought it was a nice gesture. The attitude of the manager was excellent and professional in handling the situation. However, this was kind of a "third strike and you're out" moment for the food at BLD. I think in my five times there I have really only enjoyed one of my meals enough to recommend to people as a definite, "YES, go there."   The food being just ok, and not stellar is sad but acceptable, especially since I have very high expectations because of Cork. Which, by the way, is probably my favorite restaurant in the East Valley and have the same partners. But overall, I just don't see myself running back to eat at BLD anytime soon. You better believe you can find me down the road at their other restaurant, Cork.

nbeW_F0y-OhmITLAZahhiA.text: Cute restaurant, average lunch.  I had the bleu cheese burger, and it was good.  Not outrageous, but good.  This is a good place to meet girlfriends and the girls I went with enjoyed their breakfasts.

aFJ0d-Ms99RmT3pdLJ_l9Q.text: We have been looking forward to trying BLD - finally had our chance this past weekend.  It was very busy and the staff seemed to be struggling with that. Our waitress started off a bit snappy/cocky and came across rude.  I wanted to substitute roasted red peppers on a salad for avocado and she lectured me that it wasn't a fair trade. I should have asked to substitute the chicken on the salad instead - it was overcooked, dry and tasted terrible. My daughter wanted an egg burrito with cheese and ham - that seemed to be an issue - our waitress painted the chef on duty into a real jerk (not sure if he was, but that was the impression she gave).... her burrito was a "special order" and she would have to see if he would make it... really?  Our waitress "frienlied" up after a while and the food ended up being decent (minus my chicken)... I may give it another try, but am really not in any big rush!

NjzsKMhp8MtK6qOTtwOLhw.text: Service was fine. Ordered the dinner special pancetta chicken meat balls. Came with penne pasta with spinach tomatoes and onions in a lemon cream sauce. Very good but the 3 meat balls were tough and dry without much flavor. Did not detect any pancetta. Sorry to say was very disappointed with this dish. Not sure I will return here.

OWFyKzCjutZ0onAF2w7IPw.text: BLD was a tough one for me to rate. I liked the environment and the overall feel of the place. However, I felt the food was overpriced for the portions. The food was bland and overly marinated with condiments. Maybe I was expecting too much from the previous reviews but the food just didn't meet my expectations. The service was a 5. Great service, very personable waiters, and seemed to be a very attentive staff in general. I will give this place a 2nd chance just in case I had a fluke bad experience.

6Wy1RQV049-ZA9bkucCUlQ.text: Love the clean, contemporary design of BLD...and the food has always been great.   Happy hour food specials are a nice amount of food for the price, and the outside patio is private and fun.  They also have happy hour drink specials! Nice Bar area which opens up to the patio...and I'm told that the patio accepts dogs. (Haven't brought mine yet.)  Friendly place, with some great prices and interesting, creative entrees.  Guys, there is a TV every 20 feet so it is a great game destination. They even have cooking classes! Will continue to go back... looking forward to trying some of their special events.

MihGj1ie7DVR0Y8b7L2Lkw.text: I ate at BLD tonight, which was the first time in awhile to eat there and I know it's going to be a long while until I eat there again! The WORSE service I have ever had!!!!!!!! Not only was the table I was at getting bad service I noticed the four other tables in the restaurant were getting just as neglected. Our waitress seemed too busy making herself a cappuccino and leaning against the bar to talk to the bar guest than it was to refill myself and guests drink for 45 minutes. We had empty drinks throughout the whole dinner up until we left because she would not refill them. She never came by to quality check the food either or even just a walk by. I heard another table complaining about the service as well. She concluded the dinner by slamming the check down on the table and continue walking. There was no manager in sight for us to talk to. Overall, it was the worse dining experience ever. The food is good but that does not outweigh the horrible service. I recommend going somewhere else with the whole package.

sLbnopF33T0XBX1l3-2bSg.text: My son and I dropped in today after he had an eye exam in Chandler. I had read in my Phoenix magazine that BLD was one of the best breakfast places around. Since we were only about ten minutes from there, I decided to give it a try. What a fantastic find. Even though it was lunch time, we were seated immediately...a nice table in the back and away from the front door. Within a minute there was a nice young man who took our drink order (nothing alcoholic but that is available). My son ordered the fried chicken and waffles and I ordered the Monte Christo sandwich. I think it was less than five minutes before two mouth-watering plates of food were placed on the table before us. The fried chicken on my son's plate looked like two nicely battered chicken tenders. He was really thrilled that bacon was in his waffles. From the first bite to the last, he was nothing but smiles and praise for the food.  My Monte Christo instead of being deep-fat fried was French Toast with a delicious vanilla-imposed taste, piled high with shaved ham, raspberry jam, and topped with powdered sugar. There was a warm compote of maple syrup on the side. Also on the plate were fabulously good fried potatoes with onion. They were finely crisped and really hit the spot. They also came with a small container of ketchup.   Both entrees with two soft drinks came out to around $30 which might seem a bit steep for lunch in Chandler, but believe me, it was worth every bite.   Being that we live in Maricopa, which is restaurant starved, we will definitely make BLD one of our regular places to go. It's not a bad drive from Maricopa and for anyone in the East Valley, it's on the northeast corner of Germann and Power...close to everything.  WTG...BLD!

cPBG8nT8hKigwe38mA1QfQ.text: I came in New Years and it was a ok place to eat , the girl who sat us didn't seem happy at all , I'm sure her name was Ashely. The food was also ok could have been better . I was very sad about this place. Was hoping for better service , the bussers were very good

cXZ673AMDBoFfGhT-q2yCQ.text: Breakfast is the way to go here! The "Hatch Hash" is a must! We weren't too impressed with their lunch. Dinner was ok. Their house made sangria is pretty good and reasonably priced for happy hour.

FLm1t6svumA5EFD36yuDVQ.text: Our car broke down nearby and we decided to stop in for breakfast while we waited for a tow truck. Our server, Catherine, found out and immediately greeted us and engaged us in discussion about it. She was so thoughtful and empathetic and helpful! We were pleasantly surprised by the great food and coffee and atmosphere! We will definitely be returning and are so glad we stumbled across this place! They also had wifi for my husband to continue working while we waited!

X6sb0_KfW8rzQDXlsfKiig.text: My first visit for BLD! Horrible overall service. I ordered a drink it came out wrong it was remade one of the main ingredients was not in it. Ordered my meal chicken and waffles it was "ok". The menu had beacon that came with it I'm not a pork eater so I requested turkey sausage instead. When meal came out they had forgot to bring me my eggs they asked if I wanted butter and syrup, replied "yes" 5 mins later I had to ask for butter and syrup. When the check came to my surprise there was an up charge for the turkey sausage. I called the manager over and explained everything she paused so I explained I would like her to provide us customer service she snatched the check and my credit card and took the charged for the sausage off the check. She had the waiter bring me the check and apologize for her horrible service with was tactless in my opinion.  Not to mention the flys that are swarming the restaurant as you are eating .

pnyXvH52XVLVwUI8BIX0iQ.text: I was so hopeful we found a new place that we could frequent...but our hopes were soon stomped on by over priced bland food.  I will say their caprese salad was good.   My husband had the baked goat cheese that came out 8 minutes after my salad & was burned...as soon as the server dropped off his appetizer she said that our dinners were up & asked if she should just bring them out.  We asked that she wait so he could eat his appetizer, a few minutes later our dinner was on the table & we were not even half done with our first course.    He ordered the meatloaf & was unimpressed and thought it was pre-made from sysco, his green beans were nuked to death and were the texture of old shoe leather.  I ordered the Mac & cheese. I figured the $8  price tag would yield a high end very good dish.  Well, kraft deluxe is not the worst thing, but I did not expect that from a restaurant.  Masteros & Flemings serve theirs for $5 and are both very good Mac & cheese dishes.  Basically I felt a little robbed by the entire meal. Total for the meal was $76.00 which included a $34 bottle of wine.  We are sad to say that we won't be back unless we hear things have improved.  The design of the restaurant was wonderful...but they need to figure out their food & service or it will be just more empty commercial space in the valley.
